original: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa 'gag / des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa 'gag / des cir 'gyur /
translated: And what is the consequence of that?

original: gnas skabs de yis gnas pa ni //
analyzed: gnas skabs de yis gnas pa ni //
translated: The endurance of that which endures

original: de yis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: does not cease due to that.

original: gnas skabs gang gis sngar nye bar mtshon pa'i gnas skabs des ni 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang gis sngar nye bar mtshon pa'i gnas skabs des ni 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The endurance of that which endures does not cease due to that.

original: sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na 'o ma 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na 'o ma 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid kyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Because the previous essence is not relinquished, just as milk does not cease due to the state of milk itself.

original: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gyis gnas pa yang //
translated: The endurance of that which endures

original: gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: does not cease due to another.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù has the meaning of restriction.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar blta'i /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar blta'i /
translated: Here, it should be seen that it does not cease due to another.

original: gzhan du na gzhan ma yin pas 'gag go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan ma yin pas 'gag go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it ceases due to something that is not another.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: That is the thesis.

original: gzhan nyid kyi chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: The reason for otherness is otherness.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'o ma ni zho'i gnas skabs kyis 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'o ma ni zho'i gnas skabs kyis 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the inference is: Ultimately, milk does not cease due to the state of yogurt.

original: de las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i bru ba la sogs pa bzhin no /
analyzed: de las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i bru ba la sogs pa bzhin no /
translated: Because it is different from that, like, for example, a pot that is different from that.

original: phyir rgol ba pa dag na re /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba pa dag na re /
translated: Opponents might say:

original: 'gag pa ni yod pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gag pa ni yod pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Cessation definitely exists.

original: dngos po la brten pa'i phyir dper na tshos pa bzhin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: dngos po la brten pa'i phyir dper na tshos pa bzhin no zhes zer na /
translated: Because it is based on things, like, for example, cooking.

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gang tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi /
analyzed: gang tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi /
translated: When the arising of all phenomena

original: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ba /
translated: Is not tenable,

original: de tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: Then the cessation of all phenomena

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro /üîΩgang gi tshe ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi skye ba mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro / gang gi tshe ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi skye ba mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /
translated: Is not tenable.

original: 'gag pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: When, in accordance with the mode of explanation, the arising of all phenomena is not tenable, then cessation is also not tenable.

original: tshos par bya ba dang / tshos pa ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: tshos par bya ba dang / tshos pa ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because the object of cooking and cooking itself are not established, there is no example.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la 'gag pa ni dngos po yod pa'am med pa la brtag @111a * //
analyzed: 'di la 'gag pa ni dngos po yod pa'am med pa la brtag @111a * //
translated: Here, cessation should be investigated with respect to whether it is a thing or a nonthing.

original: grang na / de la /üîΩre zhig dngos po yod pa la //
analyzed: grang na / de la / re zhig dngos po yod pa la //
translated: If you say:

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: First, cessation is not tenableüîΩWith respect to an existent thing.

original: mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me dang grang ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩde'i phyir / dngos dang dngos po med pa dag / gcig nyid na ni 'thad pa med //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me dang grang ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so // de'i phyir / dngos dang dngos po med pa dag / gcig nyid na ni 'thad pa med //
translated: Because they are incompatible, like fire and cold.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.üîΩTherefore, it is said:üîΩIt is not tenable that a thing

original: ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smras so //
translated: And a nonthing are the same.

original: ci ste yang /üîΩdngos por gyur nas de nyid bral ba na /
analyzed: ci ste yang / dngos por gyur nas de nyid bral ba na /
translated: If you say:

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya'o snyam na /
translated: Having become a thing, it is called a nonthing.

original: 'o na ni de nyid kyis don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /üîΩdngos por gyur nas dngos po med par gyur pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces gsal bar bstan te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de nyid kyis don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te / dngos por gyur nas dngos po med par gyur pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces gsal bar bstan te /
translated: Then, by that very fact, ultimately external and internal things are essenceless.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because having become a thing, it becomes a nonthing, it is clearly taught that it is essenceless, like an illusion and so on.

original: ci ste dngos po med pa la rtog ste /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po med pa la rtog ste /
translated: If you say: A nonthing is imagined.

original: 'di ltar kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: The cognition of form has an object that is not different from itself,

original: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong na de'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when that is seen, the cognition of that arises.

original: 'di na gang mthong na gang gi blo skye ba de ni de'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang mthong na gang gi blo skye ba de ni de'i yul can yin te /
translated: Here, when something is seen, the cognition of that has that as its object,

original: dper na rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i lkog shal la sogs pa mthong na ba lang gi blo skye ba bzhin no //
translated: for example, when the dewlap and so on that are not different from the self of a cow is seen, the cognition of a cow arises.

original: de bzhin du ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i gzugs mthong na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ro la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan med pa'i gzugs mthong na /
translated: Similarly, when form that is not different from the self of taste and so on is seen,

original: gzugs kyi blo skye bas de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo skye bas de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo ni bdag nyid las gzhan med pa'i yul can yin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: the cognition of form arises. Therefore the cognition of form has an object that is not different from itself.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical,

original: de nyid kyi gtan tshigs de ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi gtan tshigs de ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason itself is unestablished and the example is flawed because the property to be proven is incomplete.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: dngos po med par gyur pa la'ang //
analyzed: dngos po med par gyur pa la'ang //
translated: Also, cessation is untenable

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For that which has become nonexistent.

original: med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: mgo gnyis pa la ji ltar ni //
analyzed: mgo gnyis pa la ji ltar ni //
translated: Just as a second head cannot be cut off,

original: gcad du med pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: gcad du med pa de bzhin no //
translated: So too it cannot be cut off.

original: 'dis ni med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa la 'gag pa yod par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan to //
translated: This shows that because nonexistence is inferred, the error of the repudiation of the intrinsic reality of the subject occurs for those who maintain that cessation exists for that which is nonexistent, because of the nonexistence of cessation.

original: yang gzhan yang /üîΩkhyed cag 'gag pa'i 'gag pa zhes smra ba de don dam par yod na rang gi bdag nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / khyed cag 'gag pa'i 'gag pa zhes smra ba de don dam par yod na rang gi bdag nyid kyis sam /
translated: Moreover,

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur grang na /üîΩde la / 'gag pa 'gag pa gzhan dang ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur grang na / de la / 'gag pa 'gag pa gzhan dang ni //
translated: if that which you call ‚Äúthe cessation of cessation‚Äù existed ultimately, it would cease either by its own intrinsic nature or by the intrinsic nature of another.üîΩIn that regard,üîΩThe cessation of cessationüîΩDoes not make sense

original: de nyid kyis kyang 'gag mi rigs /
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang 'gag mi rigs /
translated: Either by itself or by another.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩji @111b ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / ji @111b ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
translated: How so?üîΩJust as arising is not generated

original: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin bzhin //
translated: By itself or by another.

original: ji ltar skye ba rang nyid kyis skyed bar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba rang nyid kyis skyed bar mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it that it is not tenable that arising itself gives rise to itself?

original: ji skad du /üîΩskye ba 'di ni ma skyes bas //
analyzed: ji skad du / skye ba 'di ni ma skyes bas //
translated: As it is said:üîΩHow could this arising, not having arisen,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed //üîΩci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed // ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
translated: Give rise to itself?üîΩIf it is arisen that which is arisen gives rise to it,

original: skyes pa ji zhig bskyed du yod //üîΩces smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa ji zhig bskyed du yod // ces smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is there to arise?

original: ji ltar skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed bar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed bar mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it that it is not tenable that another arising gives rise to it?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another arising gives rise to it,

original: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: There will be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
translated: If it arises without arising,

original: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur // zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Everything will arise in that way.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang /üîΩ'gag pa 'di ni ma 'gags pas //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang / 'gag pa 'di ni ma 'gags pas //
translated: In the same way, here also:üîΩHow could this ceasing, not having ceased,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar 'gag / ci ste 'gags pas 'gag byed na //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar 'gag / ci ste 'gags pas 'gag byed na //
translated: Cease itself? If it is ceased that which is ceased ceases it,

original: 'gag na ci zhig 'gag tu yod //
analyzed: 'gag na ci zhig 'gag tu yod //
translated: What is there to cease?

original: ces bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas /
analyzed: ces bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas /
translated: This is the commentary on the first chapter, having eight verses, calledüîΩ‚Äúthe examination of conditions.‚Äù

original: skye ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'gag pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis skyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'gag pa dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of cessation ceasing through its own nature should be stated in the same way as the refutation of arising arising through its own nature.

original: gal te 'gag pa gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te 'gag pa gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another ceased it,

original: de 'gag thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'gag thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste 'gag pa med 'gag na //
analyzed: ci ste 'gag pa med 'gag na //
translated: If it ceased without another ceasing it,

original: thams cad de bzhin 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: everything would cease in that way.

original: zhes bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'dir yang skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa gzhan gyis dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'dir yang skye ba gzhan gyis bskyed pa dgag pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'gag pa gzhan gyis dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of cessation through another should be stated in the same way as the refutation of arising through another.

original: gang dag 'jig pa can rnams ni 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig go zhes zer ba de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig pa can rnams ni 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig go zhes zer ba de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Those who say that things that are destroyed are destroyed by a cause of destruction should be addressed as follows:

original: gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par shes pa de ni /
translated: That which is ascertained to be the cause of the destruction of something

original: de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: is not the cause of its destruction,

original: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is different from it.

original: dper na de las gzhan dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like other things.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sgrub pa rgyas par ji skad du bstan pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sgrub pa rgyas par ji skad du bstan pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in this way, through the extensive presentation of the proof,

original: rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid dang med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i dang por pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid dang med pa nyid yin la /
translated: in the first chapter, the reason and example stated by the opponent are, in terms of the ultimate, not established and nonexistent.

original: kun rdzob tu gtan tshigs dang / dpe dag brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gtan tshigs dang / dpe dag brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the reason and example are stated in terms of the conventional, they are contradictory.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyi 'bras bu'i dbang gis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyi 'bras bu'i dbang gis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude through the power of the result of the mode of explanation,üîΩit is said:

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa @112a * //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa @112a * //
translated: Since arising, enduring, and ceasing

original: dag / ma grub phyir na 'dus byas med //
analyzed: dag / ma grub phyir na 'dus byas med //
translated: are not established, conditioned phenomena do not exist.

original: de la pha rol pos don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la pha rol pos don dam par 'dus byas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag la 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yod pa kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the opponent may say, ‚ÄúIn terms of the ultimate, the entities of conditioned phenomena, such as the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres, should definitely be apprehended as existing.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ma grub po //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ma grub po //
translated: But that is not established.

original: gang dag don dam par ba lang la sogs pa 'dus byas dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang dag don dam par ba lang la sogs pa 'dus byas dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Those who say that ultimately such things as cows exist as conditioned phenomena,üîΩbecause their characteristics such as a dewlap exist, should be asked:

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la yang de bzhin du ji lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin nam /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la yang de bzhin du ji lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin nam /
translated: Are those characteristics such as a dewlap endowed with characteristics or

original: 'on te mtshan nyid med cing dpe med pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya'o //üîΩde la gal te de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni de lta na lkog shal la sogs pa de dag ba lang gi ba lang nyid dam /
analyzed: 'on te mtshan nyid med cing dpe med pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya'o // de la gal te de dag mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni de lta na lkog shal la sogs pa de dag ba lang gi ba lang nyid dam /
translated: are they without characteristics and without example?

original: 'dus byas nyid mtshon par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid mtshon par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If they are endowed with characteristics, then in that case those such as a dewlap do not indicate cowhood or conditionedness,

original: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rjes bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rjes bzhin no //
translated: because they are endowed with characteristics, just like the footmarks of a cow.

original: ci ste de dag mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir de dag rang nyid mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: ci ste de dag mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir de dag rang nyid mi 'grub pas /
translated: But if they are without characteristics, they are not established by themselves because they are without characteristics.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshon par mi nus so zhes snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshon par mi nus so zhes snga ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, their basis, the characterized, cannot be indicated.

original: de dag la mtshan nyid gzhan dag yod na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag la mtshan nyid gzhan dag yod na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If they have other characteristics, then there is the fault of infinite regress.üîΩBut if they do not have other characteristics, then there is the fault that the basis, the characterized, is not established.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan med na ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang thal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan med na ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang thal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And so on.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: don dam par 'dus byas ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par 'dus byas ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that conditioned phenomena definitely exist ultimately,

original: gnyen po dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have an antidote.

original: 'di na gang med par shes pa de ni gnyen po dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med par shes pa de ni gnyen po dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which is known to be nonexistent does not have an antidote,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: 'dus byas la ni gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus /
analyzed: 'dus byas la ni gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus /
translated: Since the unconditioned exists as the antidote to conditioned phenomena, therefore, by the power of the reason stated above,

original: don dam par 'dus byas yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste ;
analyzed: don dam par 'dus byas yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste ;
translated: you should understand that conditioned phenomena definitely exist ultimately.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa dag la 'gal ba 'khrul ba med pa'i gnod pa yod cing phung po la sogs pa dag kyang 'grub bo zhes zer ro /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa dag la 'gal ba 'khrul ba med pa'i gnod pa yod cing phung po la sogs pa dag kyang 'grub bo zhes zer ro /
translated: Thus, since there is no error of contradiction in the previously stated inferences, and since the aggregates and so on are established, they say that there is no fault.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la 'dus byas rab tu grub na ni de bsal bas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba rdzas cung zhig yod par brjod du @112b yang rung grang na /üîΩ'dus byas de btags na yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la 'dus byas rab tu grub na ni de bsal bas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba rdzas cung zhig yod par brjod du @112b yang rung grang na / 'dus byas de btags na yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: If conditioned phenomena were established, then it would be possible to say that the so-called unconditioned exists as a thing, since it is the negation of that.üîΩBut since that conditioned phenomenon imputed by you does not exist,

original: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
analyzed: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
translated: then conditioned phenomena are not established.

original: 'dus ma byas ni ji ltar 'grub /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ji ltar 'grub /
translated: How could the unconditioned be established?

original: tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du ma skyes pas rdzas nyid du ma grags so zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du ma skyes pas rdzas nyid du ma grags so zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: Since it is not produced even conventionally, like the horn of a rabbit, it is not renowned as a substance.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, those reasons and so on are impossible.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid ma yin par ston na de ltar na de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bsal ba rjes su bsgrubs pas phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gal te don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid ma yin par ston na de ltar na de dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bsal ba rjes su bsgrubs pas phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro ;
translated: ‚ÄúIf you demonstrate that arising and so on are not characteristics ultimately, then in that case, since you refute the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, you commit the error that the basis of the thesis, the reason, the example, and so on are not established.

original: /'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: /'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, we say:

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin yang tha snyad du /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin yang tha snyad du /
translated: Although they do not exist ultimately,

original: rmi lam ji bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: rmi lam ji bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: like a dream, like an illusion,

original: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
translated: like a city of gandharvas,üîΩwe accept that they exist conventionally.

original: yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Therefore there is no error.

original: ji ltar rmi lam rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang ; lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyu can yul 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang /üîΩtha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba dang ji ltar sgyu ma sgyu ma mkhan dang gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthu khyad par can las glang po che dang / khyu mchog dang / bud med dang /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam rnam par brtags pa nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang ; lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyu can yul 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa nye bar dmigs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa brtags na ngo bo nyid med kyang / tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid kyis yul nyid du 'gyur ba dang ji ltar sgyu ma sgyu ma mkhan dang gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthu khyad par can las glang po che dang / khyu mchog dang / bud med dang /
translated: Just as in a dream, the memory of the experience of the examination of the dream, the result of the contact with the desired or undesired objects that are the results of the causes of Dharma, non-Dharma, and the blessings of Devadatta, is imputed, although it is essenceless.

original: gnas la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ba dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag ngo bo nyid med kyang /
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ba dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag ngo bo nyid med kyang /
translated: Just as in a magical illusion, the objects that are the causes of the cognition of existence and so on, such as the elephant, the bull, the woman, the house, and so on, which arise from the power of the special mantra and medicine of the magician, and which are the objects of the senses, are essenceless.

original: shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod pa dang / ji ltar dri za'i grod khyer 'obs rgya chen po dang / sgo dang sgo khang dang / yang thog dkar po dga' ba 'tsher bag can dang / khyams zla ba can dang /
analyzed: shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod pa dang / ji ltar dri za'i grod khyer 'obs rgya chen po dang / sgo dang sgo khang dang / yang thog dkar po dga' ba 'tsher bag can dang / khyams zla ba can dang /
translated: Because it is the cause of the error of consciousness, it is said to exist.üîΩJust as the city of the gandharvas is the cause of the arising of the idea of a city with a wide moat, gates, gatehouses, white and delightful upper stories, a moonlike courtyard,

original: skar khung dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dang ldan pa'i grong khyer gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa /
analyzed: skar khung dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dang ldan pa'i grong khyer gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa /
translated: windows, and multistoried buildings,

original: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas /
translated: so too is arising, so too is enduring,

original: de bzhin du ni 'jigs gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni 'jigs gsungs //
translated: so too is destruction declared.

original: drang srong de kho na nyid mthong ba'i mig yang dag par bye ba rnams la 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: drang srong de kho na nyid mthong ba'i mig yang dag par bye ba rnams la 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
translated: The cause of the arising of the idea of the arising, etc., of produced things is declared to be the eye of the ·πõ·π£i who sees reality.

original: mi shes pa blo gros kyi mig zum pa rnams ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams skye'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa blo gros kyi mig zum pa rnams ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams skye'o //
translated: Those whose eyes of intelligence are closed by ignorance think that things arise like dreams, etc.

original: gnas so // 'gag go zhes yang dag pa'i don gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed do //üîΩde'i phyir de @113a * //
analyzed: gnas so // 'gag go zhes yang dag pa'i don gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed do // de'i phyir de @113a * //
translated: and it ceases.

original: ltar mkhas pa dang mkhas pa ma yin pa dag gi tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon med do //üîΩ'di la kha cig na re /
analyzed: ltar mkhas pa dang mkhas pa ma yin pa dag gi tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i gzhi la sogs pa ma grub pa'i skyon med do // 'di la kha cig na re /
translated: Thus, the wise and the unwise accept arising, etc., as existing by the power of conventional expressions. Therefore, there is no fault of the non-establishment of the position, the reason, the example, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa gsum po dag bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum bstan to zhes zer ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re pha rol pos skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa gsum po dag bstan pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa dpe gsum bstan to zhes zer ro // gzhan dag na re pha rol pos skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, some say that the three examples of dreams, etc., are taught in order to demonstrate the three other kinds of discriminations that are the causes of the engagement of the afflictions.

original: mngon sum gyi blo'i bzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dang / rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo'i bzung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po yod pa'i phyir dang / rgyud tha mi dad pas 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Others say that arising, etc., do exist because they are apprehended by the mind of direct perception, because the agent exists, and because they are apprehended by a continuum that is not different.

original: gzugs bzhin no zhes smras pa de dag ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs bzhin no zhes smras pa de dag ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The response that it is like form is shown to be uncertain.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe gsum po dag go rims bzhin du gsungs te /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe gsum po dag go rims bzhin du gsungs te /
translated: The three examples of dreams and so on are stated respectively to show that the above statements are uncertain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyan thos kyi theg pa la bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyan thos kyi theg pa la bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir /
translated: The Lord has also said in the Sravakayana that although the self and entities connected to the self are devoid of intrinsic existence, they appear to be so.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por /
translated: In order to remedy the obscuration of affliction,üîΩthe Lord, who sees reality, has said:

original: gzugs ni dbu rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a lump of clay,

original: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
translated: feeling is like a water bubble,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
translated: perception is like a flickering mirage,

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin /
translated: formations are like a plantain tree,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //üîΩde nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to //üîΩzhes gsungs la /
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes // de nyid gzigs pas bka' stsal to // zhes gsungs la /
translated: and consciousness is like an illusion.

original: theg pa chen po la yang 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang de ltar snang zhing de ltar bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang de ltar snang zhing de ltar bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por //
translated: And in the Mahayana, in order to remedy the obscuration of the knowable, he has said that although compounded phenomena are devoid of intrinsic existence, they appear to be so and are taught to be so.

original: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur //
analyzed: skar ma rab rib mar me dang // sgyu ma zil pa chu bur dang // rmi lam glog dang sprin lta bur //
translated: like dreams, like lightning, and like clouds,

original: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
analyzed: 'dus byas de ltar blta bar bya //
translated: so should the conditioned be seen.

original: zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir 'di la skrag pa'i gnas med de /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir 'di la skrag pa'i gnas med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no basis for fear here.

original: blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags nas bzod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags nas bzod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The wise should examine this and develop patience.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams bdag med pa dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams bdag med pa dper na /
translated: The Lord has taught that conditioned things are selfless, like

original: sgyu ma dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / dbu ba rdos pa dang / chu'i chu bur dang / chu shing gi phung po dag bstan te /üîΩ'di la de bzhin nyid dam /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / dbu ba rdos pa dang / chu'i chu bur dang / chu shing gi phung po dag bstan te / 'di la de bzhin nyid dam /
translated: an illusion, an echo, a reflection, a mirage, a dream, a mass of foam, a bubble, a plantain tree, and a magical creation.üîΩHere, there is no suchness

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
translated: or unmistaken suchness at all.

original: 'di dag ni spros pa yang yin /
analyzed: 'di dag ni spros pa yang yin /
translated: These are elaborations

original: 'di dag ni brdzun @113b pa yang yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni brdzun @113b pa yang yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: and these are lies.

original: chos thams cad bdag med do zhes gsungs pa la bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don te /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med do zhes gsungs pa la bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúAll phenomena are selfless‚Äù means that they are essenceless.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid kyi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid kyi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúself‚Äù is a term for essence.

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re de la 'dir bdag tu snang ba ni nor ba'i de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang bdag ces bya ba'i sgra yang bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir de dag la bdag gzhan yang med la /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re de la 'dir bdag tu snang ba ni nor ba'i de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dang bdag ces bya ba'i sgra yang bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir de dag la bdag gzhan yang med la /
translated: Others say: The appearance of self in this context is the error of suchness, and the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is a term for essence. Therefore, they are selfless, but they are not self.

original: rang nyid kyang bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyang bdag ma yin te /
translated: They are not self because they are not independent, like a lord.

original: dbang phyug ma yin pa bzhin pas khungs des ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la gang zag gi bdag med pa'i sgra'i don bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: dbang phyug ma yin pa bzhin pas khungs des ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la gang zag gi bdag med pa'i sgra'i don bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, that passage cannot teach the selflessness of phenomena because it is to be specifically interpreted as the meaning of the term selflessness of persons in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: nus par gyur na ni theg pa gzhan yongs su bzung ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nus par gyur na ni theg pa gzhan yongs su bzung ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If it could, then it would be pointless to uphold other vehicles.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas 'dus byas rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows: In the first chapter, the opponent‚Äôs statement of the proof is criticized, and thus it is shown that compounded phenomena are essenceless.

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor ji tsam du 'dus byas yin pa de tsam du brdzun no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang 'dus byas la mi spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas la mi spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor ji tsam du 'dus byas yin pa de tsam du brdzun no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang 'dus byas la mi spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas la mi spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, to the extent that something is compounded, it is false, and similarly, one who does not engage with the compounded and does not engage with the uncompounded is one who engages in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ste /üîΩde bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni 'dus byas kyang med /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ste / de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de la ni 'dus byas kyang med /
translated: And similarly, all phenomena abide in suchness.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang med do //üîΩgang la 'dus byas kyang med /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang med do // gang la 'dus byas kyang med /
translated: In suchness, there is no compounded and there is no uncompounded.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang med pa de la ni gnyis su 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang med pa de la ni gnyis su 'jug pa med do //
translated: Where there is no compounded and no uncompounded, there is no engagement with duality.

original: gang la gnyis su 'jug pa med pa de la ni de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tha dad du bya ba ci yod /
analyzed: gang la gnyis su 'jug pa med pa de la ni de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tha dad du bya ba ci yod /
translated: And similarly, BrahmƒÅ, what is the difference between conditioned and unconditioned phenomena?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tha snyad tsam tha dad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tha snyad tsam tha dad par bya ba yin te /
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, the difference between conditioned and unconditioned phenomena is merely a conventional one.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs 'di 'dzin pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs 'di 'dzin pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Bodhisattvas who uphold this dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ do not conceptualize conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.üîΩThey do not objectify them.‚Äù

original: dmigs par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes @114a * //
analyzed: dmigs par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes @114a * //
translated: And similarly, Subh≈´ti, form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness

original: pa ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: pa ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: are neither conditioned nor unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness

original: skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin /
translated: are not characterized by arising,

original: 'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin no //
translated: and are not characterized by ceasing.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba'i chos can yang ma yin /
translated: Form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not characterized by arising,

original: 'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos can yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and are not characterized by ceasing. That is the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas med de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas med de /
translated: Apart from conceptualization, there is no conditioned nor unconditioned.

original: byis pa rmongs pa rnams ni mo gsham gyi rmi lam na bu mthong ba bzhin du /
analyzed: byis pa rmongs pa rnams ni mo gsham gyi rmi lam na bu mthong ba bzhin du /
translated: Fools, like those who are confused in a dream by seeing a son of a barren woman,üîΩgrasp at the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: This and so on is established.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The master BhƒÅviveka‚Äôs application.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: In the Lamp for Wisdom, a commentary on the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way,

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bdun pa'o /
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventh chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Arising, Enduring, and Ceasing.

original: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa brgyad pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in order to teach that the aggregates and so forth are essenceless, the eighth chapter is begun with the refutation of the specific objections to emptiness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: don dam par phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The aggregates, constituents, and sources do exist ultimately,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the BhagavƒÅn, in dependence upon them, taught the agent and action.

original: 'di na gang med pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la brten nas byed pa po dang las ma bstan te /
translated: For, the BhagavƒÅn does not teach the agent and action in dependence upon that which does not exist.

original: dper na bong bu dang rnga mo'i rva dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bong bu dang rnga mo'i rva dag bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the tail of a donkey or a camel.

original: phung po la sogs pa dag la ni /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag la ni /
translated: But the aggregates and so forth

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa 'di yod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan pa 'di yod de /
translated: The Bhagav√•n taught the agent and action in dependence on them.

original: legs par spyad pa'i chos spyad bya //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i chos spyad bya //
translated: One should practice the Dharma of good conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa de mi spyad //üîΩchos spyod 'jig rten 'di dang ni //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa de mi spyad // chos spyod 'jig rten 'di dang ni //
translated: One should not practice bad conduct.üîΩOne who practices the Dharma dwells happily

original: pha rol du yang bde bar gnas //
analyzed: pha rol du yang bde bar gnas //
translated: in this world and the next.

original: zhes byed pa po dang las kyang bstan to //
analyzed: zhes byed pa po dang las kyang bstan to //
translated: Thus he taught the agent and action.

original: de la chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de la chos mngon pa las /
translated: In the Abhidharma it says:

original: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Action is threefold by the classification of virtue, nonvirtue, and neutral.

original: de la dge ba yang ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan par @114b kun nas bslang ba dang / don dam pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba yang ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan par @114b kun nas bslang ba dang / don dam pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Among them, virtue is fourfold by the classification of essence, concomitance, motivation, and ultimate.

original: mi dge ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: Nonvirtue is also like that.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa las byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa las byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the reason stated,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin no //üîΩde la 'dir gal te don dam par de dag la brten nas /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag yod pa kho na yin no // de la 'dir gal te don dam par de dag la brten nas /
translated: aggregates, elements, and sense bases definitely exist ultimately.

original: byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dod na ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dod na ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Here, if you assert the reason, ‚Äúbecause the agent and action are taught in dependence on them,‚Äù it is not established.

original: 'on te dbyug pas ma bzlog pa'i phyir tha snyad du 'dod na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dbyug pas ma bzlog pa'i phyir tha snyad du 'dod na ni don 'gal ba nyid dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: If you assert it conventionally because it is not refuted by a stick, then it is contradictory and it is an establishment of what is already established.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan to zhes byar yang dpe med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par de dag la brten nas byed pa po dang las bstan to zhes byar yang dpe med de /
translated: There is no example of the statement, ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn taught the agent and action in dependence on them ultimately.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately, things do not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de dag mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de dag mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in this way, they are untenable, and so you should investigate them in this way.

original: 'di la byed pa po de yang yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la byed pa po de yang yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: In this regard, does the agent perform the action having become or

original: ma yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ma yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: not having become orüîΩhaving both become and not become?

original: yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa zhig las byed par 'gyur zhing las kyang yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa zhig las byed par 'gyur zhing las kyang yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: And does the action to be performed become or

original: ma yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ma yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: not become or

original: yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa zhig byed pa po'i bya bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa zhig byed pa po'i bya bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: having both become and not become the action of the agent?

original: de dag rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩbyed po yin par gyur pa de //
analyzed: de dag rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa / byed po yin par gyur pa de //
translated: Since all of these are completely untenable, therefore it is said:üîΩThe existent agent

original: las su gyur pa mi byed do //
analyzed: las su gyur pa mi byed do //
translated: Does not perform the existent action.

original: 'di ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //üîΩde la byed pa po yin par gyur ba ni bya ba dang ldan pa'o //üîΩlas yin par gyur ba yang bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o // de la byed pa po yin par gyur ba ni bya ba dang ldan pa'o // las yin par gyur ba yang bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the thesis.üîΩIn this regard, the existent agent is one who possesses activity.

original: byed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
analyzed: byed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
translated: The existent action is also one that possesses activity.üîΩThe nonexistent agent

original: las su ma gyur mi byed do //
analyzed: las su ma gyur mi byed do //
translated: He does not perform an action that is not an action.

original: 'di yang dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of a thesis.

original: de la yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa ni de las bzlog go //
analyzed: de la yang byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa dang / las ma yin par gyur pa ni de las bzlog go //
translated: In this regard, one who is not an agent and an action that is not an action are the opposite of that.

original: byed pa po zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: What is called an ‚Äúagent‚Äù is one who performs an action.

original: las zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: What is called an ‚Äúaction‚Äù is that which is performed.

original: mi byed do zhes bya ba ni bya ba mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi byed do zhes bya ba ni bya ba mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not perform‚Äù means he does not perform an action.

original: de la re zhig dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa snga ma sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa snga ma sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In this regard, in order to prove the previously stated thesis, he says:

original: yin par gyur la bya ba med //üîΩbyed pa po gang bya ba la ma ltos pa zhig byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod @115a * //
analyzed: yin par gyur la bya ba med // byed pa po gang bya ba la ma ltos pa zhig byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod @115a * //
translated: An existent does not perform an action.

original: na de la bya ba dang las med de /
analyzed: na de la bya ba dang las med de /
translated: If one maintains that an agent who does not depend on an action is the intrinsic reality of an agent, then he would not have an action or an object of action.

original: bya ba med par yang de grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba med par yang de grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he would be established without an action.

original: bya ba dang ldan pa las khyad par yod par yang mi rigs pas byed pa po las byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa las khyad par yod par yang mi rigs pas byed pa po las byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since it is not tenable that there is a difference between one who possesses an action and one who does not, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe agent performs an action.‚Äù This is the intended meaning.

original: yang na / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: yang na / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: It is a non-entity, and it does not perform functions.

original: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the reason that is similar to the example.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te brtags pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed de /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par byed pa po yin par gyur pa lhas byin zhes bya ba brten te brtags pa dang / mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las dge ba dang mi dge ba mi byed de /
translated: Here the inference is: Ultimately, the so-called agent Devadatta is not the basis of imputation because he does not perform virtuous and nonvirtuous actions in the continuum of Devadatta, imputed by tƒ´rthikas.

original: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no //
translated: Because he is an agent, like Yaj√±adatta.

original: yang na byed pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar btags pa ma yin par ji ltar gzigs zan pa dag gis bdag byed pa po nyid du brtags pa lta bu de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: yang na byed pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar btags pa ma yin par ji ltar gzigs zan pa dag gis bdag byed pa po nyid du brtags pa lta bu de dag gi phyir /
translated: Or, the non-imputed agent is not seen by the followers of Jaimini to be the self that is imputed as an agent.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las mi byed de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag lhas byin ni lhas byin gyi rgyud la las mi byed de /
translated: Therefore, the inference is: Ultimately, Devadatta is not the agent in the continuum of Devadatta.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no //
translated: Because he is an entity, like an action.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ni byed pa po bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las ni byed pa po bdag lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the karma of Devadatta‚Äôs continuum is not the action of the self that is the agent Devadatta,

original: las yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is karma, like anything other than that. Therefore it is undermined by inference.

original: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of that thesis?

original: ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las la byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las la byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that there is another agent of the karma of Devadatta‚Äôs continuum?

original: 'on te byed pa po med pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa po med pa yin /
translated: Or is it that there is no agent?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: gal te byed pa po gzhan yod pa yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: If there is another agent, then the thesis is undermined.

original: ci ste byed pa po med pa yin na ni dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste byed pa po med pa yin na ni dpe med do zhe na /
translated: But if there is no agent, then there is no example.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag mchod sbyin zhes bya ba lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du nye bar bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self, called ‚Äúthe performer of sacrifice,‚Äù which is not established as the agent of Devadatta‚Äôs continuum, is presented as the example.

original: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba la mi ltos pa la byed pa po nyid du rtog pa la bya ba dang las mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba la mi ltos pa la byed pa po nyid du rtog pa la bya ba dang las mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, in the case of the one who is the agent, who does not depend on action, action and the object of action are untenable.

original: las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
translated: And also the effect would not exist without the agent.

original: byed pa po des de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po des de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that effect is not made by that agent.

original: yang na / las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na / las kyang byed po med par 'gyur //
translated: And also the agent would not exist without the effect.

original: zhes bya ba ni las yin par gyur par rtog pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las yin par gyur par rtog pa la /
translated: This is the case when the effect is conceived as existent.

original: las kyang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las kyang las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the effect has the nature of the effect,

original: byed pa po la mi ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po la mi ltos pa yin te /
translated: it does not depend on the agent.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an intrinsic nature does not depend on anything else.

original: des na byed pa pos ma byas pa nyid kyi las su 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na byed pa pos ma byas pa nyid kyi las su 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the effect would be one that is not made by an agent.

original: 'dir yang rjes su @115b dpag pa snga ma bzhin no //üîΩyin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: 'dir yang rjes su @115b dpag pa snga ma bzhin no // yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: Here, the inference is the same as before.üîΩThe existent would not have activity.

original: byed pa po yang las med 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po yang las med 'gyur //
translated: And also the agent would not exist without the effect.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyed gong ma shos kyi rjes su 'brang bas rnam par bshad zin pa'i phyir bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyed gong ma shos kyi rjes su 'brang bas rnam par bshad zin pa'i phyir bshad mi dgos so //
translated: This is because the latter half of the verse is explained by following the former half. Therefore, it does not need to be explained.

original: de ltar na dam 'cha' bar byed pa'i dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur bas byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa med par yod pa de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ltar na dam 'cha' bar byed pa'i dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur bas byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa med par yod pa de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: Thus, since the assertion that the agent and action exist without mutual dependence is undermined by inference, it is not accepted.

original: de'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa po dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa kho nar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa po dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod pa kho nar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that the agent and action definitely exist in mutual dependence.

original: des na don dam par byed pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na don dam par byed pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, ultimately, the so-called agent Devadatta

original: lhas byin gyi rgyud la las byed pa po'i rgyud la gdon mi za bar rnam par smin par 'gyur ba mi byed par shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi rgyud la las byed pa po'i rgyud la gdon mi za bar rnam par smin par 'gyur ba mi byed par shes par byar nus te /
translated: cannot be said to perform the action of the continuum of Devadatta, which is the agent, without doubt ripening.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bzhin no //
translated: Because it is dependent, like a sacrifice.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las byed pa po la gdon mi za bar rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ni byed pa po lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi las byed pa po la gdon mi za bar rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ni byed pa po lhas byin gyi bya ba ma yin te ;
translated: Similarly, ultimately, the action of the continuum of Devadatta, which is the agent, does not without doubt ripen for the agent Devadatta.

original: byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po la ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is dependent on the agent.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi rgyud kyi las bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the activity of the life-stream of a sacrificer.

original: de ni dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩgal te byed por ma gyur pa //
analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa'i don nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa / gal te byed por ma gyur pa //
translated: Now, in order to establish the second point of the thesis, he says:üîΩIf an unreal agent

original: las su ma gyur byed na ni //
analyzed: las su ma gyur byed na ni //
translated: Performed an unreal action,

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What would follow from that?

original: las la rgyu ni med par 'gyur//
analyzed: las la rgyu ni med par 'gyur//
translated: The action would be without a cause.

original: byed pa po med par yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po med par yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the unreal agent is established as not being an agent.

original: byed pa po yang rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po yang rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: And the agent would be without a cause.

original: byed pa po las mi byed pa dang / las la mi ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po las mi byed pa dang / las la mi ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the agent would not perform the action and would not depend on the action.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed pa 'dis kyang byed pa po dang las kyi chos byed pa po dang las dag phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed pa 'dis kyang byed pa po dang las kyi chos byed pa po dang las dag phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid bstan to //
translated: And by this half-verse, he shows that the agent and action, the phenomena of agent and action, are mutually dependent.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni byed pa po dang las kyi phyogs la yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni byed pa po dang las kyi phyogs la yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Here, the inference is like before, in the case of the agent and action.

original: khyad par ni byed pa po dang las ma yin par gyur pa dag phyogs su bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni byed pa po dang las ma yin par gyur pa dag phyogs su bya ba yin no //
translated: The difference is that the unreal agent and action are taken as the subject.

original: ci ste yang 'ga' zhig kho bo cag la byed pa po dang las dag ni 'di lta ste rang dbang ni byed pa po'o //üîΩbyed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'ga' zhig kho bo cag la byed pa po dang las dag ni 'di lta ste rang dbang ni byed pa po'o // byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas /
translated: But if someone says to us, ‚ÄúThe agent and action are like this: the independent one is the agent,üîΩand the supreme desire of the agent is action,‚ÄùüîΩ

original: rang gi mtshan nyid grub pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid grub pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid yin pas /
translated: But if someone says to us, ‚ÄúThe agent and action exist in this way, because they are established by their own characteristics, they do not mutually rely on each other.

original: des na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer na /
analyzed: des na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer na /
translated: Therefore the meaning of the reason, ‚Äòbecause they rely on each other,‚Äô is not established,‚Äù

original: sun 'byin par byed pa la brkam pa nyid kyis de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar @116a * //
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa la brkam pa nyid kyis de la gnod pa chen po 'byung bar @116a * //
translated: then a great fault befalls you, because of your greed for refutation.

original: 'gyur te / ji ltar zhe na /üîΩ'di la rang dbang ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang las bsgrub pa'i thabs mkhas pa la rang dbang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur te / ji ltar zhe na / 'di la rang dbang ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang las bsgrub pa'i thabs mkhas pa la rang dbang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: How so?

original: las la ltos pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: las la ltos pa nyid yin la /
translated: That which is called ‚Äúthe agent is independent‚Äù is also dependent on action, because it is skilled in the means of accomplishing action.üîΩThat which is called ‚Äúaction is supreme in the desire of the agent‚Äù is also dependent on the agent.

original: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang byed pa po la ltos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po dang / las dag gi byed pa po dang / las zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid la ni phan tshun rgyu'i dngos por nye bar 'gro ba yod pa yin na /
analyzed: byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang byed pa po la ltos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa po dang / las dag gi byed pa po dang / las zhes tha snyad gdags pa nyid la ni phan tshun rgyu'i dngos por nye bar 'gro ba yod pa yin na /
translated: The supreme desire of the agent is the object, and since that also depends on the agent, the agent and object are mutually dependent as the basis of the conventions ‚Äúagent‚Äù and ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: de yang byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa med par smra ba la mi 'thad pas de'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag la rgyu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang byed pa po dang las dag ltos pa med par smra ba la mi 'thad pas de'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag la rgyu med par 'gyur te /
translated: But since it is untenable to state that the agent and object are independent, therefore the agent and object would be without cause.

original: de ltar / rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩrgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthus bya ba nyid kyis 'bras bu zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar / rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i mthus bya ba nyid kyis 'bras bu zhes bya zhing /
translated: As such: Without a cause, an effect And a cause are untenable.üîΩDue to the power of the individual determination of causes and conditions, that which is produced is called an effect.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu tshogs su zin kyang de yod na 'byung ba nyid kyis 'bras bu'i rgyu zhes bya na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu tshogs su zin kyang de yod na 'byung ba nyid kyis 'bras bu'i rgyu zhes bya na /
translated: Even though the collection of cooperating causes is complete, since it arises when it exists, it is called the cause of the effect.

original: ltos pa med pa la ni rgyu med pa yang rgyur mi rung la /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa la ni rgyu med pa yang rgyur mi rung la /
translated: And it is also thought that if it is not dependent, then a cause that is not a cause is not suitable as a cause,

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa yang 'bras bur mi rung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa yang 'bras bur mi rung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: and its effect that does not exist is not suitable as an effect.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,üîΩIf it does not exist, then action,

original: de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
analyzed: de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
translated: the agent, and activity are untenable.

original: 'bras bu de med na bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de med na bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag mi rigs te /
translated: If that effect does not exist, then action, the agent, and activity are untenable.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yul gyi bya ba de yang byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas byed pa po la ltos pa yin na bum pa sgrub nus pa'i rtsol ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yul gyi bya ba de yang byed pa po'i 'dod pa mchog ni las so zhes bya bas byed pa po la ltos pa yin na bum pa sgrub nus pa'i rtsol ba la /
translated: Moreover, the action of the object, such as a worldly pot, is also the supreme desire of the agent, and since it is said that action is the agent, if it depends on the agent, then the power to establish the pot is the agent.

original: thabs shes pa ma brjed pa'i mkhas pa la rang dbang ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po gzhan la mi ltos shing las la ltos pa yin /
analyzed: thabs shes pa ma brjed pa'i mkhas pa la rang dbang ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po gzhan la mi ltos shing las la ltos pa yin /
translated: And that which is skilled in not forgetting the method of knowledge is the independent agent. That also does not depend on another agent and depends on action.

original: bum pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag du mas bsgrub par bya ba de nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i yan lag las sgrub pa'i mchog ni byed pa'o zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po dang / las dag la ltos pa yin na ltos pa med pa la ni de dag med de /
analyzed: bum pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag du mas bsgrub par bya ba de nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i yan lag las sgrub pa'i mchog ni byed pa'o zhes bya ba de yang byed pa po dang / las dag la ltos pa yin na ltos pa med pa la ni de dag med de /
translated: The best of all accomplishments is the accomplishment of the object of accomplishment by means of the many branches of the accomplishment of the pot. But if that is dependent on the agent and action, then they do not exist without dependence.

original: gcad par bya ba'i shing med na bcad pa dang gcod pa po dang gcod pa dag med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gcad par bya ba'i shing med na bcad pa dang gcod pa po dang gcod pa dag med pa bzhin no //
translated: If the tree to be cut is not there, then the cutting, the cutter, and the cutting itself do not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang //
translated: Moreover,

original: bya ba la sogs mi rigs na //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs mi rigs na //
translated: If action and so on are illogical,

original: chos dang chos min yod ma yin //
analyzed: chos dang chos min yod ma yin //
translated: Dharma and nondharma do not exist.

original: bya ba dang byed pa po dang bya ba dag mi rigs na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po dang bya ba dag mi rigs na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If action, agent, and instrument are illogical, then Dharma and nondharma do not exist.

original: pha rol po'i tshul las chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni bya @116b ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang de dag gis gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: pha rol po'i tshul las chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni bya @116b ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang de dag gis gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs view is that Dharma and nondharma are established by action, agent, and instrument, and they are manifested by them.

original: ci ste yang rang gi sde pa dag la la 'di skad ces 'du byed rnams la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod de ;
analyzed: ci ste yang rang gi sde pa dag la la 'di skad ces 'du byed rnams la byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i skyon gyis mi gnod de ;
translated: But some of our own schools say, ‚ÄúSince there is no agent and no experiencer of compounded phenomena, the error of the absence of an agent does not undermine our position.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa dag lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi bya ba'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa dag lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi bya ba'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
