translated: Therefore, the wise definitely understand that the arising of such things as a pot is like the arising of a magical creation, and is conventional,

original: don dam pa pa ma yin par nges par shes te /
analyzed: don dam pa pa ma yin par nges par shes te /
translated: not ultimate,

original: mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa'i blo gros dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la mi gnas pa'i blo gros dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess the intelligence that does not dwell in the two extremes.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
translated: This is sufficient for a digression; let us now analyze the present topic.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa phyogs mi mthun pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa phyogs mi mthun pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o//
translated: Similarly, one should say the same about the other discordant positions, as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa dag kyang bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan yin par gyur pa dag kyang bum pa zhes bya ba de'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa rtsom par mi byed de /
translated: Likewise, those that are qualities that are asserted to be ultimate do not compose the quality-possessor called ‚Äúpot,‚Äù

original: yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: because they depend on the quality-possessor and because they are designated.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the other.

original: de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu zhes bya ba'i gzugs gzhan yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i yon tan can yin par gyur pa snam bu zhes bya ba'i gzugs gzhan yang /
translated: Likewise, the cloth, which is the other form that is asserted to be the ultimate,

original: yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan yin par gyur pa rgyu spun gyi gzugs la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin te /
translated: is not composed of the other forms that are the qualities, such as the threads,

original: yon tan la ltos pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan la ltos pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: because it depends on the qualities and because it is designated.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no ;
translated: For example, it is like the other.

original: / de bzhin du smra bar 'dod pa'i bum pa yang gzugs la sogs pas 'du ba'i rgyu can ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: / de bzhin du smra bar 'dod pa'i bum pa yang gzugs la sogs pas 'du ba'i rgyu can ma yin par nges te /
translated: Likewise, the pot, which is asserted to be the other, is definitely not the cause of the aggregation of form and so on,

original: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir dper na snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it depends on a cause, like cloth and so on.

original: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the form and so on that are asserted to be the other

original: bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bsams pa'i bum par 'du ba ma yin te /
translated: are not the cause of the aggregation of the pot that is intended,

original: yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yon tan can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: because it depends on the possessor of the qualities, like the other.

original: de bzhin du rdzas nyid dang / rgyu can nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas nyid dang / rgyu can nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, one should say that it is because of the reasons of substance, having a cause, having an effect, being expressible, being an object of knowledge, and so on.

original: yon tan dang / yon tan can ma yin par gyur pa la sogs pa dag gi phyogs la yang /
analyzed: yon tan dang / yon tan can ma yin par gyur pa la sogs pa dag gi phyogs la yang /
translated: With regard to the position that qualities and the quality-possessor are not different,

original: dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no /üîΩde bzhin du don dam par lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa yang ba lang zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma dag ni snga ma bzhin no / de bzhin du don dam par lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa yang ba lang zhes bya ba /
translated: the thesis is different, but the remaining parts of the proof are the same as before.üîΩSo too, one should understand that ultimately the horns and so on that are the characteristics do not characterize the basis of those characteristics called ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa yang ba lang zhes mtshon par mi byed par shes par bya ste /üîΩmtshan nyid kyi gzhi la ltos pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa yang ba lang zhes mtshon par mi byed par shes par bya ste / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la ltos pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: The basis of those characteristics called ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not indicated by the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: rta'i mtshan nyid bzhin no /
analyzed: rta'i mtshan nyid bzhin no /
translated: Because it depends on the basis of those characteristics, like the characteristics of a horse.

original: de bzhin du don dam par ba lang gi rdzas kyang lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin te mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de @123a * //üîΩlas gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par ba lang gi rdzas kyang lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin te mtshan nyid la ltos pa'i phyir dper na de @123a * // las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, ultimately the substance of a cow is not the basis of the characteristics such as hump, because it depends on the characteristics, just like something else.

original: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa dag ba lang gi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa dang / ba lang gi rdzas kyang lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa dag ba lang gi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa dang / ba lang gi rdzas kyang lkog shal la sogs pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, it should be said that the hump and so on do not compose the substance of a cow, and the substance of a cow is not composed of the hump and so on.

original: de bzhin du phyogs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, this should be applied to all similar and dissimilar cases.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag kyang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur ba rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag kyang lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur ba rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, ultimately the limbs such as the hand, which are the basis, do not compose the one called Devadatta, which is the basis of the limbs,

original: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir dper na rtsa ba dang sdong po la sogs pa dag bzhin no //
translated: because it depends on the basis of the limbs, just like the root, trunk, and so on.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin zhes bya ba yan lag can yin par gyur pa yang /
translated: So too, ultimately, Devadatta, who is the possessor of the parts,

original: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag yin par gyur pa dag gis brtsams pa ma yin te /
translated: is not created by the parts, such as his hands, which are the parts.

original: yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dper na shing ljon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dper na shing ljon pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he depends on his parts, he is like a tree.

original: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i so ma shar ma zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang / yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na bha ba shar ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na smra bar 'dod pa'i so ma shar ma zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste yan lag la ltos pa'i phyir dang / yan lag can yin pa'i phyir dper na bha ba shar ma bzhin no //
translated: Or, ultimately, the so-called Devadatta, who is the possessor of the parts, is not created by the parts, such as his hands, because he is apprehended as depending on his parts and because he is a possessor of parts, like a bhavashara.

original: yang na don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag ni so ma shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dag ni so ma shar ma zhes bya ba yan lag can rtsom par byed pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or, ultimately, the so-called hands, which are the parts, do not create the possessor of the parts, Devadatta, who is the one who is desired to speak.

original: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag can la ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he depends on the possessor of the parts.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is a possessor of parts, like something else.

original: 'dir yang dam bcas pa'i don la sogs pa rnam par brtag pa rgyas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang dam bcas pa'i don la sogs pa rnam par brtag pa rgyas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here also, the extensive analysis of the meaning of the thesis and so on is the same as before.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la yan lag can de yan lag dag la cha shas kyis 'jug par 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag can de yan lag dag la cha shas kyis 'jug par 'dod dam /
translated: in this regard, do you assert that the possessor of the parts engages in the parts by means of a part?

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug par 'dod /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that it engages by means of its entirety?

original: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod pa ni lhas byin zhes bya ba /üîΩyan lag can gyi rkang pa la sogs pa dag de'i cha shas lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod pa ni lhas byin zhes bya ba / yan lag can gyi rkang pa la sogs pa dag de'i cha shas lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If you assert the former, then Devadatta,

original: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: the possessor of the parts, does not commence with the parts of his feet and so on, because he does not exist in those parts, like the parts of a blanket and so on.

original: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni lhas byin zhes bya ba /üîΩyan lag can gyi bdag nyid lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni lhas byin zhes bya ba / yan lag can gyi bdag nyid lag pa'i phyogs na 'dug pa gang yin pa de /
translated: But if you assert the latter, then Devadatta,

original: de'i rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rkang pa la sogs pas brtsams pa ma yin te /
translated: the possessor of the parts, does not commence with his feet and so on, because he does not exist in those parts, like the parts of a blanket and so on.

original: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir @123b dper na ba lang la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag tu ma zhugs pa'i phyir @123b dper na ba lang la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they do not enter into them, like, for example, cows and so on.

original: de la brtag pa snga ma la ni yan lag can cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la brtag pa snga ma la ni yan lag can cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: In the former case, the whole would have parts.

original: brtag pa phyi ma la ni yan lag can mang po nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma la ni yan lag can mang po nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: In the latter case, there would be many wholes. Therefore, one should not cling to them.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is that, in order to prove that the aggregates and so on exist,

original: rab tu byed pa'i dang por gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i dang por gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas /
translated: the opponent in the first chapter states a reason that is unestablished.

original: byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: By saying this, the author demonstrates that the agent and action are essenceless.

original: de'i phyir lus dang / ngag dang / yid dag gis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la byed pa po'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang / ngag dang / yid dag gis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la byed pa po'am /
translated: And similarly, Subh≈´ti, there is no agent in form,

original: byang du 'jug pa po med do //üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am /
analyzed: byang du 'jug pa po med do // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am /
translated: or one who causes engagement in the north.üîΩThere is no agent in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: byed du 'jug pa po med do //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa po med do //
translated: or one who causes engagement.

original: gzugs la byed pa po'am /
analyzed: gzugs la byed pa po'am /
translated: There is no agent in form,

original: byed du 'jug pa po med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am /
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa po med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la byed pa po'am /
translated: or one who causes engagement, and there is no agent in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,üîΩor one who causes engagement. That is the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: byed du 'jug pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bgyis pa'o //
translated: And similarly, Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, the perfection of wisdom is not made.‚Äù

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so.

original: sha ra dva ta'i bu byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /üîΩgzugs ni dge ba'am /
analyzed: sha ra dva ta'i bu byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / gzugs ni dge ba'am /
translated: And similarly, Subh≈´ti,

original: mi dge ba ma yin no //üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba ma yin no // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dge ba'am /
translated: form is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous.

original: mi dge ba ma yin no //üîΩgzugs dge ba'am /üîΩmi dge ba ma yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba ma yin no // gzugs dge ba'am / mi dge ba ma yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dge ba'am /
translated: Feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous.

original: mi dge ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: That which is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous is the perfection of wisdom.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba'i dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba'i dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: The master BhƒÅviveka‚Äôs Lamp of Wisdom, commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way,

original: byed pa po dang las brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is called ‚ÄúExamination of Agent and Action.‚Äù

original: rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'o /üîΩ// / de ni stong pa nyid @124a * //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'o / // / de ni stong pa nyid @124a * //
translated: Chapter Eight

original: kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
analyzed: kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
translated: Now, in order to refute the specific counter positions to emptiness,

original: nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa dgu pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa dgu pa brtsam mo //
translated: the ninth chapter is begun in order to demonstrate the essencelessness of the appropriator and the appropriated.

original: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par /
translated: In the immediately preceding chapter,

original: de bzhin nye bar len shes par bya //üîΩzhes smos pa der nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nye bar len shes par bya // zhes smos pa der nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang /
translated: it was said, ‚ÄúThe appropriator should be understood in the same way.‚ÄùüîΩThere it was explained that the appropriator, whether it is existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent, does not appropriate that which is to be appropriated, whether it is existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent.

original: ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed do zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed do zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:üîΩSeeing, hearing, and so forth,

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
translated: and also feeling and so on,

original: gang gi yin pa de dag gis //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa de dag gis //
translated: are controlled by that which possesses them.

original: snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
analyzed: snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
translated: Some say that it exists prior to them.

original: de la lta zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la lta zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to that, ‚Äúseeing‚Äù is

original: 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes seeing.

original: nyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of ‚Äúhearing‚Äù and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi dang por lta ba dang / nyan pa bstan pa dag go zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi dang por lta ba dang / nyan pa bstan pa dag go zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú And so on‚Äù means those that are taught first as seeing and hearing.

original: tshor zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: tshor zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Feeling‚Äù is sensation.

original: sogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa gang dag gi dang por tshor ba bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: sogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa gang dag gi dang por tshor ba bstan pa dag go //
translated: ‚Äú And so on‚Äù means those that are taught first as sensation, such as consciousness, contact, mental activity, and intention.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the meaning of inclusion.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid ces pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúmind.‚Äù

original: dbang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang du byas pa la 'jug pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang du byas pa la 'jug pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúdominates‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúis dominant.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa de dag nye bar len pa po gang gi yin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na nye bar len pa po de yod do zhes kha cig smra ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa de dag nye bar len pa po gang gi yin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na nye bar len pa po de yod do zhes kha cig smra ste /
translated: Therefore, some say that prior to the appropriator, the appropriator exists, and that the appropriator is the one to whom the views, etc. belong, and the one to whom the feelings, etc. belong.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni rang gi sde pa thams cad kyis de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag ste /
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni rang gi sde pa thams cad kyis de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag ste /
translated: ‚Äú Some‚Äù refers to the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas, because not all Buddhist schools accept this.

original: de dag de skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de dag de skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: This is how they explain the meaning of the s≈´tra.

original: de ni pha rol pos dam bcas pa nye bar bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni pha rol pos dam bcas pa nye bar bzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position that is being set forth.

original: de dag 'di skad ces kyang zer te /üîΩ'di ltar nye bar len pa po gnas na nye bar blang ba de dag shes par byar rung ste /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces kyang zer te / 'di ltar nye bar len pa po gnas na nye bar blang ba de dag shes par byar rung ste /
translated: They also say this:üîΩ‚ÄúThe appropriator is known to exist because the appropriated exist.

original: de la ltos nas de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos nas de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They arise in dependence on the appropriator.

original: gzhan du dam bcas na /üîΩdngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: gzhan du dam bcas na / dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If you deny this,üîΩthen how could the existent

original: lta ba la sogs ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: views, etc. exist?

original: des na / de phyir de dag snga rol na //
analyzed: des na / de phyir de dag snga rol na //
translated: Therefore, prior to the views, etc.

original: dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
translated: That enduring thing exists.üîΩ

original: zhes bya @124b ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya @124b ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat enduring thing exists‚Äù is a concluding statement.

original: de lta bas na snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs dang dpe mngon par rjes su dpag pa ni nye bar len pa po de lta ba po la sogs pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yod de /
analyzed: de lta bas na snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs dang dpe mngon par rjes su dpag pa ni nye bar len pa po de lta ba po la sogs pa'i snga rol na gnas pa yod de /
translated: Therefore, as before, the argument and example are to be supplied: ‚ÄúThat appropriator exists prior to the seer, etc.,

original: nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is an appropriator.‚Äù

original: 'di na gang nye bar len pa po yin pa de ni nye bar blang pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang nye bar len pa po yin pa de ni nye bar blang pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, that which is an appropriator exists prior to the appropriated.

original: dper na sab ma mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sab ma mkhan rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a weaver exists prior to the cloth.

original: yang na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag ni nye bar len pa po snga na gnas pa dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or, the appropriated, such as seeing and hearing, are to be understood as existing prior to the appropriator,

original: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are appropriated. For example, cloth is prior to the weaver.

original: de'i phyir nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa nyid kyis nye bar len pa po zhes grags par 'gyur zhing /üîΩnye bar len pa pos nye bar blang ba nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa nyid kyis nye bar len pa po zhes grags par 'gyur zhing / nye bar len pa pos nye bar blang ba nyid kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, the appropriator is renowned as the appropriator by virtue of appropriating the appropriated.

original: nye bar blang ba zhes grags par 'gyur bas gnyi ga grub bo //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba zhes grags par 'gyur bas gnyi ga grub bo //
translated: And the appropriated is renowned as the appropriated by virtue of being appropriated by the appropriator.üîΩThus both are established.

original: des na / kho bo cag gis don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: des na / kho bo cag gis don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in our statement, ‚ÄúIn reality, only the aggregates and so on exist,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de nyams pa med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de nyams pa med do //
translated: because the Transcendent Lord taught the appropriator and the appropriated in reliance on them.‚Äù

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩPrior to seeing, hearing, and so on,

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni //
translated: and prior to feeling and so on,

original: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
analyzed: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
translated: what is the thing that endures?

original: de ni gang gis gdags bar bya //
analyzed: de ni gang gis gdags bar bya //
translated: By what means is it imputed?

original: lta ba la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa dag med na /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa dag med na /
translated: If seeing and so on and feeling and so on do not exist,üîΩthen the appropriator does not exist.

original: gang dag la brten nas 'di nye bar len pa po zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pa'i nye bar blang ba gzhan 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang dag la brten nas 'di nye bar len pa po zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed pa'i nye bar blang ba gzhan 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no other appropriated that is the basis for designating the appropriator.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su lta ba la sogs pa dag nyid kyis de gdags par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su lta ba la sogs pa dag nyid kyis de gdags par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the appropriator is designated by the eyes, etc., and by feeling, etc.,

original: lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang skye ba'i snga rol na med de /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa de dag kyang skye ba'i snga rol na med de /
translated: then those eyes, etc., and those feelings, etc. do not exist prior to arising.

original: de dag med na de gang gis gdags par bya /
analyzed: de dag med na de gang gis gdags par bya /
translated: If they do not exist, by what would it be designated?

original: de'i tshe nye bar blang ba dag med na de yang med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe nye bar blang ba dag med na de yang med de /
translated: At that time, if the appropriated does not exist, then the appropriator also does not exist,

original: shing du  ba la sogs pa dag med na nags tshal yang med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: shing du  ba la sogs pa dag med na nags tshal yang med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: just as if smoke, etc., do not exist, then a forest fire also does not exist.üîΩOr,üîΩBy the eyes, ears, and so on,

original: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyis ni //
translated: and by feeling and so on,

original: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
analyzed: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
translated: what entity exists prior

original: de ni gang gis gdags par bya //
analyzed: de ni gang gis gdags par bya //
translated: to which it is designated?

original: nye bar blang ba la brten nas nye bar len pa po gdags par bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba la brten nas nye bar len pa po gdags par bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the appropriator is designated in dependence on the appropriated.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni nye bar @125a * //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni nye bar @125a * //
translated: Thus, this verse shows that the bodhisattva is a great being.üîΩ

original: len pa po'i chos brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid bstan to //üîΩde'i phyir snga ma bzhin du yan lag lhag ma mngon pas 'dir rjes su dpag pas ni nye bar len pa po da lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
analyzed: len pa po'i chos brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid bstan to // de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du yan lag lhag ma mngon pas 'dir rjes su dpag pas ni nye bar len pa po da lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
translated: Thus, this shows that the appropriator is a phenomenon that is imputed in dependence.

original: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no //üîΩdes na nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa po ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon nam /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no // des na nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa po ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon nam /
translated: Therefore, as before, since the remainder of the limbs are clear, here the appropriator does not exist prior to the appropriated such as the present self because it is an object of imputation, like, for example, a cloth that does not exist prior to its causes, thread and so on.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: Therefore, since the appropriator and the appropriated are not established, the error that the meaning of the reason is not established or the error that the meaning of the reason is contradictory exists.

original: don dam par sab ma mkhan dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag kyang nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe yang med do //
analyzed: don dam par sab ma mkhan dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa dag kyang nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe yang med do //
translated: Also, since the weaver and the loom and so on are not established as the appropriator and the appropriated in an ultimate sense, there is no example.

original: yang na gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: yang na gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Or, some of the Vatsiputrƒ´ya school turn back and say:

original: lung las nye bar len pa po ltar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa ltar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su zad pas /
analyzed: lung las nye bar len pa po ltar gyur pa snga na gnas pa yod pa ltar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su zad pas /
translated: Since karma that is like the appropriator, which existed prior to the appropriator, would be exhausted,üîΩthe appropriator of the aggregates of humans and so on would not exist.

original: mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar grags pas rjes su dpag pas nye bar len pa po med pa nyid du bstan pa kho bo cag mi 'dod de /üîΩlong ba rkang pa tshod dpags kyis //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po nyid du 'gyur bar grags pas rjes su dpag pas nye bar len pa po med pa nyid du bstan pa kho bo cag mi 'dod de / long ba rkang pa tshod dpags kyis //
translated: We do not accept that the nonexistence of the appropriator is taught by inference,üîΩjust as a blind person

original: nyam nga'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
analyzed: nyam nga'i lam du rgyug pa ltar //
translated: runs on a treacherous path by guessing.

original: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin pa //
translated: Those who hold inference to be primary

original: rnam par ltung ba mi dka'o //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par ltung ba mi dka'o // zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: will not find it difficult to fall.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: lha yang lha'i nye bar blang ba dag nyid la brten nas lha nyid du gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rkang pa'i tshod dpags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa rjes su dpag pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: lha yang lha'i nye bar blang ba dag nyid la brten nas lha nyid du gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rkang pa'i tshod dpags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa rjes su dpag pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because even the gods are designated as gods in dependence on the appropriated aggregates of the gods, and because the inference of the size of the feet is not established as an inference even in the case of the opponent,

original: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba gtsor 'dzin pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba gtsor 'dzin pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is a downfall to hold as primary a mere semblance of inference.

original: lung spyi yin pas the tshom skye ba'i phyir yang de nyid las nges par gzung bas mi rigs te /
analyzed: lung spyi yin pas the tshom skye ba'i phyir yang de nyid las nges par gzung bas mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to accept that scripture is a means of valid cognition because it gives rise to doubt, since it is general.

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Scripture should be accepted as not different from inference,

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause for understanding a meaning that is not evident.

original: dper na / rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the nature of inference itself.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:üîΩScripture is definitely different from inference,

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin te /
translated: because it is the cause for understanding a meaning that is not evident.

original: de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: de las yul tha dad pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: because its object is different from that of inference, like direct perception.

original: de ltar yang rjes su dpag pa ni dbang pos gzung ba'i don gyi yul can yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yang rjes su dpag pa ni dbang pos gzung ba'i don gyi yul can yin la /
translated: Inference has as its object a meaning that is apprehended by the sense faculties.

original: sgra'i @125b mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma ni dbang po las 'das pa mtho ris dang byang grol gyi yul can yin pas /
analyzed: sgra'i @125b mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma ni dbang po las 'das pa mtho ris dang byang grol gyi yul can yin pas /
translated: But scriptural valid knowledge has as its object the supersensible meaning of heaven and liberation.

original: de'i phyir lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don tha dad pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, scripture is definitely a different object from inference.

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las yul tha dad pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las yul tha dad pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Scripture is not a different object from inference,

original: rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par mtho ris su rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgyu bcad pa las skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid byang grol rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par mtho ris su rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir dang / rgyu bcad pa las skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid byang grol rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: because heaven is to be inferred from the special cause, and liberation, which is characterized by the absence of birth from the cessation of causes, is to be inferred.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: yang na mtho ris dang thar ba yod do zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yang na mtho ris dang thar ba yod do zhes bya ba /
translated: Or, heaven and liberation exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gang yin pa de ni ji lta ba bzhin te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gang yin pa de ni ji lta ba bzhin te //
translated: That which is the statement of the TathƒÅgata is just as it is.

original: de brjod pa'i phyir de'i tshig bzhin pas /
analyzed: de brjod pa'i phyir de'i tshig bzhin pas /
translated: Because it is expressed in that way, it is the word of that one.

original: rjes su dpag pa kho nas mtho ris la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon de nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa kho nas mtho ris la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon de nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: Because one understands heaven, etc. only through inference, the fault of the non-establishment of the reason still applies.

original: de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pa las sdang bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pa las sdang bar ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is showing his hostility toward inference.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: khyod 'dod par ltar /
analyzed: khyod 'dod par ltar /
translated: if, as you assert,üîΩthe appropriator exists

original: lta la sogs pa med par yang //üîΩgal te de ni gnas gyur na //üîΩde med par yang de dag ni //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa med par yang // gal te de ni gnas gyur na // de med par yang de dag ni //
translated: without the appropriated,üîΩthen without doubt,

original: yod par gyur pa the tshom med //
analyzed: yod par gyur pa the tshom med //
translated: the appropriated would exist without the appropriator.

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: The meaning is that the appropriated, such as form, etc.,

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa po la mi ltos par nye bar blang ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa po la mi ltos par nye bar blang ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: would exist without the appropriator, because the appropriated, such as form, etc., would be established as such without depending on the appropriator.

original: de dag gcig med par gcig byung na ni /
analyzed: de dag gcig med par gcig byung na ni /
translated: If one of them arose without the other,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it would be like this:

original: lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i chos 'di dag ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di'i'o //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba'i chos 'di dag ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di'i'o //
translated: The phenomena that are appropriated, such as seeing, are of this one called Devadatta, the appropriator.

original: nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di yang nye bar blang ba 'di dag gi'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa de mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba 'di yang nye bar blang ba 'di dag gi'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa de mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: This one called Devadatta, the appropriator, is of these appropriated phenomena.üîΩBut that order is impossible.

original: rim pa de ni gdon mi za ba kho nar 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: rim pa de ni gdon mi za ba kho nar 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: That order must be accepted without doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar / ci yis gang zhig gsal bar byed /üîΩgang gis ci zhig gsal bar byed //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / ci yis gang zhig gsal bar byed / gang gis ci zhig gsal bar byed //
translated: Why?

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir te /üîΩci yis zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gang yang rung bas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir te / ci yis zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gang yang rung bas so //
translated: Because of such statements as:üîΩBy what is anything illuminated?üîΩBy what is anyone illuminated?

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa'o //
translated: By what is anything illuminated?üîΩBy what is anyone illuminated?

original: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par byed pa'o //
translated: By what is anything illuminated?

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni lta ba po dang / nyan pa po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni lta ba po dang / nyan pa po la sogs pas so //
translated: By what is anyone illuminated?

original: ci zhig ces bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù refers to any of the things such as seeing.

original: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni /üîΩlta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa 'di'i lta @126a * //
analyzed: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni / lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa 'di'i lta @126a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIt makes them manifest‚Äù meansüîΩthat it makes manifest the seer, hearer, etc.,

original: ba dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa ni 'di'o zhes mngon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa ni 'di'o zhes mngon par byed pa'o //
translated: and the seeing, hearing, etc., of this one.

original: de ltar gcig la gcig ltos pas nye bar blang ba dang / nye bar len pa po dag tha snyad par grub pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de ltar gcig la gcig ltos pas nye bar blang ba dang / nye bar len pa po dag tha snyad par grub pa yin gyis /
translated: Thus, the appropriated and the appropriator are established conventionally,

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: gal te ltos pa can yin yang ltos pa nges pas don dam pa ba yin no zhe na /üîΩgang la ltos nas nye bar blang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar blang ba la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa can yin yang ltos pa nges pas don dam pa ba yin no zhe na / gang la ltos nas nye bar blang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar blang ba la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa cung zad kyang med la /
translated: If you say that although they are dependent, they are ultimate because the dependence is definite,üîΩthen there is not the slightest thing that is the appropriator prior to the establishment of the appropriated, without depending on the appropriated.

original: gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa po 'grub par 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba yang /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa po 'grub par 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba yang /
translated: And there is not the slightest thing that is the appropriated prior to the establishment of the appropriator, without depending on the appropriator.

original: nye bar len pa po la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid du grub pa med de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po la mi ltos par snga nas nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid du grub pa med de /
translated: The self that is the appropriator does not exist prior to the appropriatedüîΩwithout depending on the appropriated.

original: de med na gang la ltos nas nye bar blang bar 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba ni nam yang de la ltos nas nye bar blang bar mi 'gyur zhing nye bar blang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de med na gang la ltos nas nye bar blang bar 'gyur ba'i nye bar blang ba ni nam yang de la ltos nas nye bar blang bar mi 'gyur zhing nye bar blang ba ma yin la /
translated: If it did not exist, then the appropriated that would depend on it would never

original: gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa por 'gyur ba'i nye bar len pa po yod /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas nye bar len pa por 'gyur ba'i nye bar len pa po yod /
translated: be the appropriated that depends on it.üîΩAnd without the appropriated, how could there be an appropriator?

original: nam yang / de la ltos nas nye bar len pa por mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nam yang / de la ltos nas nye bar len pa por mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Without the appropriated, the appropriator would never be the appropriator.

original: nye bar len pa po ma yin pas ltos pa nges pa yang srid par dka'o //üîΩci med gang zhig ga la yod //üîΩgang med ci zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ma yin pas ltos pa nges pa yang srid par dka'o // ci med gang zhig ga la yod // gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
translated: And without the appropriator, it would be difficult to maintain that there isüîΩappropriation.üîΩHow could there be a non-existent appropriator?

original: nye bar blang ba ci zhig po med na /üîΩnye bar len pa po gang zhig po ga la yod /üîΩnye bar len pa po gang zhig po med na /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba ci zhig po med na / nye bar len pa po gang zhig po ga la yod / nye bar len pa po gang zhig po med na /
translated: How could there be an existent appropriated?üîΩIf the appropriated does not exist, how could the appropriator exist?

original: nye bar blang ba zhig po yang ga la yod de /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba zhig po yang ga la yod de /
translated: If the appropriator does not exist, how could the appropriated exist?

original: de ltar de med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so //
analyzed: de ltar de med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so //
translated: Thus, since that does not exist, the fault of the reason remains unrefuted.

original: yang gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag phyir log par byed de /
analyzed: yang gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag phyir log par byed de /
translated: Again, the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas respond:

original: khyod lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gang zhig gnas pa yod do zhes rnam par brtags nas /
analyzed: khyod lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gang zhig gnas pa yod do zhes rnam par brtags nas /
translated: You imagine that prior to all such things as seeing, something that exists is the basis of seeing and so on.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzos nye bar sbyar ba'i tshig gi don la skyon 'dogs pa des ci bya /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzos nye bar sbyar ba'i tshig gi don la skyon 'dogs pa des ci bya /
translated: What is the point of refuting the meaning of the words that you have fabricated through your own thoughts?

original: kho bo cag ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni /
translated: We say:

original: lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: Prior to all such things as seeing,

original: snga rol gang zhig yod pa min //
analyzed: snga rol gang zhig yod pa min //
translated: there is nothing that exists.

original: zhes smra'o // 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But if you ask, ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù

original: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod de /üîΩlta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod de / lta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis //
translated: we reply: Prior to each of such things as seeing, it exists.üîΩIt is made clear by other things such as seeing

original: gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed //
translated: at other times.

original: lta ba dang nyan pa dang / smon pa dang / myong bar byed pa dang / lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag las lta ba'am /
analyzed: lta ba dang nyan pa dang / smon pa dang / myong bar byed pa dang / lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag las lta ba'am /
translated: From such things as seeing, hearing, desiring, experiencing, the body, and feeling, it is not the same as seeing,

original: nyan pa'am / snom pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gis gzhan gyi tshe na 'di ni lta ba po'o /
analyzed: nyan pa'am / snom pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gis gzhan gyi tshe na 'di ni lta ba po'o /
translated: or hears, or smells, or does something else, then at that time it is clearly evident that this is the seer,

original: 'di ni nyan pa po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan pa po'o //
translated: this is the hearer,

original: @126b 'di ni snom pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs par gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: @126b 'di ni snom pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs par gsal bar byed do //
translated: this is the smeller, and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ltar lta ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar lta ba'am /
translated: Therefore, in that way, prior to seeing,

original: yan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa de de las gzhan pa'i nye bar blang ba la ltos pas /
analyzed: yan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na gnas pa de de las gzhan pa'i nye bar blang ba la ltos pas /
translated: hearing, and so on, if it exists, then since it would rely on something else to be appropriated,

original: nye bar len pa po nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid med do//
analyzed: nye bar len pa po nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid med do//
translated: it would not be established as the appropriator. Therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩlta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: Here we say:

original: snga rol gal te yod min na //
analyzed: snga rol gal te yod min na //
translated: If it does not exist prior to

original: lta la sogs pa re re yi //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa re re yi //
translated: all such things as seeing,

original: snga rol de ni ji ltar yod //
analyzed: snga rol de ni ji ltar yod //
translated: how could it exist prior to

original: gang gi phyir de lta ba'am /üîΩnyan pa la sgos pa dag gi snga rol na yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ba'am / nyan pa la sgos pa dag gi snga rol na yod par 'dod na /
translated: each such thing as seeing?üîΩIf it is asserted that it exists prior to seeing,

original: de la mi ltos pa'i nye bar blang ba de nyid du mi 'grub la /
analyzed: de la mi ltos pa'i nye bar blang ba de nyid du mi 'grub la /
translated: hearing, and so on, then without relying on them, it would not be established as the appropriator.

original: de la mi ltos pa'i nye bar len pa po de yang nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub bo zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩde lta bas na rjes su dpag pa las nye bar blang ba re re'i snga rol na yang /
analyzed: de la mi ltos pa'i nye bar len pa po de yang nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub bo zhes bya bar dgongs so // de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa las nye bar blang ba re re'i snga rol na yang /
translated: and that appropriator not dependent on that is not established as an appropriator.üîΩThus, as before, it is not established that prior to each of the appropriated aggregates,

original: nye bar len pa po yod par snga ma bzhin du rab tu mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yod par snga ma bzhin du rab tu mi 'grub bo //
translated: the appropriator exists by means of intrinsic existence.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba rnams lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po yang yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba rnams lta ba po gang kho na yin pa de nyid nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po yang yin no zhe'am /
translated: those who assert that the appropriator exists would have to accept that the one who sees is the one who hears and the one who feels,

original: gzhan yin no zhes khas len par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yin no zhes khas len par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or that they are different.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: de la / gal te re re'i snga rol na //
analyzed: de la / gal te re re'i snga rol na //
translated: If prior to each

original: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
analyzed: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
translated: The seer were the hearer,

original: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //
translated: The feeler would also be the seer.

original: ji ltar mu stegs can dag na re /
analyzed: ji ltar mu stegs can dag na re /
translated: As the tƒ´rthikas say,

original: de'i lta ba po de'i lus dang dbang po'i gnas rtsa ba dang / 'jim pa lta bu dag ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa'i chos can yin no zhes zer ba ltar 'dod na de yang rnam pa de lta bur ma grags pas /
analyzed: de'i lta ba po de'i lus dang dbang po'i gnas rtsa ba dang / 'jim pa lta bu dag ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa'i chos can yin no zhes zer ba ltar 'dod na de yang rnam pa de lta bur ma grags pas /
translated: If you assert that the seer, the body, and the sense faculties, which are the basis of the seer, are like clay and the pot, which are subject to increase and decrease, then that is not renowned in that way.

original: de ni de ltar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, that is not tenable.

original: yang na / gal te re re'i snga rol na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te re re'i snga rol na //
translated: Moreover, if prior to each

original: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
analyzed: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
translated: The seer itself would be the hearer,

original: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur //
translated: And the feeler would be the same.

original: gcig pu rdzas su yod du zin kyang skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig pu rdzas su yod du zin kyang skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though it exists as a single substance, because it does not endure for more than a moment,

original: tha snyad du yang lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po nyid yin par mi srid de /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po nyid yin par mi srid de /
translated: it is impossible for it to be the seer, the hearer, and the feeler even conventionally.

original: gcig pu 'thad pa med pa re re'i snga rol na yod par ga la rigs /
analyzed: gcig pu 'thad pa med pa re re'i snga rol na yod par ga la rigs /
translated: How could it be tenable that it exists prior to each of them as a single thing?

original: de'i phyir de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThat is not tenable in that way.‚Äù

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: de gcig nyid du ste /
analyzed: de gcig nyid du ste /
translated: It is the one.

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon gyis skyon chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon gyis skyon chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The fault of the thesis is the fault of the subject.

original: don dam par nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nyan pa po ni lta ba po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the hearer is not different from the seer,

original: nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: nyan pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because he is the hearer,

original: rgyud tha dad pa'i nyan pa po bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa'i nyan pa po bzhin no //
translated: like the hearer of a different continuum.

original: nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid @127a * //
analyzed: nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa gzhan nyid @127a * //
translated: Since the hearer is inferred to be different from the seer, etc.,

original: du rjes su dpog pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do //üîΩlta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: du rjes su dpog pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i skyon yod do // lta ba po yang gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the fault of the thesis is the fault of the subject‚Äôs own nature being contradicted.

original: mig la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: mig la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: The seer does not rely on the eye in order to observe form,

original: nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nyan pa po bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nyan pa po bzhin no //
translated: because he is not different from the hearer, like the hearer.

original: lta ba po nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lta ba po nyan pa po las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas gzugs dmigs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the seer is inferred to be not different from the hearer,üîΩthe fault of the thesis is the fault of the subject‚Äôs own nature being contradicted.

original: mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyi de bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: mig la ltos par mi byed pa nyid kyi de bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Since the eye is not dependent on the self, the fault of the subject not being established still applies to your thesis.

original: de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan dag ni 'di skad ces /üîΩgal te de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par gyur na de lta na lta ba po yang de nyid yin la /üîΩnyan pa po yang de nyid yin tshor ba po yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan dag ni 'di skad ces / gal te de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par gyur na de lta na lta ba po yang de nyid yin la / nyan pa po yang de nyid yin tshor ba po yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The opponent responds:

original: de de ltar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de de ltar mi rigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that the self is the seer, the hearer, the feeler, and the cognizer.‚ÄùüîΩWe do not say that it is not tenable that the self is the seer, the hearer, the feeler, and the cognizer.üîΩWe say that it is not tenable that the self is the seer, the hearer, the feeler, and the cognizer in the sense of being their intrinsic nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would absurdly follow that the self would move from one sense faculty to another, just as a person moves from one window to another.

original: bdag ni dbang po gzhan gang du yang 'gro bar mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag ni dbang po gzhan gang du yang 'gro bar mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: We do not assert that the self moves from one sense faculty to another.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: de ni thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that this is a fault of the consequence.

original: mig la sogs pa byed pa de dang de nas skyes pa gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i blo dag bdag thams cad du song ba'i phyogs su 'du bas /üîΩlta ba po la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa sgra la sogs par snang ba dag yod na /üîΩrna ba la sogs par snang ba'i nang gi byed pa po yod cing shes pa yod par snang ba'i gzugs brnyan 'char bas phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur bas lta ba po dang nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa dag grub pas /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa byed pa de dang de nas skyes pa gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i blo dag bdag thams cad du song ba'i phyogs su 'du bas / lta ba po la sogs pa dbang po gzhan du 'gro ba med par yang 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa sgra la sogs par snang ba dag yod na / rna ba la sogs par snang ba'i nang gi byed pa po yod cing shes pa yod par snang ba'i gzugs brnyan 'char bas phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur bas lta ba po dang nyan pa po nyid la sogs pa dag grub pas /
translated: The eye and so on are the agent, and the mind that observes form and so on is born from that agent.üîΩSince it is included in the position that the self pervades all, it is established that the seer and so on do not move to another sense faculty, and if the engagement of the ear and so on appears as sound and so on,üîΩthen the internal agent that appears as the ear and so on exists and the reflection that appears as consciousness arises and benefits.

original: bdag thams cad du song ba la dbang po gzhan gyi phyogs su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag thams cad du song ba la dbang po gzhan gyi phyogs su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the seer, hearer, and so on are established by that, the self that pervades all does not move to another sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir de ltar re re'i snga rol na yod pa nyid mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar re re'i snga rol na yod pa nyid mi 'thad pas /
translated: Therefore it is untenable that the self exists prior to each of them.

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon de nyid ma nyams so //
translated: Thus the fault of the reason remains.

original: skyes bu smra ba gang dag phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag las gzhan pa'i skyes bu de nyid lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / sems pa po yin par smra ba dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu smra ba gang dag phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag las gzhan pa'i skyes bu de nyid lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / sems pa po yin par smra ba dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
translated: The same refutation applies to those who assert that the person is the seer, the hearer, and the feeler, but is different from the aggregates, elements, and media.

original: yang na lta ba po nyid @127b la sogs pa dag mi 'thad par ni skye mched brtag par bstan zin pas yang bstan mi dgos so //
analyzed: yang na lta ba po nyid @127b la sogs pa dag mi 'thad par ni skye mched brtag par bstan zin pas yang bstan mi dgos so //
translated: Or, since it has been shown in the Examination of the Media that the seer, etc. are not tenable, it is unnecessary to demonstrate that again.

original: gal te bdag khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bdag khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: If one does not accept the self,

original: de'i khyad par bsal ba'i phyir de phyogs su byed pa mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i khyad par bsal ba'i phyir de phyogs su byed pa mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: it is not proper to take that as a position in order to refute its distinctions.

original: spyi dang dmigs kyis ma bstsal ba mdzad pa'i mtha' gzhan las yongs su bzung ba tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: spyi dang dmigs kyis ma bstsal ba mdzad pa'i mtha' gzhan las yongs su bzung ba tha snyad du khas blangs pa phyogs su byas te /
translated: But, having taken as a position the conventional acceptance of the self, which is not refuted either generally or specifically, and which is accepted in other contexts,

original: de'i khyad par ma grags pa sel bas skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ma grags pa sel bas skyon med do //
translated: there is no fault in clearing up its unknown distinctions.

original: ci ste nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: ci ste nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
translated: But if the proponents of the existence of the appropriator, in order to completely avoid the errors indicated,

original: lta ba po yang gzhan /
analyzed: lta ba po yang gzhan /
translated: conceive that the seer is one thing,

original: nyan pa po yang gzhan /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang gzhan /
translated: the hearer is another,

original: tshor ba po yang gzhan yin par rtog na de lta yang /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang gzhan yin par rtog na de lta yang /
translated: and the feeler is another, then what follows from that?

original: gal te lta po gzhan nyid la //
analyzed: gal te lta po gzhan nyid la //
translated: If the seer were one thing

original: nyan pa po gzhan tshor gzhan na //
analyzed: nyan pa po gzhan tshor gzhan na //
translated: and the hearer another, and the feeler another,

original: zhes bya bas yongs su rtog pas cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩlta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: zhes bya bas yongs su rtog pas cir 'gyur zhe na / lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: then what would be the point of conceiving that?

original: lan 'ga' ste /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ste /
translated: The hearer would exist at the time of the seer,üîΩbecause it would be different from it.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: 'di na gang zhig gang las gzhan yin par shes pa de ni lan 'ga' de ni lan 'ga' de yod na yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di na gang zhig gang las gzhan yin par shes pa de ni lan 'ga' de ni lan 'ga' de yod na yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, whatever is known to be different from something else, it is sometimes nonexistent when that exists.

original: dper na bum pa yod na kham phor yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa yod na kham phor yod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a pot exists, a saucer does not exist.

original: de bzhin du nyan pa po yang lta ba po las gzhan yin no /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan pa po yang lta ba po las gzhan yin no /
translated: In the same way, the hearer is different from the seer.

original: lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur zhing nyan pa po ji lta ba bzhin du snom pa po dang / myang ba po dang / reg pa po dang / sems pa po dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba po yod pa'i tshe na nyan pa po yang yod par 'gyur zhing nyan pa po ji lta ba bzhin du snom pa po dang / myang ba po dang / reg pa po dang / sems pa po dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: When the seer exists, the hearer also exists, and just as the hearer, so also the smeller, the taster, and the toucher, and the one who knows also exist.

original: des na / bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: des na / bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the self would be multiple.

original: rgyud so so la'o //
analyzed: rgyud so so la'o //
translated: In each continuum.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir don dam par rgyud tha dad pa dag gi lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / snom pa po la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir don dam par rgyud tha dad pa dag gi lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / snom pa po la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: But since that is unacceptable, therefore it is untenable that the seer, hearer, and so on are different in ultimate reality in different continua.

original: 'dir yang skabs kyi don la phan pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang skabs kyi don la phan pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa mtshon par bya ste /
translated: Here also, the inference should be illustrated by the meaning of the context.

original: nye bar len pa po lhas byin gyi nyan pa po ni /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po lhas byin gyi nyan pa po ni /
translated: The hearer of the appropriator Lhejin

original: lta ba po las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba po las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: is not different from the seer,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because he is the appropriator who is related as cause and effect.

original: dper na / lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams la rjes su dpag pas gnod do //
analyzed: dper na / lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas gzhan nyid du smra ba rnams la rjes su dpag pas gnod do //
translated: Therefore, the thesis of difference is undermined by inference.

original: yang na / lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //üîΩces bya ba ni lta ba po la brten nas /
analyzed: yang na / lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod // ces bya ba ni lta ba po la brten nas /
translated: Or, the hearer exists at the time of the seer.

original: nyan pa po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan pa po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the hearer arises in dependence on the seer.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: In that case,

original: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: the self would be manifold.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the times, such as the past, are different.

original: @128a * // de ltar gyur na 'dir yang phyir smra bar nus te /
analyzed: @128a * // de ltar gyur na 'dir yang phyir smra bar nus te /
translated: In that case, the opponent can reply as follows:

original: don dam par nye bar len pa po ni nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /üîΩbrten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa po ni nye bar len pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te / brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na /
translated: Ultimately, the appropriator is not the entityness of the appropriator,

original: nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it arises in dependence, like the appropriated aggregates themselves.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi lta ba la sogs pa ni nye bar len pa po lhas byin zhes bya ba'i nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the seeing and so on of Devadatta is not the appropriated aggregates of Devadatta, the appropriator,üîΩbecause it is seen, like Devadatta himself.

original: lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because it is seeing and so on,

original: mchod sbyin gyi lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the self that is the nature of seeing and so on in a sacrifice.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa po nyid dang / nye bar blang ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir yang ji skad smras pa'i skyon dang ma bral lo //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa po nyid dang / nye bar blang ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir yang ji skad smras pa'i skyon dang ma bral lo //
translated: Thus, because the appropriator and that appropriated are not established, the previously stated error is not removed.

original: gal te nye bar len pa po ni de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa po ni de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the appropriator is not to be described as the same as or different from the appropriated, then there is no error.

original: bdag gi yin par brjod pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi yin par brjod pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is no error because the self is described as ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: yang na gang dag bdag lta ba po la sogs pa brjod pa dag phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gi phyogs la /
analyzed: yang na gang dag bdag lta ba po la sogs pa brjod pa dag phung po las gzhan pa nyid du ston pa de dag gi phyogs la /
translated: Moreover, those who describe the self as the seer and so on, who are proponents of the self as being different from the aggregates,

original: lta bo'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: lta bo'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: when it sees, it hears.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: This is the remainder of the verse.

original: 'di la lta bar byed pas lta ba po ste /
analyzed: 'di la lta bar byed pas lta ba po ste /
translated: Here, because it sees, it is the seer.

original: gzugs dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: It is endowed with the observation of form.

original: de ni sgra dmigs pa dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: de ni sgra dmigs pa dang mi ldan te /
translated: It is not endowed with the observation of sound.

original: gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a single thing to have two intrinsic realities.

original: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: If the hearer exists when the seer exists,

original: ces bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: then just as it has been said,

original: snom pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / sems pa po dag kyang yod par gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: snom pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / sems pa po dag kyang yod par gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: if the smeller, the taster, the toucher, and the thinker exist, what would be the consequence?

original: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur /
translated: The self would become multiple.

original: lus dang dbang po'i tshogs gcig la'am /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po'i tshogs gcig la'am /
translated: If the self were to exist, it would be either in the collection of bodies and faculties,üîΩor in the collection of causes and effects.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs gcig la zab bo zhes bya ba'i bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs gcig la zab bo zhes bya ba'i bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the self would become multiple.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir bdag ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /üîΩdmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir bdag ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste / dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: But since that is unacceptable, therefore the self is not established as a single entity.üîΩBecause the objects of observation are different.

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the objects of observation are different,

original: rgyud du ma'i lta ba po bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyud du ma'i lta ba po bzhin no //
translated: like the seer of many different mindstreams.
