original: nye bar len pa po yo dpar smra ba gzhan dag 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yo dpar smra ba gzhan dag 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: Others who assert the appropriator say this:

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang / gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang / gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs pa de la /
translated: In this regard, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThe six sense bases have name-and-form as their condition.‚Äù

original: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas /
analyzed: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas /
translated: Form is the four great elements.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug 'byung la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug 'byung la /
translated: Therefore the six sense bases arise due to the condition of the great elements.

original: 'byung ba de dag kyang nye bar len pa po'i nye bar blang ba yin pas /üîΩde'i phyir nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa lta ba la sogs pa skye mched drug dang ldan pa snga na gnas pa'i rim @128b gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dag 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba de dag kyang nye bar len pa po'i nye bar blang ba yin pas / de'i phyir nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa lta ba la sogs pa skye mched drug dang ldan pa snga na gnas pa'i rim @128b gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dag 'byung ba ni /
translated: And since those elements are appropriated by the appropriator,üîΩthe TathƒÅgata‚Äôs way is that feeling and so on arise in sequence from the earlier six sense bases that possess seeing and so on, which are the appropriator.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul yin na khyed kyis nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul yin na khyed kyis nye bar len pa po de lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag gi snga rol na med de /
translated: But you say that the appropriator does not exist prior to the appropriated such as seeing and so on.

original: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because it is the object of imputation,

original: snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: snam bu rgyu spun dag gi snga rol na med pa bzhin no zhes brjod pas /
translated: for example, like a cloth that does not exist prior to its threads.

original: tshul de dang 'gal bar byed pas /
analyzed: tshul de dang 'gal bar byed pas /
translated: Since you contradict this way,

original: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the opponent is harmed by this, this is not good.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
translated: Seeing, hearing, and so on, and also feeling and so on,

original: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
analyzed: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
translated: do not exist in the elements from which they arise.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist in the elements.

original: rdzas su yod pa nye bar len pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nye bar len pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not established as appropriators that exist substantially.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, how is it that the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúName and form have consciousness as their causal condition‚Äù?

original: tha snyad du ming dang / gzugs dang / de la brten nas nye bar len pa po nyid du gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: tha snyad du ming dang / gzugs dang / de la brten nas nye bar len pa po nyid du gdags par zad kyi /
translated: In conventional terms, the appropriator is imputed in dependence on name and form.

original: don dam par nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa po rdzas su yod pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa med do //
translated: But in an ultimate sense, since we do not accept that name and form exist substantially as the appropriator, the opponent is not harmed.

original: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: yang na / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
translated: Or, seeing, hearing, and so on, and also feeling and so on,

original: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
analyzed: gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
translated: do not exist in the elements from which they arise.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist in the elements.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag gi nye bar len pa po nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence, ‚ÄúThey are established as appropriators of those.‚Äù

original: gal te 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de ji ltar lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub ce na /üîΩ'byung ba nye bar blang ba nye ba len pa'i nye bar len pa po ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar len par bye dpar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i nye bar len pa po de ji ltar lta ba la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa po nyid du mi 'grub ce na / 'byung ba nye bar blang ba nye ba len pa'i nye bar len pa po ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar blang ba dag nye bar len par bye dpar mi rigs te /
translated: If the appropriator of the appropriated primary elements is established as the appropriator of the appropriated view and so on, how is it not established as the appropriator of the appropriated view and so on?üîΩIt is not tenable that the appropriator of the appropriated primary elements is the appropriator of the appropriated view and so on because they are appropriated from another.

original: de dag las gzhan nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i 'byung ba'i nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i dus na lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang /üîΩlta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba'i dus na yang 'byung ba nye bar blang ba dag /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa'i 'byung ba'i nye bar len pa po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba nye bar blang ba'i dus na lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang /üîΩlta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar blang ba'i dus na yang 'byung ba nye bar blang ba dag /
translated: They are like the appropriator of the primary elements of a different continuum. This is because they are appropriated at the time of appropriating the primary elements and because at the time of appropriating the view and so on, the primary elements are not appropriated.

original: nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because it is not that which is appropriated.

original: gal te gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe /
translated: If you say:

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
translated: When seeing, hearing, etc. and feeling, etc.

original: nye bar blang ba dag yin pa de'i tshe na nye bar len pa po zhes smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba dag yin pa de'i tshe na nye bar len pa po zhes smra'o zhe na /
translated: are that which is appropriated, then at that time we say that there is an appropriator.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: lta ba la sogs pa da nye bar blang ba yin pa de'i tshe na yang @129a * //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa da nye bar blang ba yin pa de'i tshe na yang @129a * //
translated: because when seeing, etc. are that which is appropriated, at that time also,

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag 'dus pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: seeing, etc. are not substantially existent because they are merely a collection.

original: gal te ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say: It is just as we maintain.üîΩThen, in response to that, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / gang gi yin pa gal te med //üîΩde dag kyang ni yod pa min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gi yin pa gal te med // de dag kyang ni yod pa min //
translated: If that which is the appropriator does not exist,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: those which are appropriated also do not exist.

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa nyid dang ; rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin na nye bar len pa po nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid kyi lan gdab par dka'o //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas brtags na /üîΩgang zhig lta la sogs pa yi //üîΩsnga rol da ltar phyin med //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa nyid dang ; rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin na nye bar len pa po nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid kyi lan gdab par dka'o // de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas brtags na / gang zhig lta la sogs pa yi // snga rol da ltar phyin med //
translated: If the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.

original: de la yod do med do zhes ;üîΩ/ rtog pa dag ni ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la yod do med do zhes ; / rtog pa dag ni ldog par 'gyur //
translated: If the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.

original: nye bar len pa po gang zhig lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol dang / da ltar dang / phyi na rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub cing 'byung ba'i rdzas bzhin du med pa de lta bu de la don dam par gcig pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po gang zhig lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol dang / da ltar dang / phyi na rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub cing 'byung ba'i rdzas bzhin du med pa de lta bu de la don dam par gcig pa nyid dang /
translated: If the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.

original: gzhan pa nyid du yod do med do zhes bya bar rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du yod do med do zhes bya bar rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the appropriator does not exist, then the appropriated also does not exist.üîΩIf the appropri

original: de la re zhig yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cessation of the conception of existence is because of non-substantiality.

original: med do zhes bya bar med par rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba de med pas rtog pa ldog pa na brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med do zhes bya bar med par rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba de med pas rtog pa ldog pa na brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cessation of the conception of non-existence is because of the cessation of the conception of existence.

original: yang na yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni don don dam par yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na yod do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni don don dam par yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the cessation of the conception of existence is because of the absence of inference that reveals the ultimate existence of objects.

original: med do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni yod pa bsal bas med par rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med do zhes bya bar rtog pa ldog pa ni yod pa bsal bas med par rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cessation of the conception of non-existence is because of the absence of the conception of non-existence that is the negation of existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: blo yis rnam par gzhigs nas ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhigs nas ni //
translated: Having analyzed with the mind,

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
translated: The essence is not apprehended.üîΩTherefore, they are taught to be inexpressible

original: de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid ni med par bstan //üîΩzhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid ni med par bstan //üîΩzhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And to have no essence.

original: de la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag gis rjes su dpag pa las nye bar len pa po yod de /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa po yod par smra ba dag gis rjes su dpag pa las nye bar len pa po yod de /
translated: In response to that, those who say that the appropriator exists argue that the appropriator exists because of inference.

original: de yang nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: de yang nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya zhing /
translated: Moreover, because it appropriates, it is called the appropriator.

original: des nye bar blang ba yin pas nye bar blang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des nye bar blang ba yin pas nye bar blang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: And because it appropriates that, it is called the appropriated.

original: de gnyi ga grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sdang smra pa grub bo zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩde la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni nye bar len pa po yod pa'i gtan tshigs sun dbyung ba brjod pa dang / rang dbang gis rjes su dpag pa brjod pas /
analyzed: de gnyi ga grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sdang smra pa grub bo zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no // de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni nye bar len pa po yod pa'i gtan tshigs sun dbyung ba brjod pa dang / rang dbang gis rjes su dpag pa brjod pas /
translated: Therefore, since both of those are established, the argument of the proponents of the existence of the appropriator is established.

original: nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid @129b du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid @129b du bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this context, the meaning of the chapter is to refute the argument that the appropriator exists and to demonstrate that the appropriator lacks intrinsic existence by stating an independent inference.

original: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la shes pa po 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la shes pa po 'am /
translated: Subh≈´ti, form is not known by the knower,

original: shes par byed pa po med do //
analyzed: shes par byed pa po med do //
translated: nor does it cause knowledge.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
translated: feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, there is no knower.

original: shes par byed pa po med do //
analyzed: shes par byed pa po med do //
translated: There is no knower or

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
translated: maker of consciousness in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: shes par byed pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
analyzed: shes par byed pa po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the absence of a knower or maker of form,üîΩfeeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gzugs la shes pa po'am mthong ba po med do //üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
analyzed: gzugs la shes pa po'am mthong ba po med do // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
translated: There is no knower or seer of form.

original: mthong ba po med do //üîΩgzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
analyzed: mthong ba po med do // gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la shes pa po 'am /
translated: There is no knower or seer of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the absence of a knower or seer of form,

original: mthong ba po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no ;
analyzed: mthong ba po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no ;
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: / slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: / slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: Composed by the master BhƒÅviveka.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel ba shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel ba shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: From the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Root of the Middle Way.

original: nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Examination of the Appropriator and the Appropriated is finished.

original: rab tu byed pa dgu pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the ninth chapter.

original: // / da ni nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa /
analyzed: // / da ni nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa /
translated: Now, in order to refute the distinctions that are discordant with the lack of inherent nature of the appropriator and the appropriated, the dependent origination that possesses the distinction of not being the same object and not being different objects,

original: bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu pa brtsam mo //
translated: the tenth chapter is begun by the power of the meaning to be explained.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'di la khyod kyis nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag phan tshun ltos nas rab tu 'grub par smras pas /
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag phan tshun ltos nas rab tu 'grub par smras pas /
translated: In this regard, you have said that the appropriator and the appropriated are established in mutual dependence.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs rab tu grub pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba nyid dag bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs rab tu grub pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba nyid dag bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa smra bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to prove the appropriator and the appropriated, the proponent of the argument should state a proof on the basis of a well-established reason.

original: don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The appropriator and the appropriated exist ultimately.

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no //
translated: Because they are mutually dependent, like fire and fuel.

original: de'i phyir de grub pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de grub pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas /
translated: Therefore, since that is established, the aggregates and so on exist ultimately.

original: nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the BhagavƒÅn taught the appropriator and the appropriated in dependence on them.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa grub po //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa grub po //
translated: In this way, since the reason is established, the thesis is established.

original: @130a * // 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: @130a * // 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: skye ba spyir bkag pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: skye ba spyir bkag pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Since arising in general is refuted, and form is not observed apart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: form is not observed apart from the cause of form.

original: zhes bya ba der rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas /
translated: Here, since substantial existence is refuted,

original: me dang bud shing dag gi yod pa nyid dgag pa yang grub mod kyi /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag gi yod pa nyid dgag pa yang grub mod kyi /
translated: Although the existence of fire and fuel has been refuted,

original: yang de med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate their nonexistence,

original: sgrub pa gzhan sems gtod la nyon cig /'di la me dang bud shing dag yod pa nyid du 'dod na gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: sgrub pa gzhan sems gtod la nyon cig /'di la me dang bud shing dag yod pa nyid du 'dod na gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: listen to another proof that is being presented: If you assert that fire and fuel exist, you must accept that they are either identical or different.

original: gzhan nyid du khas blang bar bya grang na des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du khas blang bar bya grang na des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: gal te shing de me yin na //
analyzed: gal te shing de me yin na //
translated: If that fire were the fuel,

original: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
translated: then the agent and object would be one.

original: de la bud shing ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba gsum po dag yin la /
analyzed: de la bud shing ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba gsum po dag yin la /
translated: Fuel is the three elements such as earth.

original: me ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: me ni me'i khams so //
translated: Fire is the fire element.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: me ni 'byung ba bzhi po dag las me shas che bar gyur pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: me ni 'byung ba bzhi po dag las me shas che bar gyur pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Fire is the predominance of the fire element among the four elements.

original: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa mngon te /
analyzed: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa mngon te /
translated: Here, because this is a statement that is open to dispute, the opponent‚Äôs proof is reversed and an inference is stated.

original: dper na gal te sgra rtag na bum pa yang rtag par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: dper na gal te sgra rtag na bum pa yang rtag par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: For example, if sound were permanent, it would follow that a pot would be permanent, but that is unacceptable.

original: byas pa nyid la mi rtag pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: byas pa nyid la mi rtag pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin pas /
translated: Because impermanence does not occur without being produced,

original: de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it exists in that.

original: sgra de yang byas pa yin pas de'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: sgra de yang byas pa yin pas de'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: And that sound is produced. Therefore sound is impermanent,

original: byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because it is produced, like a pot, for example.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Here the syllogism is: Ultimately fire and fuel are not the same,

original: byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir dper na gcod pa po dang / bcad pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir dper na gcod pa po dang / bcad pa dag bzhin no //
translated: because one is the agent and the other the object, like the cutter and the cut.

original: me yang bud shing sreg pa'i byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: me yang bud shing sreg pa'i byed pa po yin la /
translated: Fire is the agent that burns fuel,

original: bud shing yang sreg pa na las yin pas /
analyzed: bud shing yang sreg pa na las yin pas /
translated: and fuel is the object that is burned.

original: me dang bud shing dag la yang byed pa po dang las nyid yod pas de'i phyir de nyid gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag la yang byed pa po dang las nyid yod pas de'i phyir de nyid gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since the agent and object exist in fire and fuel, therefore they are not the same.

original: yang na / gal te shing de me yin na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te shing de me yin na //
translated: If the fuel is the fire,

original: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
translated: then the agent and object would be one.

original: de'i phyir bud shing las me gzhan ma yin par dam 'cha' ba'i dam bcas pa la gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas mi tshab dang ; me sreg pa nyid kyis me'i lce dag bstsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod de //
analyzed: de'i phyir bud shing las me gzhan ma yin par dam 'cha' ba'i dam bcas pa la gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas mi tshab dang ; me sreg pa nyid kyis me'i lce dag bstsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod de //
translated: Therefore, since the thesis that ‚Äúthe fire is not different from the fuel‚Äù is contradicted by the inference of oneness, and since the particular subject is contradicted by the exclusion of the fire‚Äôs flame by the burning of the fuel,

original: gal te mthong bas gnod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong bas gnod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is not a contradiction because it is not seen,

original: gcig pa nyid la yang mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid la yang mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be seen that they are one.

original: de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
translated: Since this is completely rejected, it contradicts your philosophical position.

original: de ltar @130b khas ma blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar @130b khas ma blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do //
translated: Since we do not accept this, it does not contradict our position.

original: de ltar re zhig me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus it is not tenable that fire and fuel are one.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid du 'dod na de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid du 'dod na de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: But if you assert that they are different, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
translated: If fire were different from fuel,

original: shing med par ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shing med par ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: But it is not possible for fire to exist without fuel.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because it is different, like something else that is different from it.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the idea.

original: bud shing la mi ltos par me yod do zhes bya ba de ni mngon par zhen pa'i blo can dag kyang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: bud shing la mi ltos par me yod do zhes bya ba de ni mngon par zhen pa'i blo can dag kyang mi 'dod de /
translated: For even those who have a mind that is attached to the notion that fire exists without depending on fuel do not assert that

original: 'dis ni me dang bud shing dag gi chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni me dang bud shing dag gi chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows that fire and fuel have the property of dependence.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bstan par bya ba'i don gyi dbang gis rjes su dpag par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bstan par bya ba'i don gyi dbang gis rjes su dpag par 'dod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the one who wishes to infer the meaning that is to be demonstrated here should say,

original: don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, fire is not different from fuel,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is dependent, like the intrinsic reality of fuel itself.

original: de bzhin du don dam par bud shing yang me las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par bud shing yang me las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, ultimately, fuel is not different from fire,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is dependent, like the intrinsic reality of fire itself.

original: gal te me dang bud shing dag tha dad pa nyid kyis thams cad ltos pa dang bcas pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te me dang bud shing dag tha dad pa nyid kyis thams cad ltos pa dang bcas pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that fire and fuel are different, and that everything that is dependent is not ascertained,

original: de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis mtshungs par bkag pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis mtshungs par bkag pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: then we reply that this is not a fault, because we have refuted them as being the same in the sense of being of the same type.

original: me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas len pa la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de ;
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid du khas len pa la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de ;
translated: There is another fault in the assertion that fire and fuel are different.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that?

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would always be burning.

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //
translated: It would arise without a cause of burning.

original: gal te bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na bud shing la mi ltos par rtag tu 'bar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na bud shing la mi ltos par rtag tu 'bar bar 'gyur te /
translated: If fire were different from fuel, it would burn always without depending on fuel.

original: de la bud shing de med byang 'chi bar mi 'thad cing rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bud shing de med byang 'chi bar mi 'thad cing rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be tenable that it would go out in the absence of fuel, and it would be permanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would arise without a cause of burning.

original: 'bar byed ces bya ba ni bud shing ngo //
analyzed: 'bar byed ces bya ba ni bud shing ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBurning‚Äù is fuel.

original: gang la rgyud yod pa de ni 'bar byed kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang la rgyud yod pa de ni 'bar byed kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: That which has fuel is produced from the cause of burning.

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which is produced without fuel is produced without the cause of burning.

original: gzhan yang 'chi ba yongs su spang pa'i phyir bud shing skam po gzhug pa dang / sbar ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtsom pa dag kyang mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'chi ba yongs su spang pa'i phyir bud shing skam po gzhug pa dang / sbar ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtsom pa dag kyang mi 'thad pas /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that the fuel is ignited and the action of burning exists in order to abandon death.

original: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the action would be pointless.

original: don med pa ni don dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: don med pa ni don dang bral ba'o //
translated: Pointless means devoid of purpose.

original: de'i dngos po ni don med pa nyid de 'bras bu med pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni don med pa nyid de 'bras bu med pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Its state is pointlessness, which is to say, the absence of a result.

original: de lta yin na las kyang med //
analyzed: de lta yin na las kyang med //
translated: If that were so, then there would be no karma.

original: las med pa ni las yod pa ma yin pa @131a * //
analyzed: las med pa ni las yod pa ma yin pa @131a * //
translated: The absence of karma means that karma does not exist.

original: ste ; bud shing la mi ltos par 'byung zhing gnas pas bsreg par bya ba sreg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las med pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ste ; bud shing la mi ltos par 'byung zhing gnas pas bsreg par bya ba sreg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las med pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Since it would arise and endure without depending on fuel, it is unacceptable that the action of burning, which has the characteristic of burning the object to be burned, would not exist.

original: grong mi'i bud med yan chad la yang me ni rgyu dang ldan pa nyid dang / rtsom pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / las dang bcas pa nyid du grags par 'dod pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar nus te /
analyzed: grong mi'i bud med yan chad la yang me ni rgyu dang ldan pa nyid dang / rtsom pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / las dang bcas pa nyid du grags par 'dod pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar nus te /
translated: Because it is well known that fire possesses a cause, possesses an undertaking, and possesses an action, even in the case of a village woman, therefore it is possible to state an inference.

original: don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par me ni bud shing las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, fire is not different from fuel,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / las dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / las dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bud shing gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin te /
translated: because it possesses a cause, because it possesses an undertaking, and because it possesses an action, just like the self of fuel itself.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de bzhin du bud shing gi phyogs la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bud shing gi phyogs la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, it should be stated in the case of fuel.

original: bud shing la yang gzugs par bya ba la sogs pa'i las yod pa'i phyir las dang bcas pa nyid du grub pas bud shing gi gtan tshigs dang dpe nyid ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bud shing la yang gzugs par bya ba la sogs pa'i las yod pa'i phyir las dang bcas pa nyid du grub pas bud shing gi gtan tshigs dang dpe nyid ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because fuel also has an action, such as the action of being burned, it is established as possessing an action. Therefore the reason and example of fuel are not unestablished.

original: de la 'di snyam du ci'i phyir 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang ; rtsom pa don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ci'i phyir 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang ; rtsom pa don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúWhy is it that it would arise without a cause and it would follow that undertaking would be pointless?‚Äù

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it would not depend on another,

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //
translated: it would arise without a cause.

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na //
translated: If it were always burning,

original: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: it would follow that undertaking would be pointless.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it would not depend on another,

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: it would arise without a cause.

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na rtsom pa don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na rtsom pa don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were always burning, it would follow that undertaking would be pointless.

original: ji ste pha rol po dag slob dpon gyis me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin pa'i skyon brjod pas /
analyzed: ji ste pha rol po dag slob dpon gyis me dang bud shing dag gzhan nyid yin pa'i skyon brjod pas /
translated: But if the opponent wants to avoid the fault that the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states,

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: it would follow that it would always be burning,üîΩand so on, and the consequences that are taught,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gsungs pa ji skad bstan par thal bar 'gyur ba dag yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gsungs pa ji skad bstan par thal bar 'gyur ba dag yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
translated: then he should not say that fire and fuel are different.

original: de la gal te 'di snyam du //üîΩsreg bzhin bud shing yin sems na //
analyzed: de la gal te 'di snyam du // sreg bzhin bud shing yin sems na //
translated: But if you thinküîΩthat the burning is the fuel,

original: mes khyab cing sreg bzhin pa nyid na de bud shing zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: mes khyab cing sreg bzhin pa nyid na de bud shing zhes bya zhing /
translated: If you think that when it is pervaded by fire and is burning, it is called fuel,

original: me la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i bud shing nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i bud shing nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: and that the fuel is established as dependent on fire,

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon med do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon med do snyam du sems na /
translated: then the error of the consequence does not arise.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: glags yod pa'i tshig nye bar bzhag pa brjod pas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pas glags yod pa'i skyon gyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: glags yod pa'i tshig nye bar bzhag pa brjod pas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pas glags yod pa'i skyon gyi gzhi'o //
translated: Because you have stated a fallacious argument, you have committed the error of a fallacy, since you have taught four kinds of fallacies.

original: gzhan nyid mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that they are different,

original: dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then your thesis is undermined.üîΩMoreover, listen to this:

original: gzhan yang nyon cig / gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon cig / gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
translated: If that much is it,

original: @131b gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
analyzed: @131b gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
translated: by what is that fuel burned?

original: gang gi tshe me'i rkyen gyis 'bar ba dang bcas pa de tsam du bud shing de yin par brjod na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe me'i rkyen gyis 'bar ba dang bcas pa de tsam du bud shing de yin par brjod na /
translated: When you say that that much is fuel, because it is burning with the condition of fire,

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed /
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed /
translated: by what is that fuel burned?

original: tha snyad du yang 'ba' zhig byung ba la ni bud shing zhes brjod cing 'bar ba dang bcas pa la ni me zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du yang 'ba' zhig byung ba la ni bud shing zhes brjod cing 'bar ba dang bcas pa la ni me zhes bya'o //
translated: and when it occurs only conventionally, it is called fuel.

original: don dam par ni skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, because arising is refuted.

original: skyes su zin na yang de tsam yin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la khyab par byed par 'thad de /
analyzed: skyes su zin na yang de tsam yin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la khyab par byed par 'thad de /
translated: Even if it did arise, because it would be just that much, by what and in what would it be tenable to pervade?

original: de'i phyir tshig de ni rang gi blo gros yang bar ston pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig de ni rang gi blo gros yang bar ston pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, this statement is merely an indication of your own feeble intellect.

original: yang na 'di ni rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, this is another interpretation of the opponent‚Äôs position:

original: 'di la byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gis sreg bzhin pa na bud shing zhes bya grang na de yang sgrub pa sngar bstan bas rdzas su yod pa nyid brtsal ba'i phyir med pas /
analyzed: 'di la byed pa po me'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gis sreg bzhin pa na bud shing zhes bya grang na de yang sgrub pa sngar bstan bas rdzas su yod pa nyid brtsal ba'i phyir med pas /
translated: If the characteristic of the agent, fire, is burning, it is called fuel. But since the existence of that as a real substance has been refuted by the previously explained argument,

original: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
analyzed: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
translated: when it is just that much, it is that.

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
translated: By what and in what would it be tenable to burn fuel?

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de tsam sreg pa dang / tshos pa dang / snang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ma yin pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam dro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi reg pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de tsam sreg pa dang / tshos pa dang / snang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ma yin pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: When the mere collection of form and so on possesses the special contact that has the characteristic of heat, it is the cause of the effects of burning, cooking, and illumination, but not when it does not.

original: yang na bud shing ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las me shas che bar ma gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na bud shing ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las me shas che bar ma gyur pa 'am /
translated: Or else, fuel is the four great elements when the fire element is not predominant,

original: gsum po dag yin par brjod la /
analyzed: gsum po dag yin par brjod la /
translated: or else it is the three elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'am gsum po de dag kyang bsreg par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'am gsum po de dag kyang bsreg par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Those four or three great elements are what is burned,

original: sreg par byed pa dag ma yin la /üîΩme yang 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: sreg par byed pa dag ma yin la / me yang 'byung ba 'am /
translated: but they are not what burns.

original: 'byung ba 'dus pa yin par pha rol po dag gis kyang shes pas de'i phyir yang nges par bya nus te /
analyzed: 'byung ba 'dus pa yin par pha rol po dag gis kyang shes pas de'i phyir yang nges par bya nus te /
translated: And the fire element is also understood by others to be an element or a composite of elements.

original: don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is possible to ascertain that ultimately fire does not burn fuel,

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is an element, like water and so on.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid dang rags pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa nyid dang / phyi rol pa nyid dang / skye ba can nyid dang / rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid dang rags pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa nyid dang / phyi rol pa nyid dang / skye ba can nyid dang / rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, you should state the reasons, ‚ÄúBecause it is associated with form and so on, because it is gross, because it is included in the aggregate of form, because it is external, because it is produced, and because it has causes.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'thad pas /üîΩgang tshe de tsam de yin na //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'thad pas / gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
translated: Therefore, in this way, since it is untenable that fire ultimately burns,üîΩIf that is fire,

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
translated: By what is that fuel burned?üîΩWhen fire is conventionally called ‚Äúfuel,‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba'i khyad par la ltos nas /
translated: it is in dependence on a specific arising.

original: tha snyad du me 'am bud shing zhes brjod pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'dus pa de tsam me 'am bud shing de yin na gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed /
analyzed: tha snyad du me 'am bud shing zhes brjod pa'i tshe 'byung ba 'dus pa de tsam me 'am bud shing de yin na gang gis bud shing de sreg par byed /
translated: If that mere collection of elements is fire or fuel, by what is that fuel burned?

original: @132a * // de lta bas na sreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @132a * // de lta bas na sreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus it is not logical to say that when it is burning, it is fuel.

original: gal te sa la sogs pa dag dbyer med par gnas pa la /
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa dag dbyer med par gnas pa la /
translated: If you say that the example is not established because the elements earth and so on exist in a state of nonseparation,

original: sreg par byed pa me'i khams yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sreg par byed pa me'i khams yod pa'i phyir /
translated: and because the fire element burns them,

original: dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no zhe na /üîΩde yang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no zhe na / de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: then the example is not established.

original: sa la sogs pa dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dpe nyid du grub pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: But that is not so, because the example is established by the mere similarity of type, or because the elements earth and so on are established as the example by their intrinsic identity.üîΩThere is no fault.

original: grags pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa dag gi skyon yang med de /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod pa la sogs pa dag gi skyon yang med de /
translated: There is no fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged and so on,

original: sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this has already been addressed.

original: bye brag pa dag na re /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag na re /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say:

original: rdul phran de bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa la bdag dang ldan pa ma mthong bas bskyed pa'i las kyi rdul phran de bdag gi phyogs dang phral nas rdul phran gzhan dang phrad par bya ste /üîΩphrad pa rdul phran gnyis kyis gnas su byed do //
analyzed: rdul phran de bdag gi phyogs dang phrad pa la bdag dang ldan pa ma mthong bas bskyed pa'i las kyi rdul phran de bdag gi phyogs dang phral nas rdul phran gzhan dang phrad par bya ste / phrad pa rdul phran gnyis kyis gnas su byed do //
translated: Since the atom that is in contact with the self is not seen to possess the self, the atom generated by the action of the self is separated from the self and comes into contact with another atom.üîΩThe contact of the two atoms is the place where the second atom is generated.

original: rdul phran phrad pa dang bcas pa de gnyis kyis rdul phran gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: rdul phran phrad pa dang bcas pa de gnyis kyis rdul phran gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed do //
translated: The two atoms in contact generate a substance called a dyad.üîΩThe second atom, by the process already explained, comes into contact with another atom and generates a substance called a dyad atom.

original: rdul phran gnyis pas kyang ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas rdul phran dang phrad pas rdul phran gnyis pa'i rdul phran zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas brtsams pa me nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir me yin la /
analyzed: rdul phran gnyis pas kyang ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas rdul phran dang phrad pas rdul phran gnyis pa'i rdul phran zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis snang byed kyi rdzas brtsams pa me nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir me yin la /
translated: In this way, the substance of fire is generated in stages. Since it is related to fire, it is fire.

original: de bzhin du bsreg bya yang bud shing nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir bud shing yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsreg bya yang bud shing nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir bud shing yin te /
translated: Similarly, since the fuel is related to the fire, it is fuel.

original: de gnyis ni rgyu dang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩde dag kyang /
analyzed: de gnyis ni rgyu dang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin no zhes zer ro // de dag kyang /
translated: Because these two are cause and effect, they are mutually dependent.üîΩWe will refute them in detail with the arguments already presented,

original: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
translated: such as: If fire were different from fuel,

original: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes ba la sogs pa rgyas par ji skad bstan pa dag gis dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes ba la sogs pa rgyas par ji skad bstan pa dag gis dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: It would arise without fuel.

original: don dam par snang byed ni me ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par snang byed ni me ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, one should not hold that the illuminator is fire,

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because it is an element, like

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba dag bzhin no //
translated: the other elements.

original: rtsom pa dgag pa yang don dam par me'i rdul phra rab dag ni me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsom pa dgag pa yang don dam par me'i rdul phra rab dag ni me zhes bya ba'i rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, in the ultimate sense, the subtle particles of fire do not compose the substance called ‚Äúfire,‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i rdul phra rab dag bzhin no //
translated: because they are subtle particles, like the other subtle particles.

original: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /üîΩci gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin / ci gzhan dag rtsom par byed pa yin nam /
translated: What is the meaning of this thesis?üîΩDo you mean that others compose it?

original: rtsom par mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: rtsom par mi byed pa yin /
translated: Or do you mean that it is not composed?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni @132b dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar na ni @132b dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: If it is as in the first hypothesis, then your thesis is undermined.

original: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar na ni dpe med do zhe na /
translated: If it is as in the second hypothesis, then there is no example.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / brtag pa phyi ma la yang sa la sogs pa me rtsom par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag las gang yang rung ba dpe nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / brtag pa phyi ma la yang sa la sogs pa me rtsom par byed pa ma yin par grub pa dag las gang yang rung ba dpe nyid yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because you do not accept the first hypothesis, and because in the second hypothesis, any one of the elements such as earth, which are established as not beginning fire, is itself an example.

original: yang na don dam par me ni me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na don dam par me ni me'i rdul phra rab dag gis brtsams pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, ultimately fire is not to be apprehended as beginning with the particles of fire,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na chu bzhin no //
translated: because it is an effect, like water.

original: de bzhin du byas pa nyid dang / chud za ba nyid dang skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du byas pa nyid dang / chud za ba nyid dang skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o ;
translated: In the same way, the arguments that it is produced, perishable, and subject to arising should be stated.

original: / grangs can dag ni snying stobs dang rdul shas che ba'i sgra dang / rig pa dang / gzugs dag ni me yin la /
analyzed: / grangs can dag ni snying stobs dang rdul shas che ba'i sgra dang / rig pa dang / gzugs dag ni me yin la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that sound, touch, and form that are predominantly sattva and rajas are fire.

original: mun pa shas che ba ni bud shing yin par smra zhing des de la khyab par 'dod pas /
analyzed: mun pa shas che ba ni bud shing yin par smra zhing des de la khyab par 'dod pas /
translated: They say that that which is predominantly tamas is fuel, and they assert that fire pervades it.

original: bud shing gi rgyus me 'byung bas bud shing rgyu yin pa'i phyir me ni bud shing la ltos pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: bud shing gi rgyus me 'byung bas bud shing rgyu yin pa'i phyir me ni bud shing la ltos pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Since fire arises from the cause of fuel, fire depends on fuel because fuel is its cause.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yongs su spangs so zhes zer na /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yongs su spangs so zhes zer na /
translated: Thus they say that the error of nihilism is completely avoided.

original: de dag kyang don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par me ni bud shing sreg par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But in response to that, we say that ultimately fire does not burn fuel because

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
translated: it is an element, just like water and so on. This should be refuted as before.

original: ci ste dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid dam ngo bo nyid med par rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid dam ngo bo nyid med par rtog na /
translated: If, after analyzing the meaning of the thesis, you think that it is neither essentially existent nor essentially nonexistent,

original: phyogs snga ma la gnod pa 'am dpe med do zhes rgol bar byed na /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma la gnod pa 'am dpe med do zhes rgol bar byed na /
translated: then you should not argue that the opponent‚Äôs position is flawed or that there is no example.

original: de la 'dir dgag pa de ni sreg pa nyid dgag pa kho nas mthu zad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sreg pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra'i don ni sgra gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: de la 'dir dgag pa de ni sreg pa nyid dgag pa kho nas mthu zad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sreg pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra'i don ni sgra gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med la /
translated: Here, the refutation is only the exhaustion of the power of the refutation of burning, and since the meaning of the word is to be indicated by another word, the opponent‚Äôs position is not undermined.

original: sa la sogs pa sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par grub pa dag nyid dpe yin pa'i phyir dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par grub pa dag nyid dpe yin pa'i phyir dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And since the examples are just earth and so on, which are established as not having the nature of burning, there is no absence of examples.

original: dpyad pa rgyas pas chog go //
analyzed: dpyad pa rgyas pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extensive analysis.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na //üîΩsreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na // sreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
translated: If fire is different from fuel, it would not contact it.üîΩIf it did not contact it, it would not burn.

original: 'chi bar mi 'gyur mi 'chi na //
analyzed: 'chi bar mi 'gyur mi 'chi na //
translated: If it did not burn, it would not be extinguished.

original: rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas //üîΩme gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad de /
analyzed: rang gi rtags dang ldan par gnas // me gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad de /
translated: It would remain with its own characteristics.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na de nyid bud shing dang ma phrad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na de nyid bud shing dang ma phrad pa bzhin no //
translated: If fire is different from fuel, it would not contact fuel, because it is different, like that very fuel not contacting fuel.

original: phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phrad pa med na sreg par mi 'gyur te /

translated: How could fire be different from fuel or not different?üîΩIt is thought that if one

analyzed: de de las gzhan yin par dam 'cha' ba la ni ji skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar dgongs so //

analyzed: gzhan nyid rang la ma grub pa'i phyir dang mi phrad par bstan par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de dag yod pa'i phyir dngos kyi don grub bo //

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te shing ltos me yin la //

analyzed: gal te me ltos shing yin na //

original: gang la ltos pa'i me dang shing //
analyzed: gang la ltos pa'i me dang shing //

analyzed: ci ste yang bud shing dang por grub pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na de'i phyir bshad pa /

original: me grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: me grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur //

analyzed: de ltar rtog pa la / bud par bya ba'i shing la yang //

analyzed: me med par ni 'gyur ba yin //

original: don dam par bud shing ni me'i snga rol na grub pa med de /
analyzed: don dam par bud shing ni me'i snga rol na grub pa med de /

original: @134b 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: @134b 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba dang por grub pa ma yin mod kyi /

analyzed: /'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te dngos po gang ltos 'grub //
analyzed: gal te dngos po gang ltos 'grub //
translated: If things are established in dependence,

original: de nyid la yang ltos nas ni //üîΩltos bya gang yin de grub na //
analyzed: de nyid la yang ltos nas ni // ltos bya gang yin de grub na //
translated: Then in dependence on whatüîΩWould that which is established exist?

original: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
translated: In dependence on what would that which is established exist?

original: dang po zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //üîΩgal te khyod 'dod pa ltar me'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa ni bud shing la ltos nas 'grub cing me de nyid la yang ltos nas me 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba bud shing gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o // gal te khyod 'dod pa ltar me'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa ni bud shing la ltos nas 'grub cing me de nyid la yang ltos nas me 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba bud shing gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang yin pa
translated: The remainder of the sentence is ‚Äúfirst.‚ÄùüîΩIf, as you assert, the thing characterized as fire is established in dependence on fuel, and in dependence on that fire itself, fire is established, then in dependence on what would that which is established exist?

original: de 'grub na gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'grub na gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: In dependence on what would that which is established exist?

original: gang yang rung ba me nyid dam bud shing nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba me nyid dam bud shing nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is not established that any of them is fire or fuel.

original: rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni phan tshun ltos pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni phan tshun ltos pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that arising from their own causes is not established as mutually dependent.

original: des na ba lang gi rva'i dpe nyid la yang gtam de nyid du 'gyur te /üîΩde gnyis la yang gang la ltos nas gzhan gang yang rung ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i g-yas pa'am /
analyzed: des na ba lang gi rva'i dpe nyid la yang gtam de nyid du 'gyur te / de gnyis la yang gang la ltos nas gzhan gang yang rung ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i g-yas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the same argument applies to the example of the ox‚Äôs horns.

original: g-yon par grags pa gang yin /
analyzed: g-yon par grags pa gang yin /
translated: In the case of those two, which is the right horn and which is the left horn, in dependence on which any of them is established as the other?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po ltos grub gang yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po ltos grub gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever things are established in dependence

original: de ma grub na ji ltar ltos //
analyzed: de ma grub na ji ltar ltos //
translated: How could they be established without a basis?

original: ma grub pa ni ltos par mi byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ltos par mi byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that that which is not established does not serve as a basis.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par me ma grub pa ni bud shing la ltos par mi byed de ;
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par me ma grub pa ni bud shing la ltos par mi byed de ;
translated: Here the inference is: Fire that is not established ultimately does not serve as a basis for fuel,

original: me nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: me nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because it is not established as fire, like anything else.

original: pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po dag rang gi tshul la gnod pa bcab pa'i phyir /
translated: The opponent is trying to conceal the fault in his own position.

original: ji ste grub pa ltos she na /
analyzed: ji ste grub pa ltos she na /
translated: If you say that it is established in dependence,

original: de skad zer na de lta na yang de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de skad zer na de lta na yang de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: then even so, it is not tenable that it exists in dependence.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bstsal ba'i phyir des na med par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid kyis med pa nyid bstsal ba'i phyir des na med par smra ba rnams kyi dam bcas pa la chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since the existence of fire is inferred through its dependence, the opponent‚Äôs thesis is undermined by the fact that fire is not nonexistent. Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs thesis is undermined by the fact that the subject is nonexistent.

original: yang na / de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na / de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: Or, it is not tenable that it exists in dependence.

original: med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Because it does not exist, like a sky flower.

original: yang na de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: Or, it is not tenable that it exists in dependence.

original: bud shing @135a * //
analyzed: bud shing @135a * //
translated: Fuel

original: de ni me la ltos par mi rigs te de bzhin du med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni me la ltos par mi rigs te de bzhin du med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: It is not tenable that fuel depends on fire because it does not exist in that way, like something else.

original: de bzhin du me'i phyogs la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i phyogs la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said about the position of fire.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na /
translated: Therefore, when this is investigated,

original: shing la ltos pa'i me med de //
analyzed: shing la ltos pa'i me med de //
translated: fire that depends on fuel does not exist.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bud shing me la mi ltos par bud shing nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bud shing me la mi ltos par bud shing nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as previously explained, fuel does not exist without depending on fire.

original: shing la ma ltos me yang med //
analyzed: shing la ma ltos me yang med //
translated: Fire does not exist without depending on fuel.

original: rgyu tha dad pa dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because different causes are not established as being different, and because difference is refuted.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: me la ltos pa'i shing med de //
analyzed: me la ltos pa'i shing med de //
translated: Fuel does not exist in dependence on fire.

original: me la ma ltos shing yang med //
analyzed: me la ma ltos shing yang med //
translated: Fire does not exist without depending on fuel.

original: ltos pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because dependence is refuted and because difference is refuted.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
analyzed: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
translated: Fire does not come from another.

original: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference is refuted, because going is refuted, and because substantial existence is refuted.

original: bud shing dang bcas par ram bud shing med par 'ong bar brtag na /
analyzed: bud shing dang bcas par ram bud shing med par 'ong bar brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that fire comes with fuel or without fuel,

original: gnyi ga la yang 'ong ba mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang 'ong ba mi 'grub ste /
translated: in both cases coming is not established.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med na bud shing med pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med na bud shing med pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is dependent is not established, and because if it is not dependent, then since there is no fuel, there is no basis.

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel.

original: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference is refuted.

original: yang na bud shing me med pa nyid phyogs su byas te bshad pa /
analyzed: yang na bud shing me med pa nyid phyogs su byas te bshad pa /
translated: Or else, taking the position that fuel does not exist without fire, he explains:

original: shing la 'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la 'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel.

original: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because it is produced, like consciousness.

original: gang dag me ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dpe la yang de yod par smra ba de dag la yang /
analyzed: gang dag me ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dpe la yang de yod par smra ba de dag la yang /
translated: But those who say that fire has the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas, and that it exists in the example,

original: de la gsal ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gsal ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: for them, it is not the case that there is no example, because there is a thing that has the distinction of clarity in that.

original: gal te de'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because its power exists,üîΩthen it follows that the example is not established.

original: lan de ni rtog ge pa sgra'i mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa la de mngon par mi shes pa nyid du bstan pa na /
analyzed: lan de ni rtog ge pa sgra'i mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa la de mngon par mi shes pa nyid du bstan pa na /
translated: The answer is that when a logician who does not understand the definition of sound is taught that he does not understand it,üîΩ

original: rtog ge'i bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyis sgra'i mtshan nyid la mkhas so zhes phyir zlog par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog ge'i bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyis sgra'i mtshan nyid la mkhas so zhes phyir zlog par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: The answer is like the case of a logician who does not understand the definition of a sound logical reason, and when it is shown that he does not understand it, he replies, ‚ÄúI am an expert in the science of logic.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni /
translated: Others explain the verse as follows:

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do //üîΩgzhan ma yin pa na re /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do // gzhan ma yin pa na re /
translated: Because it is not perceived and because the statement would be pointless.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Others say that this is not correct,

original: mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi @135b 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis yod pa nyid du ston pa mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi @135b 'grub pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis yod pa nyid du ston pa mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonperception is not established as a logical reason, and because it contradicts the conclusion that existence is shown by the logical reason of the point of composition.

original: me dang bud shing dag ji skad bstan pa'i dgag pa dag 'ba' zhig gis dgag par bya ba yin par ma bsams kyi /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag ji skad bstan pa'i dgag pa dag 'ba' zhig gis dgag par bya ba yin par ma bsams kyi /
translated: Fire and fuel are not only refuted by the refutations already explained,üîΩbut they are also refuted by other refutations. Therefore, the remaining refutations should be understood to be similar.
