original: 'di ltar dgag pa gzhan dag gis kyang dgag par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir dgag pa lhag ma dag kyang 'dra bar bstan par bya ste /üîΩsong dang ma song bgom pa yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar dgag pa gzhan dag gis kyang dgag par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir dgag pa lhag ma dag kyang 'dra bar bstan par bya ste / song dang ma song bgom pa yis //
translated: The remaining refutations should be understood to be similar.

original: de bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
analyzed: de bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
translated: The remaining refutations should be understood to be similar.üîΩJust as it was explained that going does not exist on that being gone over, on that already gone over, and on that not yet gone over,

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa las song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pa la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du bsregs pa dang ; ma bsregs pa dang / sreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med de /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa las song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pa la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du bsregs pa dang ; ma bsregs pa dang / sreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med de /
translated: so burning does not exist on that being burned, on that already burned, and on that not yet burned.

original: bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsregs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsregs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because they are objects of burning, they are like that which is being burned.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa las /
translated: Just as it was explained that going does not exist on that being gone over, on that already gone over, and on that not yet gone over,

original: 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa de dag las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du don dam par sreg pa po dang / sreg pa po ma yin pa dang / de dag las gzhan pa yang sreg par mi byed pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa de dag las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi byed par bstan pa de bzhin du don dam par sreg pa po dang / sreg pa po ma yin pa dang / de dag las gzhan pa yang sreg par mi byed pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Just as it has been shown that neither the goer nor the nongoer goes, so it should be shown that in reality neither the burner nor the nonburner nor anything else burns.

original: bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang // sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir dang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir bong ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang // sreg pa po ma yin pa'i phyir dang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir bong ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because it would have two actions, because it would not be a burner, and because both errors would follow, like a donkey.

original: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
analyzed: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
translated: Fire is not wood.

original: gcig pa nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because oneness has been refuted earlier.

original: shing las gzhan la me yang med //
analyzed: shing las gzhan la me yang med //
translated: Fire is not separate from wood.

original: gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because separateness has been refuted earlier.

original: me ni shing dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: me ni shing dang ldan ma yin //
translated: Fire is not possessed of wood.

original: ji ltar rtsva'i dra ba ba lang dang ldan pa ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rtsva'i dra ba ba lang dang ldan pa ltar ro //
translated: Like a cow is possessed of a rope.

original: me la shing med /
analyzed: me la shing med /
translated: Wood is not in fire.

original: ji ltar rdza bo na rgya shug dag ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rdza bo na rgya shug dag ltar ro //
translated: Like jujubes are in a pot.

original: der de med /
analyzed: der de med /
translated: It is not in that.

original: ji ltar chu nang padma dag ltar te /
analyzed: ji ltar chu nang padma dag ltar te /
translated: Just as a lotus in water.

original: gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bstan pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of difference has already been taught.

original: de'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar me dang bud shing dag ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since fire and fuel are not established in that way, the example does not exist.

original: rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In the first chapter, it was said, ‚ÄúIn the ultimate truth, the appropriator and that appropriated exist,

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi lan gdab par dka'o //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir dper na me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de'i dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi lan gdab par dka'o //
translated: because they are mutually dependent, just like fire and fuel.‚Äù Since the example is incomplete, it is difficult to respond.

original: des na don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len @136a * //
analyzed: des na don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas nye bar len @136a * //
translated: Therefore, the root of the proof, ‚ÄúIn the ultimate truth, the aggregates and so on exist,

original: pa po dang / nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i rtsa ba ma grub bo //
analyzed: pa po dang / nye bar blang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i rtsa ba ma grub bo //
translated: because the BhagavƒÅn taught the appropriator and that appropriated in dependence on them,‚Äù is not established.üîΩJust as the suchness and difference of fire and fuel are refuted,

original: ji ltar me dang bud shing dag gi de nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar me dang bud shing dag gi de nyid dang gzhan nyid bkag pa de bzhin du /
translated: so too,

original: me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
translated: Fire and fuel, and all the stages of self andüîΩappropriation,

original: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //
translated: are explained in their entirety

original: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu /üîΩma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu / ma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
translated: together with the pot, cloth, and so on.

original: rim pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The term ‚Äústages‚Äù means ‚Äúaspects of negation.‚Äù

original: thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do //
translated: All are explained in their entirety.

original: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the self is not identical with the appropriated aggregates,

original: byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are the object of action and the agent.

original: dper na / gcod pa po dang / bcad pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / gcod pa po dang / bcad pa dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the one who cuts and that which is cut.

original: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag ni nye bar blang ba las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the self is not different from the appropriated aggregates,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nye bar blang ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nye bar blang ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they are related and because they are entities. For example, it is like the self of the appropriated aggregates themselves.

original: de bzhin du don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, in the ultimate sense, the appropriated aggregates are not identical with the self,

original: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are the object of action and the agent.

original: dper na bcad pa dang gcod pa po dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bcad pa dang gcod pa po dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cut and the cutter.

original: don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nye bar blang ba ni bdag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: In an ultimate sense, the appropriated is not different from the self,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is dependent and because it is a thing, just like the self itself.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de /
translated: In an ultimate sense, the self of Devadatta does not appropriate the appropriated of Devadatta,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is dependent.

original: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like something else.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag gi nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag gi nye bar blang ba ma yin te /
translated: In an ultimate sense, the appropriated of Devadatta is not the appropriated of the self of Devadatta,

original: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is an appropriation, just like the appropriated of Yajnadatta.

original: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa ni lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba la ltos par mi byed de /
translated: In an ultimate sense, the self of Devadatta, whether it is established or not, does not depend on the appropriated of Devadatta,üîΩbecause it is a self, just like the self of Yajnadatta.

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the self, like the self of Yaj√±adatta.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba ni lhas byin gyi bdag grub pa dang ma grub pa'i ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the appropriated aggregates of Devadatta are not the object of dependence for the establishment or nonestablishment of Devadatta‚Äôs self,

original: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are appropriated aggregates,

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar blang ba bzhin no //
translated: like the appropriated aggregates of Yaj√±adatta.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: lhas byin gyi bdag lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de zhes bya ba de'i @136b don gang yin /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi bdag lhas byin gyi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par mi byed de zhes bya ba de'i @136b don gang yin /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of the statement ‚ÄòThe self of Devadatta does not appropriate the aggregates of Devadatta‚Äô?‚Äù

original: ci gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that something else appropriates them?

original: 'on te ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin /
translated: Or is it that nothing at all appropriates them?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
analyzed: gal te gzhan nye bar len par byed pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
translated: If it is that something else appropriates them, then the opponent‚Äôs position is undermined.

original: ci ste ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: ci ste ci yang nye bar len par mi byed pa yin na ni dpe med de /
translated: But if it is that nothing at all appropriates them, then there is no example.

original: mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni rang gi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni rang gi nye bar blang ba nye bar len par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self is the master of the sacrifice because it appropriates the appropriated aggregates.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been answered.

original: me dang bud shing de dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: me dang bud shing de dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
translated: The order of the self and the appropriated in relation to fire and fuel is explained in the same way as the order of the pot and cloth and so on.

original: de la bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can du gyur pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa rnam pa de lta bu dag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / yan lag dang yan lag can du gyur pa dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can du gyur pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa rnam pa de lta bu dag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the pot, cloth, and so on should be understood as cause and effect, as part and whole, as quality and qualified, and as definition and definiendum.

original: de la re zhig don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, first, a pot is not identical to clay in the ultimate sense.

original: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na bcad pa dang / gcod pa po dag bzhin no //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na bcad pa dang / gcod pa po dag bzhin no //
translated: because it is an action and an agent, like, for example, cutting and the cutter.

original: don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: A pot is not different from clay ultimately,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir /
translated: because it is dependent and because of the reasons such as effect.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the intrinsic nature of clay.

original: de bzhin du 'jim pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jim pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should state [the reasons] in regard to the parts of clay and so forth.

original: grangs can dag ni bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: grangs can dag ni bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis bum pa ni 'jim pa las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that a pot is not different from clay because of the mode of proof.

original: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang / spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid dang / yul la sogs pa gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang / spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid dang / yul la sogs pa gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is the intrinsic nature of clay, it exists, it is a cause and effect, it is a universal and an instance, and it is the same as its object and so forth.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, like the intrinsic nature of clay.

original: de dag gi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang / bum pa'i bdag nyid dag rang gi bdag nyid dang gcig pa nyid du dbu ma smra ba rnams la ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do //
analyzed: de dag gi 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang / bum pa'i bdag nyid dag rang gi bdag nyid dang gcig pa nyid du dbu ma smra ba rnams la ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do //
translated: and the nature of the clay and the nature of the pot are not established for the Madhyamikas as being the same nature, so there is no example.

original: dam bcas pa'i don yang rnam par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don yang rnam par brtag par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the thesis should be analyzed.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ces bya ba dus gcig na'o zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la @137a * //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ces bya ba dus gcig na'o zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la @137a * //
translated: If the cause and effect are the same, it is one time, but then the opponent is harmed.

original: gnod do // ci ste rgyu'i gsal ba 'bras bu la yod do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnod do // ci ste rgyu'i gsal ba 'bras bu la yod do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the manifestation of the cause exists in the effect, then it is harmed by what is renowned,

original: zho la 'o ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zho la 'o ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because milk does not exist in curd.

original: gal te de'i gnas skabs na yang drug ldan la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i sgra la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de'i gnas skabs na yang drug ldan la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i sgra la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir grags pa'i gnod par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúEven at that time, sound and so on exist without the particularities of being endowed with the six and so on, so it is not harmed by what is renowned,

original: khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med do zhe na /
translated: and it is also not harmed by what is accepted,‚Äù

original: de dag la 'o ma nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ni lam ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la 'o ma nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de ni lam ma yin no //
translated: that is not a path because it is untenable that those are milk.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas rgyu ma yin pa nyid la sogs pas de dag rgyu yin pa nyid la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas rgyu ma yin pa nyid la sogs pas de dag rgyu yin pa nyid la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Since the non-existence of a cause, etc. is inferred to be non-different from the existence of a cause, etc., the thesis is faulty because the nature of the subject and its distinction are refuted.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na yang skyon snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa'i rgyu phyogs su byed na yang skyon snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If the present and past are taken as the subject, the same fault arises.

original: rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: The reason is not established and is contradictory, because of the non-ascertainment of the non-arisen and the destroyed of the same type and of different types, and because of the contradiction with what is commonly recognized.

original: skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa dmigs par byed pa na phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin ni shes pa yod pa nyid nang gi byed par snang ba'i rgyu yin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa dmigs par byed pa na phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin ni shes pa yod pa nyid nang gi byed par snang ba'i rgyu yin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When a person observes sound, etc., he is benefited because he is the object to be benefited, and the nature of sound, etc. is the cause of the appearance of the internal cognition, so it benefits.

original: skyes bu dag spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gi ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: skyes bu dag spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gi ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: because the person is the possessor of a universal and of a particular.

original: skyes bu skyes bu zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu skyes bu zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúperson‚Äù is the universal;

original: lhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ces bya ba dag ni khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ces bya ba dag ni khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the words ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs self‚Äù and ‚ÄúYaj√±adatta‚Äôs self‚Äù are the particulars.

original: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang 'jim pa las gyur pa yin par rtog na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang 'jim pa las gyur pa yin par rtog na ni dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan no //
translated: If the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause of being of the nature of clay‚Äù is conceived as ‚Äúarisen from clay,‚Äù then the example lacks the property to be established.

original: 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtog na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtog na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: If the meaning of the reason is conceived as ‚Äúhaving the nature of clay,‚Äù then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'bras bu rgyu las gzhan nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu las gzhan nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúthe effect is not different from the cause‚Äù?

original: ci rang gi rgyu las sam /
analyzed: ci rang gi rgyu las sam /
translated: Is it from its own cause?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi rgyu las /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi rgyu las /
translated: Or is it from another cause?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te rang gi rgyu las na ni dpe med do //
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyu las na ni dpe med do //
translated: If it is from its own cause, then there is no example.

original: ci ste gzhan gyi rgyu las na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi rgyu las na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is from another cause, then the former is contradicted and there is the contradiction of what is renowned.

original: gal te gzhan nyid ma yin na ni de'i nus pas mi stong pa'o zhe na yang dpe med do //
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid ma yin na ni de'i nus pas mi stong pa'o zhe na yang dpe med do //
translated: If it is not different, then it is not empty of its own power, but there is no example.

original: rgyu phyogs su bya ba'i dus la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu phyogs su bya ba'i dus la yang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same in the case of the time of activity in the cause-side.

original: de dag ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa @137b yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa @137b yin te /
translated: These are just a few of the directions.

original: phyogs 'dis gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi skad cig ma nyid la gnod par bya ba'i phyir grangs can dag gis rjes su dpag pa la smras pa rnams sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi skad cig ma nyid la gnod par bya ba'i phyir grangs can dag gis rjes su dpag pa la smras pa rnams sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: By this direction, in order to refute the momentariness of material and immaterial phenomena, the arguments of the Samkhyas in their inferences should be refuted.

original: de bzhin du don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / de la sogs pa dag dang / gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / de la sogs pa dag dang / gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, ultimately, the whole, the khadga, is not identical with the parts, the khadga's root, trunk, branches, leaves, etc.

original: de dag gi phyogs gcig chad kyang de mi 'chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs gcig chad kyang de mi 'chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug bzhin no //
translated: Even if one part of it is cut off, it is not cut off.

original: don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yan lag can seng ldeng ni yan lag seng ldeng gi rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the possessor of parts, the piece of wood, is not different from its parts, the roots, the trunk, the branches, the leaves, etc.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na seng ldeng gi yan lag dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na seng ldeng gi yan lag dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is dependent, like the self of the parts of the piece of wood.

original: de bzhin du don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni /
translated: In the same way, in the ultimate sense, the parts of the piece of wood

original: yan lag can dang / gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can dang / gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: are not identical with the possessor of parts,

original: de'i phyogs gcig chad kyang de dag mi 'chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug gi yan lag dag bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig chad kyang de dag mi 'chad pa'i phyir dper na rgya shug gi yan lag dag bzhin no //
translated: because even if one part of it is cut off, they are not cut off. Like the parts of the jujube.

original: don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni yan lag can las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par seng ldeng gi yan lag dag ni yan lag can las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the parts of the piece of wood are not different from the possessor of parts,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na yan lag can seng ldeng gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na yan lag can seng ldeng gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they are dependent, like the self of the piece of wood.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de bzhin du don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, ultimately cloth is not identical with the forms that are the nature of the threads,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no ;
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na sab ma bzhin no ;
translated: because it is related and because it is substantial, like a mat.

original: / don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: / don dam par snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately cloth is not different from the forms that are the nature of the threads,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun dag gi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is related and because when it disintegrates they also disintegrate, like the nature of the threads themselves.

original: de bzhin du don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, ultimately the forms that are the nature of the threads are not identical with the cloth,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang bzhin no //
translated: because they are related and because they are substantial, like individual threads.

original: don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu las gzhan nyid ma yin te /üîΩltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig @138a * //
analyzed: don dam par rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dag ni snam bu las gzhan nyid ma yin te / ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / de zhig @138a * //
translated: In reality, the material form that is the nature of the causes, the primary and secondary elementary matter, is not different from cloth,

original: na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na snam bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: na de dag kyang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na snam bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is dependent and because when that is destroyed, they are also destroyed, like the intrinsic nature of cloth.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the characteristics and the basis of the characteristics.

original: gal te gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pas ni gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa la gnod la /
analyzed: gal te gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pas ni gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa la gnod la /
translated: If the inference that refutes identity refutes the inference that refutes difference,

original: gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: and if the inference that refutes difference refutes the inference that refutes identity, then neither is established.

original: gnyi ga bkag pas 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga bkag pas 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error because the establishment of the thesis is by the negation of both.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, when analyzed in this way, identity and difference are untenable ultimately.

original: mi 'thad du zin kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gdul ba'i sems can rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir de dag 'jig rten las grags pa dag gis bka' stsal pa la /
analyzed: mi 'thad du zin kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gdul ba'i sems can rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir de dag 'jig rten las grags pa dag gis bka' stsal pa la /
translated: Even though they are untenable, the Transcendent Conqueror taught them in accordance with worldly renown in order to perfectly accomplish the assemblies of qualities such as the discipline, concentration, and wisdom of the sentient beings to be tamed.

original: kha cig gis de dag ni don dam pa'o snyam du rig nas chos rnams de ltar spros pa med kyang /
analyzed: kha cig gis de dag ni don dam pa'o snyam du rig nas chos rnams de ltar spros pa med kyang /
translated: Some think that those are ultimate, and thus they proliferate about phenomena even though they are free of proliferations.

original: spros par byed pa de rigs pa ma yin par slob dpon gyis dgongs pa na /
analyzed: spros par byed pa de rigs pa ma yin par slob dpon gyis dgongs pa na /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna thought that it is illogical to proliferate about phenomena in that way.üîΩHe said:

original: gang dag bdag dang dngos po rnams //
analyzed: gang dag bdag dang dngos po rnams //
translated: Those who teach that the self and things

original: de bcas nyid dang tha dad par //üîΩston pa de dag bstan don la //
analyzed: de bcas nyid dang tha dad par // ston pa de dag bstan don la //
translated: are the same or differentüîΩdo not think that they are

original: mkhas so snyam du mi sems so //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mkhas so snyam du mi sems so //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: skilled in the meaning of the teaching.

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan dag khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan dag khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because they accept other phenomena that are contradictory with valid knowledge.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa dang / dpe med par bstan pas /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa dang / dpe med par bstan pas /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows: By demonstrating that the proof and example stated by the opponent at the beginning of the chapter are not established,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: it demonstrates that dependent arising has the feature of not being the same object and not being a different object.

original: de'i phyir lus las gzhan pa'i chos mi mthong la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus las gzhan pa'i chos mi mthong la /
translated: Therefore, one does not see a phenomenon that is different from the body,

original: chos las gzhan pa'i lus mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos las gzhan pa'i lus mi mthong ste /
translated: and one does not see a body that is different from a phenomenon.

original: ji ltar gnyis ma yin pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa ma yin pa de ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis ma yin pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa ma yin pa de ltar mthong ngo //
translated: One sees in such a way that it is neither nondual nor not nondual.

original: de ltar mthong bas mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mthong bas mngon sum nyid du mthong ba yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: Since one sees in that way, it is established that ‚Äúone does not see even seeing as direct perception‚Äù and so on.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The master BhƒÅviveka‚Äôs commentary

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: In the Lamp for Wisdom, a commentary on the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way,

original: me dang bud shing brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: me dang bud shing brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the chapter is called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Fire and Fuel.‚Äù

original: @138b rab tu byed pa bcu pa'o /
analyzed: @138b rab tu byed pa bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the tenth chapter.

original: // / da ni dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: // / da ni dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in order to teach the essencelessness of cyclic existence by refuting the specific attributes that are discordant with the essencelessness of things, the eleventh chapter is begun.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say the following:

original: don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In reality, the aggregates and so forth do exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang khyad par bstan nas /
translated: This is because the Transcendent Lord taught the names and the particulars

original: de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and taught the instructions for their elimination.

original: 'di la gang med pa de la ni ming dang khyad par bstan pa dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di la gang med pa de la ni ming dang khyad par bstan pa dang / de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable to teach the names and particulars of that which does not exist and to teach the instructions for its elimination.

original: dper na mgo gnyis pa'i mig gi nad med par bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mgo gnyis pa'i mig gi nad med par bya ba bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the case of the elimination of the eye disease of one who has two eyes.

original: de dag la ni ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The names and specific attributes of those are taught, and the instructions for their elimination are taught, as follows:

original: dge slong dag 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med de /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med de /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, samsara is without beginning or end.

original: dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
translated: The childish who do not know the true Dharma

original: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
analyzed: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
translated: have a long samsaric life.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag / de lta bas na khyed kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag / de lta bas na khyed kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas /
translated: And similarly, ‚ÄúMonks, therefore you should train thinking, ‚ÄòWe will strive to eliminate samsara.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus phung po la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since these are stated, the reason stated above is valid and the aggregates and so on definitely exist.

original: 'dir bshad pa ;
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa ;
translated: Here we say:

original: 'jig rten gyi mgon pos skye ba'i rgyun las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu skye ba'i gnyen por ma skyes pa rgyun ma chad pa la gzigs nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mgon pos skye ba'i rgyun las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu skye ba'i gnyen por ma skyes pa rgyun ma chad pa la gzigs nas /
translated: The Lord of the World, seeing that the continuum of birth generated by karma and affliction is like an illusion or a mirage, and seeing that the antidote to birth is unceasing nonarising,

original: byis pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ring ngo zhes gsungs shing /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ring ngo zhes gsungs shing /
translated: The Buddha said that the cyclic existence of childish beings is long.

original: skye ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma'i gleng gzhir gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: skye ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma'i gleng gzhir gyur pa yin pas /
translated: Birth is the basis for the arising of many kinds of suffering.

original: 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir gus par bya ba nyid la sbyar bar bzhed pa na de skad gsungs par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir gus par bya ba nyid la sbyar bar bzhed pa na de skad gsungs par zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said this in order to encourage beings to strive in the practice that will end cyclic existence.

original: rtog pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis yongs su brtags na don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi khyad par 'ga' yang dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis yongs su brtags na don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi khyad par 'ga' yang dmigs su med pas /
translated: However, when those who have conceptual thoughts fully investigate, they do not observe the slightest difference between cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par gsungs pa ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir gal te ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par gsungs pa ma yin no // de'i phyir gal te ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha did not teach this in terms of the ultimate.

original: man ngag bstan pa'i don dam pa pa yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: man ngag bstan pa'i don dam pa pa yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that the ultimate is the teaching of instructions that are taught in order to end the teaching of names and their referents,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: then the meaning of your reason is not established.

original: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don @139a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don @139a * //
translated: If you think that the reason is conventional,

original: 'gal ba nyid dang dpe med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid dang dpe med do //
translated: then the meaning of your example is contradicted.

original: 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gang gsungs pa ni 'di na rgyu med par smra ba bsal ba'i phyir dngos po rgyu las skye'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab skye ba bstan pa'i phyogs su bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes gang gsungs pa ni 'di na rgyu med par smra ba bsal ba'i phyir dngos po rgyu las skye'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab skye ba bstan pa'i phyogs su bka' stsal pa /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúSamsara has no beginning or end‚Äù was made by the Lord in the context of teaching arising in order to refute the claim that there is no cause.

original: de sun dbyung bar 'dod pa'i mu stegs can dag gis /
analyzed: de sun dbyung bar 'dod pa'i mu stegs can dag gis /
translated: The tirthikas, who wish to refute that,

original: bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar 'khor ba'i /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar 'khor ba'i /
translated: asked the Lord, ‚ÄúHow is it that samsara

original: sngon mtha' mngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
analyzed: sngon mtha' mngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
translated: has a beginning?‚Äù

original: thub pa chen po sa min zhes gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa chen po sa min zhes gsungs //
translated: The Great Sage said, ‚ÄúIt does not.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba thog ma tha med de //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma tha med de //
translated: Samsara has no beginning or end.

original: de la sngon med phyi ma med //üîΩde la 'khor ba ni kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de la sngon med phyi ma med // de la 'khor ba ni kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: It has no prior limit or later limit.

original: skye ba dang rga shi'i dpyad thag gi rgyun ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi'i dpyad thag gi rgyun ma chad pa'o //
translated: In this regard, samsara is the continuous cycle of birth, aging, and death.

original: thog ma dang tha ma ni thog ma dang tha ma dag ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma ni thog ma dang tha ma dag ste /
translated: Beginning and end are the prior limit and the later limit.

original: de la thog ma dang tha ma dag med pa'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma med par gsungs te /
analyzed: de la thog ma dang tha ma dag med pa'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma med par gsungs te /
translated: Since samsara has neither a prior limit nor a later limit, it is said to have no beginning or end.

original: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dag las brtsom  pa'i dus nges pa med pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po ma shar ba dag la tha ma ma grub pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dag las brtsom  pa'i dus nges pa med pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po ma shar ba dag la tha ma ma grub pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: Because there is no definite time for the transmission of the one cause from one to another, and because the final end is not established for those for whom the antidote has not arisen,

original: de'i phyir de ni lan gdab pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni lan gdab pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: therefore this is the reply.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das la log pa mi gsung ba nyid du yid ches pa yang dag par skyes pa rnams ni de la yid ches par 'gyur gyi tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa gzhan dag ni yid ches par mi
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das la log pa mi gsung ba nyid du yid ches pa yang dag par skyes pa rnams ni de la yid ches par 'gyur gyi tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa gzhan dag ni yid ches par mi
translated: Thus, those who have correctly generated confidence in the Lord Buddha as one who does not speak falsely will have confidence in this, but others whose minds are distorted by the appearance of valid cognition will not have confidence.

original: 'gyur la / thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab 'di yang slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud dang bral ba yin pas de'i phyir don 'di gzhan la bstan par nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur la / thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab 'di yang slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud dang bral ba yin pas de'i phyir don 'di gzhan la bstan par nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: And since this scripture of the Lord of Sages is free from the stinginess of a teacher, therefore it is possible to teach this meaning to others, so an inference should be stated.

original: bskal pa dang po'i lus can rnams kyi lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni tshe rabs gzhan dag tu nye bar bsags pa'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa dang po'i lus can rnams kyi lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni tshe rabs gzhan dag tu nye bar bsags pa'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The bodies, faculties, and collections of awareness of the beings of the first eon should be understood to be the causes of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma accumulated in other lives.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are the causes of the arising of pleasure and pain, of virtue and nonvirtue, and so on,

original: dper na deng sang gi lus dang dbang po dang po'i blo'i tshogs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na deng sang gi lus dang dbang po dang po'i blo'i tshogs bzhin no //
translated: like the bodies, faculties, and collections of awareness of beings of the present day.

original: de bzhin du thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa'i rgyu nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can nyid la sogs pa'i gtan @139b tshigs dag dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa'i rgyu nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can nyid la sogs pa'i gtan @139b tshigs dag dang /
translated: In the same way, the reasons such as being the cause of the uncommon object, being the object of benefit, being the benefactor, being the cause of joy and sorrow, and being subject to destruction,

original: dam bcas pa dang / dpe ji skad bstan pa dag gis rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa dang / dpe ji skad bstan pa dag gis rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The thesis and the example as stated should be elaborated by way of inference.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'dir mu stegs can dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir mu stegs can dag gis smras pa /
translated: Here the tƒ´rthikas say:

original: 'khor ba ni thog ma yod par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni thog ma yod par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Cyclic existence should be taken as having a beginning

original: tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has an end.

original: gang la tha ma yod pa de la ni thog ma yang yod par mthong ste /
analyzed: gang la tha ma yod pa de la ni thog ma yang yod par mthong ste /
translated: That which has an end is also seen to have a beginning,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, for example.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i 'khor ba la yang tha ma yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus 'khor ba ni thog ma yod par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i 'khor ba la yang tha ma yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus 'khor ba ni thog ma yod par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, since cyclic existence, in which correct knowledge has arisen, has an end, therefore, by the power of the stated reason, cyclic existence should be taken as having a beginning.

original: de la 'dir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here the tƒ´rthikas say: Not only does cyclic existence not have a beginning,

original: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
translated: but also all things

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
translated: do not have a beginning.

original: zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa thog ma med pa'i rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba dag la yang thog ma yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa thog ma med pa'i rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba dag la yang thog ma yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: the arising of a pot, etc., from a beginningless series of causes is not established as having a beginning, the example is faulty in that it does notüîΩinclude the predicate.

original: tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: tha ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The meaning of the argument ‚Äúbecause there is an end‚Äù is also not established.

original: 'khor ba ni mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is indeterminate whether or not cyclic existence has an end.

original: gzhan dag na re gal te 'khor ba thog med par 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gal te 'khor ba thog med par 'dod na /
translated: Others say that if cyclic existence is asserted to be beginningless, then

original: 'o na de ltar de la zad pa med par yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar de la zad pa med par yang shes par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that it is also endless,

original: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu'am nam mkha' bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu'am nam mkha' bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because it has no beginning, like a person or space.

original: skyes bu'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: A person or anything else

original: ma skyes pa ni tha snyad du yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni tha snyad du yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: But since we do not accept that the non-arisen is even nominally existent, the example is not established.

original: kun rdzob kyi phyogs la yang 'bru la sogs pa thog ma med pa dag la gnyen po byung bas mtha' mthong ba'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi phyogs la yang 'bru la sogs pa thog ma med pa dag la gnyen po byung bas mtha' mthong ba'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: And in the context of the conventional, since the end of seeds, etc., is seen when their antidotes arise, the meaning is contradictory.

original: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can nye bar 'khrul pa gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can nye bar 'khrul pa gzhan dag na re /
translated: Other confused people, proud of their learning, say,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The Transcendent Lord is not omniscient,

original: 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes zer bas /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes zer bas /
translated: because he did not reveal the prior limit of cyclic existence.

original: rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir dper na mi phal pa srog chags shi ba gar song mi shes so zhes zer ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir dper na mi phal pa srog chags shi ba gar song mi shes so zhes zer ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Since they claim that he does not know, it is like the case of an ordinary person who says, ‚ÄúI do not know where the dead animal went.‚Äù

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: gzhan gyis 'khor ba thog ma yod pa nyid du yongs su @140a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'khor ba thog ma yod pa nyid du yongs su @140a * //
translated: because others imagine that cyclic existence has a beginning.

original: brtags pa bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brtags pa bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute that, the Transcendent Lord said,

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes gsungs pa de ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid yin pas mi mngon pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes gsungs pa de ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa'i tshig gi don yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid yin pas mi mngon pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pas /
translated: Since cyclic existence is without beginning, the BhagavƒÅn knows it to be not evident.üîΩSince cyclic existence is taught to be without beginning, the BhagavƒÅn is not obstructed with regard to it.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba gzhan gyi 'byor ba chen po la phrag dog byed pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba gzhan gyi 'byor ba chen po la phrag dog byed pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no //
translated: This is the natural outcome of others who speak without analysis out of great envy.

original: dam bcas pa'i don rgyas par ni de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don rgyas par ni de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa las rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The meaning of the thesis is extensively explained in the chapter on the TathƒÅgata.

original: / dpyad pa spros pas chog gi skabs nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / dpyad pa spros pas chog gi skabs nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Enough of this extensive analysis.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis 'khor ba'i chos ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis 'khor ba'i chos ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid yin par bstan te /
translated: This verse teaches that the phenomena of cyclic existence are without beginning and end.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the syllogism is: Ultimately, the aggregates do not exist as they appear,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are without beginning and end,

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: like the man conjured up by a magician.

original: 'dir mkhas su re ba'i blo can kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'dir mkhas su re ba'i blo can kha cig na re /
translated: Here, some intelligent people say:

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu la yang shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag dus phyi mar yang de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pas med doüîΩzhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu la yang shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag dus phyi mar yang de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pas med do zhes zer ro //
translated: The example is not established as similar to the predicate, because the objects of form, etc., which are the objects of non-conceptual consciousness, exist for the man conjured up by a magician and they exist in the same way in the future.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical, because

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu log par snang ba nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang / shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag la yang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pas skyon med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu log par snang ba nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang / shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag la yang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pas skyon med do //
translated: Because the magician‚Äôs illusory man is the very example of a false appearance, and because form, etc., which are the objects of non-conceptual consciousness, are also empty of the nature of a man, the example is not established, so there is no fault.

original: de lta bas na 'khor ba yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khor ba yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ming dang khyad par bstan nas de zad par bya ba'i phyir man ngag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since samsara is not established as existent, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúin order to teach the name and the particular, and in order to teach the instruction for the exhaustion of that‚Äù is not established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: don dam pa'i phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Samsara, called the continuum of the aggregates of the ultimate, does indeed exist,

original: de'i dbus yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbus yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its middle exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni dbus dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni dbus dmigs su med de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not apprehended as a middle,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of a donkey, for example.

original: 'khor ba la ni gang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag yod pa'i dbus yod pas de'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin no @140b des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / 'gal ba nyid med pas 'dod pa'i don 'grub po //
analyzed: 'khor ba la ni gang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag yod pa'i dbus yod pas de'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin no @140b des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / 'gal ba nyid med pas 'dod pa'i don 'grub po //
translated: Thus, since the meaning of the reason is not unestablished and it is not contradictory, the intended meaning is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang la thog med tha med pa //
analyzed: gang la thog med tha med pa //
translated: How could that which has no beginning and no end

original: de la dbus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: de la dbus ni ga la yod //
translated: Have a middle?

original: de la dbus yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: de la dbus yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that it does not have a middle.

original: sgyu ma byas pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud la dbus med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud la dbus med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is like the continuum of an illusory person that does not have a middle.

original: de ltar thog ma dang tha ma ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog par mi 'thad de //
analyzed: de ltar thog ma dang tha ma ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i skyon ldog par mi 'thad de //
translated: Thus, since a beginning and end are not established and there is no example, it is not tenable to reverse the faults that have been taught.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: Therefore, when analyzed in this way, samsara is essenceless.

original: de phyir de la snga phyi dang // lhan cig rim pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de phyir de la snga phyi dang // lhan cig rim pa mi 'thad do //
translated: is untenable.

original: skye ba dang rga shi dag gi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dag gi'o //
translated: With respect to birth and aging and death.

original: de la smra ba gang dag na re /
analyzed: de la smra ba gang dag na re /
translated: Those who say that

original: 'khor ba ni ngo bo nyid yod de /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni ngo bo nyid yod de /
translated: cyclic existence exists essentially

original: skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses birth and aging and death,üîΩlike a pot,

original: mo gsham gyi bu med pa ni /üîΩskye ba dang / rga shi dang ldan par mi rigs so zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu med pa ni / skye ba dang / rga shi dang ldan par mi rigs so zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
translated: for example,üîΩshouldüîΩbe asked:üîΩIs the birth of cyclic existence prior to, subsequent to, or simultaneous with cyclic existence?üîΩThe sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous

original: skye ba dang / rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: is untenable.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med pa dang don 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don dam par skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med pa dang don 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established, and because nothing that possesses birth, etc., ultimately is established as existing essentially, there is no example, and the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: ji ltar skye ba la sogs pa ngag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'grub pa de ltar 'di brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba la sogs pa ngag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'grub pa de ltar 'di brtag par bya ste /
translated: Just as the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous does not apply to arising, etc., so you should analyze this.

original: gal te skye ba snga gyur la //
analyzed: gal te skye ba snga gyur la //
translated: If arising were prior,

original: rga shi 'phyi ba yin na ni //
analyzed: rga shi 'phyi ba yin na ni //
translated: and aging and death were subsequent,

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ro //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ro //
translated: If, as the opponent asserts,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: thenüîΩthere would be birth without aging and death,

original: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: and there would be birth without having died.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: skye ba la rga shi'i ngo bo nyid med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba la rga shi'i ngo bo nyid med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: birth would not have the nature of aging and death,

original: rga shi med par yang skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga shi med par yang skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because birth would occur without aging and death.

original: gang zhig gang med par yang skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par yang skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: That which occurs without something else does not have the nature of that other thing,

original: dper na ba lang rta med par skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na ba lang rta med par skyes pa de la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: just as a cow does not have the nature of a horse.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: ma shi bar skye bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma shi bar skye bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: there would be birth without having died.

original: sngar gzhan du ma shi ba kho nar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gzhan du ma shi ba kho nar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because birth would occur without having died in a previous life.

original: de dag ni mi 'dod do //üîΩde la skye ba ni mi skyed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mi 'dod do // de la skye ba ni mi skyed pa ste /
translated: But we do not accept this.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba'o //
translated: Birth is the origination of what did not exist before.

original: rga ba ni lus yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni lus yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Aging is the transformation of the body.

original: 'chi ba ni srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'o //
translated: Death is the cessation of the life faculty.

original: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir glags yod pa las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa mngon te /üîΩskye ba ni rga shi bas snga ba ma @141a * //
analyzed: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir glags yod pa las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa mngon te / skye ba ni rga shi bas snga ba ma @141a * //
translated: Here, we infer that birth is not prior to aging and death because it is a case of the prior existence of the cause, since the word ‚Äúprior‚Äù is used.

original: yin te / de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me tsha ba bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yin te / de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me tsha ba bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Birth is not prior to aging and death, because it has that nature, just as heat is not prior to fire.

original: ci ste skyon der 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas rga shi snga bar 'dod na de lta na yang /üîΩgal te skye ba 'phyi gyur la //
analyzed: ci ste skyon der 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas rga shi snga bar 'dod na de lta na yang / gal te skye ba 'phyi gyur la //
translated: But if you maintain that aging and death are prior, then in that case:üîΩIf aging and death are prior

original: rga shi snga ba yin na ni //
analyzed: rga shi snga ba yin na ni //
translated: And birth is later,

original: de lta na /üîΩskye ba med pa'i rga shi ni /
analyzed: de lta na / skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni /
translated: thenüîΩHow could there be aging and death

original: rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: Without birth?

original: smra ba gzhan dag kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: smra ba gzhan dag kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya bar 'dod pas /
translated: Other scholars also maintain that aging and death are the conditions of birth.

original: de med na skye ba med pa'i rga shi rkyen med pa ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na skye ba med pa'i rga shi rkyen med pa ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If birth does not exist, how could aging and death occur without a cause?

original: skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /üîΩma skyes pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste / ma skyes pas gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Aging and death do not exist without birth.üîΩThe intended meaning is that if birth does not exist, then aging and death do not exist.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni rga shi ni skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni rga shi ni skye ba bas snga bar mi rigs te /
translated: Here is the inference: It is not logical that aging and death should precede birth,

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: because they occur when it exists, just like the state of being an elder.

original: gal te skye ba ni rga shi dang rjes su 'brel bzhin pa kho nar yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba ni rga shi dang rjes su 'brel bzhin pa kho nar yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because birth exists only in conjunction with aging and death,üîΩbirth and aging and death

original: skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //
translated: cannot occur simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rtog na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rtog na //
translated: Because if you imagine that

original: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur na //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur na //
translated: one who is in the process of being born is dying,

original: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: both would be without a cause.

original: de gnyis ni dgag pa mi mthun pa yin pas skye ba zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni dgag pa mi mthun pa yin pas skye ba zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since these two are mutually exclusive, it is not the case that birth exists.

original: skye bzhin ba nyid na 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin ba nyid na 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is in the process of arising would die.

original: de ltar skye ba med na snga ma bzhin du skye ba dang rga shi gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de ltar skye ba med na snga ma bzhin du skye ba dang rga shi gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te ;
translated: Thus, if arising does not exist, then, as before, birth and aging and death would be without a cause.

original: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they would occur simultaneously.

original: dper na skye ba'i rgyu rga shi ma yin pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyi rgyu yang ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na skye ba'i rgyu rga shi ma yin pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyi rgyu yang ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: For example, just as aging and death are not the cause of birth, so also birth is not the cause of aging and death.

original: gal te lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: If you think that even those that arise simultaneously are causes,

original: mtshan dang / dpe byed dang skyes bu chen po bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan dang / dpe byed dang skyes bu chen po bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like the major and minor marks of a Buddha or the parts of a chariot,

original: de ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni lan ma yin te /
translated: that is not an answer.

original: dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the refutation has already been presented.

original: de'i phyir yang skye ba dang / rga shi dag la lhan cig nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang skye ba dang / rga shi dag la lhan cig nyid mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for birth and aging and death to occur simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na /
translated: Thus, when you examine in this way,

original: gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
analyzed: gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
translated: the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous

original: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
analyzed: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
translated: is not possible for that birth and that aging and death.

original: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
translated: Why do you fabricate them?

original: don dam par de dag spros par bya bar mi rigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: don dam par de dag spros par bya bar mi rigs pa kho na ste /
translated: In reality, it is not tenable to fabricate them,

original: de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because they are not produced.

original: de ltar 'khor ba sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs skye ba dang / rga shi dang / ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon gyi lan gdab par byas so //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs skye ba dang / rga shi dang / ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon gyi lan gdab par byas so //
translated: Thus, because the reason proving cyclic existence‚Äîthe possession of birth, aging, and death‚Äîis not established, the error of the meaning of the reason being unestablished that was stated in the first chapter by the opponent is refuted.

original: @141b da ni slob dpon gyis skye ba la sogs pa dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag yod par mi 'thad pa bzhin du dngos po lhag ma rnams la yang 'dra bar bstan par bshed nas bshad pa /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
