analyzed: @141b da ni slob dpon gyis skye ba la sogs pa dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag yod par mi 'thad pa bzhin du dngos po lhag ma rnams la yang 'dra bar bstan par bshed nas bshad pa / rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that just as the sequence of prior, posterior, and simultaneous is not tenable in the context of arising and so on, it is also similar for other things, the master says:üîΩCause and effect,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan nyid gzhi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan nyid gzhi //
translated: Characteristics and the basis characterized,

original: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni /
analyzed: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni /
translated: Feeling and the feeler,

original: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
analyzed: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
translated: Whatever exists,

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya dang / grol ba dang thar pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang / shes pa dang shes bya dang / grol ba dang thar pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: and liberation and the characteristics of liberation.

original: 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
translated: Only sa·πÉsƒÅra has no beginning.

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
translated: It is not that it does not exist.

original: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang /
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang /
translated: But for all things,

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
translated: there is no beginning.

original: de la re zhig 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i dbang du byas nas phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i dbang du byas nas phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, first of all, we will explain a little bit from the perspective of cause and effect and characteristics and the basis of characteristics.

original: don dam par 'bru ni myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par 'bru ni myu gu'i snga na yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that ultimately the seed does not exist prior to the sprout,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is the effect, like, for example, the sprout's own nature.

original: gal te rgyud tha dad pa'i 'bras bu sngar 'byung ba dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na //
analyzed: gal te rgyud tha dad pa'i 'bras bu sngar 'byung ba dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na //
translated: If it is argued that it is not ascertained by the prior occurrence of the effect of a different continuum,

original: de dag kyang don dam par de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since they are ultimately refuted in that way, there is no absence of the property of the subject because there is no counter-position.

original: ci ste 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod na yang don dam par 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod na yang don dam par 'bras bu rgyu bas snga bar 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: If you assert that the effect is prior to the cause, then you should not assert that the effect is prior to the cause ultimately.

original: rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error of causelessness would ensue.

original: gang dag rgyu las 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid bsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu las 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid bsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
translated: For those who say that the effect is to be removed from the cause,

original: 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis bsal bar byed pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis bsal bar byed pa mi 'thad de /
translated: it is not tenable that the effect is removed by the conditions.

original: de dag zhig pas de 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na 'jim pa la sogs pa zhig pas bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag zhig pas de 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na 'jim pa la sogs pa zhig pas bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it would be destroyed by their destruction, like a pot by the destruction of clay and so on.

original: gang zhig gang gis bsal bar byed pa de ni de zhig pas 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis bsal bar byed pa de ni de zhig pas 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is removed by something is not destroyed by the destruction of that.

original: dper na nyi ma dang nor bu dang / mar me dang / sman gyi 'od zhig pas gsal bar bya ba khri'u dang / gtan pa dag zhig par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma dang nor bu dang / mar me dang / sman gyi 'od zhig pas gsal bar bya ba khri'u dang / gtan pa dag zhig par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For example, it is like the light of the sun, a gem, a lamp, or medicine, which do not cease to illuminate a pile of things to be illuminated.

original: gsal ba yang sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba yang sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin no //
translated: And because the manifest also arises from what has not previously existed, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas are proponents of the nonexistence of effects prior to their arising.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause and effect are simultaneous,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that also is not logical.

original: ci ste lhan cig tu'o zhe na /üîΩde lta na yang don dam par 'bru dang myu gu lhan cig 'byung ba dag rgyu dang 'bras @142a * //
analyzed: ci ste lhan cig tu'o zhe na / de lta na yang don dam par 'bru dang myu gu lhan cig 'byung ba dag rgyu dang 'bras @142a * //
translated: If you say that they are simultaneous,

original: bu'i dngos por mi rung ste /
analyzed: bu'i dngos por mi rung ste /
translated: in that case, ultimately, it is not tenable that seeds and sprouts that arise simultaneously are the entities of cause and effect.

original: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rva dag bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na ba lang gi rva dag bzhin no //
translated: Because they arise simultaneously, like the two horns of an ox.

original: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi bas snga bar mi 'dod de /
translated: Similarly, the characteristics of the dewlap and so on are not asserted to precede the basis of those characteristics.

original: gzhi med pa'i phyir dper na ri mo rtsig pa bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i phyir dper na ri mo rtsig pa bas snga ba ma yin pa bzhin no ;
translated: Because it has no basis, like a painting is not prior to the wall.

original: / de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid pas snga bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: / de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid pas snga bar mi rigs te /
translated: Similarly, it is not tenable that the basis of those characteristics is prior to the characteristics.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu chen po nyid skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams pas snga bar mi rigs pa dang / sa nyid sra ba bas snga bar mi rigs pa bzhin no //üîΩmtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi lhan cig tu 'byung ba dag kyang /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes bu chen po nyid skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams pas snga bar mi rigs pa dang / sa nyid sra ba bas snga bar mi rigs pa bzhin no // mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi lhan cig tu 'byung ba dag kyang /
translated: Because the dewlap and so on are the basis of those characteristics, it is not tenable that the state of being a great being is prior to the marks of a great being, and it is not tenable that earth is prior to solidity.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: Also, it is not asserted that characteristics and the basis of those characteristics arise simultaneously.

original: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na dri dang ro lhan cig tu 'byung ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na dri dang ro lhan cig tu 'byung ba dag bzhin no //
translated: Because they arise simultaneously, like smell and taste arise simultaneously.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is the same as before.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas /
translated: stated by the opponent in the first chapter are stated.

original: 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is shown that cyclic existence is essenceless.üîΩTherefore, in the same way, no one would cycle, no one would

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du 'di la 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /üîΩrnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa ngas 'khor ba yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du 'di la 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa ngas 'khor ba yang mi dmigs /
translated: achieve nirvana, there would be no affliction, and there would be noüîΩpurification.üîΩSimilarly, BrahmƒÅ, I do not observe cyclic existence, nor do I observe

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang /
translated: The TathƒÅgata designates cyclic existence,üîΩbut no one cycles there. The TathƒÅgata designates nirvana,

original: der 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dogs par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: der 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dogs par mdzad kyang /
translated: but no one achieves nirvana.

original: der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs skye ba 'am 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs skye ba 'am 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And similarly, Subh≈´ti, form would not be born or die.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba'am 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba'am 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness would not be born or die.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti,üîΩform, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness not being born or dying is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba'am 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba'am 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: And similarly, Subh≈´ti,

original: @142b sngon dang phyi ma dang / dbus kyi mtha' med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: @142b sngon dang phyi ma dang / dbus kyi mtha' med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha'o //
translated: the end of nirvana is the end of the past, future, and middle.

original: ji ltar brjod pa de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not as it is expressed.

original: chos thams cad mtha' med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtha' med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe limit of all phenomena is the limit of nirvana,‚Äù and so on, is established.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The master BhƒÅviveka states:

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: In the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on NƒÅgƒÅrjuna‚Äôs Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: 'khor ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the chapter is called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Cyclic Existence.‚Äù

original: rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter.

original: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in order to teach the essencelessness of suffering by refuting the specific objections to emptiness, the twelfth chapter is begun.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩsdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir 'di na gang med pa de ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin te / sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir 'di na gang med pa de ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
translated: the aggregates exist ultimately,

original: dper na mgo gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mgo gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are suffering. That which does not exist is not suffering, just like a second head.

original: phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: The aggregates are suffering.

original: mdo sde las /
analyzed: mdo sde las /
translated: A s≈´tra says:

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / chos mngon pa las kyang /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / chos mngon pa las kyang /
translated: And the Abhidharma states:üîΩThe origin of suffering is the world,

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lta ba'i gnas dang srid pa yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lta ba'i gnas dang srid pa yin //
translated: the basis of views, and existence.

original: zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, due to the power of the reason stated, the aggregates definitely exist ultimately.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sdug bsngal du rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzhag nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal du rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzhag nas /
translated: Having posited the conception of suffering,

original: kha cig sdug bsngal ba dag gis byas //
analyzed: kha cig sdug bsngal ba dag gis byas //
translated: some assert that suffering is self-produced,

original: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
translated: produced by another, produced by both,

original: rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod //
translated: or it arises without a cause.

original: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: That is untenable.

original: smra ba kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi ga ma byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod de /
analyzed: smra ba kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi ga ma byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod de /
translated: Some say that suffering is self-produced, produced by another, produced by both, or it arises without a cause.

original: rnam pa du mar rnam par brtags pa de ni bya ba'i 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar rnam par brtags pa de ni bya ba'i 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
translated: That which is analyzed in many ways is not suitable as the effect of an action.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de la re zhig ji ltar don dam par sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rung ba de ltar 'dir bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig ji ltar don dam par sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rung ba de ltar 'dir bstan par bya ste /
translated: First, it should be shown here how suffering created by itself is not suitable in the ultimate sense.

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur pa //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur pa //
translated: If it were created by itself,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //üîΩgang gi phyir bdag gis byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur // gang gi phyir bdag gis byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: it would not arise in dependence.

original: de la brten nas 'byung ba nyid kyi chos med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas 'byung ba nyid kyi chos med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because what is created by itself is not created by causes and conditions, therefore, it is said that the property of not arising in dependence would not exist.

original: de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: brten nas byung ba nyid du 'dod de 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas 'byung ba nyid yin par bstan @143a * //
analyzed: brten nas byung ba nyid du 'dod de 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas 'byung ba nyid yin par bstan @143a * //
translated: Arising in dependence is accepted. This shows that the phenomenon of suffering arises in dependence.

original: to ; / gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
analyzed: to ; / gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
translated: Because these aggregates

original: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
analyzed: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
translated: arise in dependence on those aggregates.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phung po 'di dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phung po 'di dag 'byung ste /
translated: Because the aggregates that are asserted to arise in dependence on these present aggregates arise.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù should be regarded as having the meaning of ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te /
translated: Thus, this is a statement of an example that is similar to the predicate.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga ni byed pa po lhas byin dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga ni byed pa po lhas byin dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Here the inference is: ultimately, the five aggregates called ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù are not Devadatta, the agent,

original: brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na srid pa gcig tu gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po phyi ma dag phung po lnga po snga ma'i rgyu las byung bzhin no //
analyzed: brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na srid pa gcig tu gtogs pa'i phung po lnga po phyi ma dag phung po lnga po snga ma'i rgyu las byung bzhin no //
translated: because they arise in dependence, just like the five aggregates in the next life that belong to the same continuum of existence arise from the five aggregates in the prior life.

original: yang na bye brag pa dag na re /
analyzed: yang na bye brag pa dag na re /
translated: Again, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas say:

original: lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la /
analyzed: lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs zhig kyang bdag ni mi 'jig la /
translated: The collection of body, sense faculties, and intellect is not the self,üîΩbut the self is not destroyed.

original: de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa gcig pu yin pas de'i phyir des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung gi /
analyzed: de yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la byed pa po de dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa gcig pu yin pas de'i phyir des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag gis byas pa zhes byar rung gi /
translated: Moreover, in our system, the self is the only thing that is permanent and possesses the action. Therefore, it is correct to say that the suffering created by it is self-created.

original: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de byed pa po de dang ldan pa yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de byed pa po de dang ldan pa yin pas bdag gis byas pa ma yin la /
translated: But in the case of those who say that compounded phenomena are momentary, the suffering that arises in a moment of consciousness is not self-created, because it is not possessed by the creator.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa mi srid bas gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa mi srid bas gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And since it is impossible for one to experience the effects of actions created by another, suffering is not created by another.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer bas de dag la yang /üîΩde ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer bas de dag la yang / de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: This contradicts the statement in the sutra that the self creates suffering.üîΩIt is not tenable that suffering is created.

original: sdug bsngal de ni bya bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de ni bya bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that suffering is created.

original: bdag de dang bcas ba nyid du gnas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag de dang bcas ba nyid du gnas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is undermined by inference in the case of those who maintain that the self is permanent and possesses the action.

original: de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni skyes bu ni byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni skyes bu ni byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is: The person is not an agent,

original: rtag pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: because it is permanent, like space.

original: rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po nyid brtsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po nyid brtsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Since permanence is inferred, the thesis is faulty in that the nature of the subject is refuted by the reason, because the person is an agent, not a non-agent.

original: gzhan yang / gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: Moreover, if it were self-made,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not arise dependently.

original: bdag gi rkyen las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gi rkyen las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not arise from its own conditions,

original: byed pa po ma skyes pa la bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: byed pa po ma skyes pa la bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because it is untenable that an unarisen agent has activity. This is the intended meaning.

original: yang na gal te sdug bsngal byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod na de lta na yang /
analyzed: yang na gal te sdug bsngal byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod na de lta na yang /
translated: Or, if you assert that the self is the experiencer of suffering, then in that case,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not arise dependently.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la sdug bsngal nyid bdag gi @143b sgrar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la sdug bsngal nyid bdag gi @143b sgrar brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: But in our system, the word ‚Äúself‚Äù refers to suffering.

original: yang na gal te skyes bu rang gis las de byas par gyur na /
analyzed: yang na gal te skyes bu rang gis las de byas par gyur na /
translated: Or, if the person himself were to perform that action,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not arise in dependence.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom other causes that are co-originating‚Äù is an ellipsis.

original: sdug bsngal ni byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni byed pa po bdag dang ldan par 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not assert that suffering is possessed by the self that is the agent,

original: rgyu du ma dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu du ma dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is established by many causes.

original: dper na rlung shugs drag po dag gis shing skam po'i yal ga dag bskyod de drud pa las byung ba'i nags kyi mes nags tshal bsreg pa'i las bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na rlung shugs drag po dag gis shing skam po'i yal ga dag bskyod de drud pa las byung ba'i nags kyi mes nags tshal bsreg pa'i las bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: For example, it is like the action of burning a forest by the wind, which is the cause of the fire, and the dry branches, which are the condition of the fire.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi sdug bsngal ni byed pa pos lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi sdug bsngal ni byed pa pos lhas byin gyi bdag dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The inference here is this: Ultimately, the suffering of Devadatta is not possessed by the self of Devadatta, the agent, because it is established by many causes, like the suffering of Devadatta that is produced by the action of Devadatta.

original: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal bzhin no //
translated: Because it is suffering, like the suffering of Yaj√±adatta.

original: gal te mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal skye ba la yang lan 'ga' lhas byin byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mchod sbyin gyi sdug bsngal skye ba la yang lan 'ga' lhas byin byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the arising of the suffering of Yaj√±adatta is not ascertained because Devadatta is the agent,

original: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ba yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that it is not ascertained because the result of the action done by oneself is experienced.

original: de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin na yang byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bong ba la sogs pa dag kyang tha snyad du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos pos de'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin na yang byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bong ba la sogs pa dag kyang tha snyad du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos pos de'i yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Even if it is a transformation of that, since a clod of earth, etc. are not the nature of the agent, they become its parts through the state of being a co-operating cause conventionally. Therefore there is no fault.

original: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de /
analyzed: gang la 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de la ni sems kyi skad cig ma gang la sdug bsngal skye ba de /
translated: For one in whom the formations are momentary and perishable, the moment of mind in which suffering arises

original: byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: byed pa po de dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
translated: is not possessed by that agent.

original: bdag gis byas pa ma yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la yang nyon cig / don dam par ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa ma yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la yang nyon cig / don dam par ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the ultimate sense, suffering is not to be described as created by itself or created by another,

original: de dag mi srid par bstan pa mi gnod do //
analyzed: de dag mi srid par bstan pa mi gnod do //
translated: so the teaching that these two are impossible does not undermine our position.

original: tha snyad du ni 'jig rten na de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni 'jig rten na de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud tha mi dad pa la /
translated: Conventionally, in the world, when a continuum of cause and effect is not different, because it is of the same kind,

original: tha snyad de dag mthong ste /
analyzed: tha snyad de dag mthong ste /
translated: these conventions are seen.

original: dper na bdag gis btsugs pa'i mar me de nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: dper na bdag gis btsugs pa'i mar me de nyid 'di yin no //
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the very lamp I lit,‚ÄùüîΩand ‚ÄúThis is the very mango tree I planted.‚Äù

original: bdag gis bskyed pa'i shing aa mra de nyid 'di yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang sems can gyi skad cig ma snga ma sems can gyi skad cig ma phyi ma dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel ba tha mi dad pas byas pa la bdag gis byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bskyed pa'i shing aa mra de nyid 'di yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang sems can gyi skad cig ma snga ma sems can gyi skad cig ma phyi ma dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel ba tha mi dad pas byas pa la bdag gis byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, here, the previous moment of the sentient being is the later moment of the sentient being, and because the cause and effect are not different, the creation is called ‚Äúcreated by itself.‚Äù

original: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur @144a * //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur @144a * //
translated: Even if they were different, they would not be cause and effect.üîΩ

original: 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: Even if they are different, they are related as cause and effect.

original: sems can gyi skad cig ma snga mas dge ba dang / mi dge ba nye bar bsags pa dag gi rnam par smin pa mi myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi skad cig ma snga mas dge ba dang / mi dge ba nye bar bsags pa dag gi rnam par smin pa mi myong ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the earlier moment of a sentient being does not fail to experience the karmic maturation of the virtue and nonvirtue accumulated by the earlier moment.

original: dper na dug gi mthu 'o ma'i skad cig mar blugs pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba zho'i skad cig mar myong ba bzhin pas ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na dug gi mthu 'o ma'i skad cig mar blugs pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba zho'i skad cig mar myong ba bzhin pas ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the potency of poison is poured into the moment of milk, and its transformation is experienced in the moment of curd. Therefore, one does not encounter the effects of actions not done and the effects of actions done do not expire.

original: ci ste skad cig ma snga mas las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu ni 'du byed kyi skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste skad cig ma snga mas las nye bar bsags pa'i 'bras bu ni 'du byed kyi skad cig ma phyi ma la myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the effect of the karma accumulated by the earlier moment is not experienced in the later moment of the formative factors,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa bzhin no zhe na /üîΩde yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa bzhin no zhe na / de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: it would be like different mindstreams.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' las /
translated: That is not good because the conclusion of activity states:

original: gang la brten nas gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten nas gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on something

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: is not that thing for the time being.

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is not different from that.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause of being different‚Äù is not established.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la sogs pa'i mthu'i khyad par ni skye ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i rgyud la 'bras bur 'gyur bar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la sogs pa'i mthu'i khyad par ni skye ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i rgyud la 'bras bur 'gyur bar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The special power of the prior moment of mind, etc., should be understood as the result in the continuum of the non-arisen antidote to birth.

original: mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na ma du lung ga'i me tog gi ze ba dmar ba bzhin pas tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na ma du lung ga'i me tog gi ze ba dmar ba bzhin pas tha snyad kyi bden pa la gnod pa med do //
translated: Since it is a special power, like the red stamen of the madulla flower, it does not contradict conventional truth.

original: gal te phyogs gzhan gyis las byas pa'i 'bras bu phyogs gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur bas phyogs la ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gzhan gyis las byas pa'i 'bras bu phyogs gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur bas phyogs la ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If the result of karma done in one part of the body is experienced in another part, then the fault arises that one would encounter the result of karma not done in that part and that done would perish.

original: de nyid kyis lan 'ga' yang 'bras bu myong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis lan 'ga' yang 'bras bu myong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, one would never experience the result of karma.

original: phyogs 'brel par brtags na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs 'brel par brtags na yang dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If you examine the relationship, your thesis is undermined.

original: phrad pa dang / 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir dran pa dang shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos ma yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: phrad pa dang / 'du ba dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir dran pa dang shes pa la sogs pa skyes pa dag dngos ma yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
translated: Because contact and union are also related, memory, cognition, etc., which arise from the non-existent thing, are contradicted by the conclusion of your theory.

original: bdag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because of identity,

original: de ji ltar gcig pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar gcig pa nyid yin /
translated: how can they be identical?

original: gcig nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that they are identical because they possess the number one,

original: bdag ni gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: then the self does not possess the number one,

original: yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi grangs dngos bzhin no //
translated: because it exists, like the number one.

original: gcig dang gcig ma yin pa la gcig pa nyid du brtags na yang 'brel pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mi srid pa'i phyir bzang po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig dang gcig ma yin pa la gcig pa nyid du brtags na yang 'brel pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mi srid pa'i phyir bzang po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If you imagine that the one and the non-one are identical, then the relationship is meaningless and is not good, because it is impossible.

original: zhar la bshad pas cho ga ste /
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas cho ga ste /
translated: This is a digression.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sdug @144b bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sdug @144b bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is not asserted that suffering is self-produced.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it produced by another.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩgal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
translated: How so?üîΩIf this is different from that

original: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
translated: and if that is different from this,

original: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
analyzed: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
translated: then since that other would produce this,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur //üîΩgal te sngon gyi phung po de dag las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phung po phyi ma 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur // gal te sngon gyi phung po de dag las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phung po phyi ma 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing /
translated: suffering would be produced by another.üîΩIf the later aggregates that link with these former aggregates were different,

original: gal te 'di dag las kyang sngon gyi phung po de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni de ltar brtag na gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag las kyang sngon gyi phung po de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni de ltar brtag na gzhan de dag gis 'di dag byas pas /
translated: and if these were different from those former aggregates, then if one analyzes in this way, since that other would produce these,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: suffering would be produced by another.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod de gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas de byed pa po nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod de gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas de byed pa po nyid ma yin pas /
translated: But that is unacceptable, because it is not inferred that they are different, and since that other is not a producer,

original: de byed pa po yin pa bstsal bas /
analyzed: de byed pa po yin pa bstsal bas /
translated: it is refuted that it is a producer.

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par dam bcas pa'i dam bca' ba la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par dam bcas pa'i dam bca' ba la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because the assertion that suffering is created by another has the fault of contradicting the nature of things.üîΩMoreover,

original: yang na / gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
analyzed: yang na / gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
translated: If it is created by another,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'thad pas de dag la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni 'thad pas de dag la /
translated: then suffering is created by another.üîΩThis is untenable because

original: gzhan nyid de yang mi srid pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid de yang mi srid pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: it is impossible for them to be different.

original: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: Even if they were different, it would not arise from another, just as it is explained in the Chapter on Non-arising.

original: de las skye ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de las skye ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is impossible for it to arise from another.

original: ji ltar gzhan nyid mi srid par dgongs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan nyid mi srid par dgongs she na /
translated: How is it impossible for them to be different?

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams ni phung po phyi ma rnam pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi sngon gyi phung po rnams ni phung po phyi ma rnam pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the former aggregates of Devadatta are not different from the later aggregates.

original: lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir dper na phung po phyi ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi phung po yin pa'i phyir dper na phung po phyi ma'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the self of Devadatta‚Äôs aggregates, just like the self of his later aggregates.

original: yang na gtan tshigs ni rgyud tha mi dad pa'i sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na gtan tshigs ni rgyud tha mi dad pa'i sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or the reason is because the suffering is not a different continuum.

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The remaining parts of the syllogism are as before.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /üîΩgzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir dang / gang zag gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa / gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mi myong ba'i phyir dang / gang zag gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
translated: Others say:

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin pas /
translated: Because one does not experience the effect of an action done by another, and because the person is different in different situations, suffering is both self-created and created by another.

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, neither of the two positions is faulty.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te gang zag bdag gi ni //üîΩsdug bsngal byas nas gang dag gis //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te gang zag bdag gi ni // sdug bsngal byas nas gang dag gis //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf the person creates his own suffering,

original: sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
translated: then by whom is the suffering of those

original: sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin //
translated: who have no suffering created?

original: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it contradicts your own tenets.

original: gal te gang zag bdag @145a * //
analyzed: gal te gang zag bdag @145a * //
translated: If you imagine that the person

original: gis phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas par rtog na /
analyzed: gis phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal byas par rtog na /
translated: makes suffering that has the characteristics of the five aggregates,

original: gang gis bdag gis sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang zhig yin te /üîΩbdag gi dngos po gang gis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag ces brjod pa /
analyzed: gang gis bdag gis sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang zhig yin te / bdag gi dngos po gang gis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag ces brjod pa /
translated: then what is that person who makes suffering without suffering?

original: sdug bsngal med pa ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa ni //
translated: The person who is called ‚Äúthe one who makes suffering by the entity of self‚ÄùüîΩdoes not exist at all.

original: 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: ci ste yang rang gi lta ba bskyang bar 'dod pas gang zag ni phung po rnams las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du brjod na yang de lta na yang gang zag ni lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang rang gi lta ba bskyang bar 'dod pas gang zag ni phung po rnams las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du brjod na yang de lta na yang gang zag ni lhas byin zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la med par shes par bya ste /
translated: But if you want to maintain your own view and say that the person is not described as the same as or different from the aggregates, then in that case you should understand that the person called Devadatta does not exist in these five aggregates.

original: brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they arise in dependence, like a pot.

original: gal te yod pa nyid 'gog par byed pa'i phyir de ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid 'gog par byed pa'i phyir de ni yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists because it is the negation of existence,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good,

original: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par dpe med pa'i phyir dang / yod pa nyid 'ga' yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par dpe med pa'i phyir dang / yod pa nyid 'ga' yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established by the example, because it is not tenable that anything exists ultimately, and because it is not definite that it is not the primal substance, the person, ƒ™≈õvara, etc., imagined by the heterodox.

original: 'dir yang sngar slob dpon nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar slob dpon nyid kyis /
translated: Here, the master himself has already said:

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If it were created by itself,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not arise in dependence.

original: zhes bya bas sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan pa /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sdug bsngal gyi chos brten nas byung ba nyid yin par bstan pa /
translated: Thus he has taught that the phenomenon of suffering arises in dependence.

original: de'i dbang kho nas rjes su dpag pa bstan to /
analyzed: de'i dbang kho nas rjes su dpag pa bstan to /
translated: He has taught that it is inferred only on the basis of that.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par gang zag ma grub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gang gis kyang bdag gis ma byas par grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par gang zag ma grub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gang gis kyang bdag gis ma byas par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the person is not established ultimately in that way, it is established that no person at all creates suffering.

original: da ni ji ltar gang zag gzhan du 'gyur bas sdug bsngal byas par mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad pa /üîΩgal te gang zag gzhan gyis ni //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar gang zag gzhan du 'gyur bas sdug bsngal byas par mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad pa / gal te gang zag gzhan gyis ni //
translated: Now, it will be explained how it is untenable that suffering is created by another person.üîΩIf suffering is created by another person,

original: sdug bsngal byas na gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas na gzhan zhig gis //
translated: then another person would create

original: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
translated: the suffering that is given to that one.

original: sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung //
translated: But how could that one exist without suffering?

original: gal te gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas nas gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan zhig gis sdug bsngal de byas nas gang las sbyin par bya ba de sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: gal te gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas nas gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan zhig gis sdug bsngal de byas nas gang las sbyin par bya ba de sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung ste /
translated: If suffering is created by another person and that suffering is created by another person who is a different state, then how could that one to whom the suffering is given exist without suffering?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: That is absolutely not the case.

original: gang zag sdug bsngal med pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang zag sdug bsngal med pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is because the person without suffering is refuted and because there is no inference that demonstrates that person‚Äôs existence.

original: da ltar gyi gang zag med pa'i phyir gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gang gi phyir des byas pa gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gang zag med pa'i phyir gnas skabs gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gang gi phyir des byas pa gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: Because the present person does not exist, the difference of another in a different time does not exist. Therefore, how could it be said that ‚Äúthat which is produced by that is produced by another‚Äù?

original: yang gzhan yang /üîΩ@145b sngar rjes su dpag pa las sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / @145b sngar rjes su dpag pa las sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover,üîΩsince it has already been demonstrated through inference that suffering is not self-produced, therefore:

original: bdag gis byas par ma grub pas //
analyzed: bdag gis byas par ma grub pas //
translated: Suffering is not established as self-produced.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
translated: How could suffering be produced by another?

original: ma byas pa la gzhan gyi tha snyad mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ma byas pa la gzhan gyi tha snyad mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the designation ‚Äúproduced by another‚Äù is impossible if it is not produced.

original: yang na rgyud so sor nges pa la las rnam par smin pa can gzhan gyis byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rgyud so sor nges pa la las rnam par smin pa can gzhan gyis byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it is impossible for another to produce the karma that ripens in a particular continuum,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas zhes gsungs te /
translated: how could suffering be produced by another?

original: de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is untenable that suffering is produced by self or by another.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
translated: Whatever suffering others inflict

original: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
translated: would be self-produced for him.

original: gnas skabs gzhan tha dad du zin kyang gang zag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan tha dad du zin kyang gang zag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although the states are different, the person is not different.

original: de lta bas na bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya ba de dag ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya ba de dag ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúself-produced‚Äù and ‚Äúproduced by another‚Äù are untenable.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: gang zag gi bdag gis byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag gis byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the person is the self,

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
translated: suffering is self-produced.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because the person is not the suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te /

original: de ltar rnam grangs las bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam grangs las bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Thus, because it is established by way of enumeration that suffering is produced by self and by another, there is no error.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
translated: First, suffering is not self-produced.

original: gang zag gi bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means it is not produced by the self of the person.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gang zag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir gang zag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //

original: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo yin na yang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo yin na yang /
translated: Even if it were the essence of suffering,

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba de bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas dgongs so//
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas dgongs so//
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.üîΩOr,

original: yang na / de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
analyzed: yang na / de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
translated: it would not be produced by itself

original: zhes bya ba ni rang la bya ba byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / bdag las skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin du nges byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang la bya ba byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / bdag las skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin du nges byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because it is not seen to perform an action on itself, and because it is not tenable that it is produced from itself, just as it is not tenable that it is produced by another.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir des byas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te zhes gang smras pa de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir des byas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te zhes gang smras pa de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that if suffering is produced by that, it is produced by another, because that which is suffering is not a person.

original: gal te gzhan dag ma nyes na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag ma nyes na //
translated: If another is not at fault,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could suffering be created by another?

original: pha rol po dag gis gzhan nyid du bsams pa gang yin pa de gal te bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid ma skyes kyang yod par gyur na ni des ni de gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir @146a * //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis gzhan nyid du bsams pa gang yin pa de gal te bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid ma skyes kyang yod par gyur na ni des ni de gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir @146a * //
translated: If that which is thought by others to be another, that which is not created by the self, and that which is not born as the self, exists, then because it is established as another,

analyzed: des byas pa yang gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur grang na /
translated: that which is created by that would be created by another.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni ma skyes pa yod pa nyid du mi ston pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni ma skyes pa yod pa nyid du mi ston pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: But the wise do not teach that what is unborn exists. Therefore how could suffering be created by another?

analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //

analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang ; gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so //

original: grangs can dag ni rdul shas che bas bya ba byed pa'i 'jug pa de dag dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: grangs can dag ni rdul shas che bas bya ba byed pa'i 'jug pa de dag dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the function of the activity of the predominance of rajas is suffering.

original: de yang gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, because the internal agents are the self, therefore the self possesses agents.üîΩBecause the internal agents are different from the nature of the person, therefore the self possesses other agents.

translated: Therefore, the suffering created by them is created by self and other.

analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces /

original: phung po skad cig smra ba yis //
analyzed: phung po skad cig smra ba yis //
translated: The proponents of momentary aggregates

analyzed: sh'akya pa dag bdag med na ; / mtho ris thar pa dgos pa yi //
translated: say that if the self does not exist,üîΩthe striving of the ≈öƒÅkyas for

analyzed: 'bad pa don med nyid du 'gyur // phung po snga mar gtogs pa yi //
translated: heaven and liberation would be pointless.üîΩThe virtuous karma that belongs to

analyzed: kun du 'byung bar 'dod mod kyi //

analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gzhan don du //

analyzed: 'bad pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te // gzhan la phan par bya bar ni //
translated: And effort would be untenable.

original: 'ga' yang 'jug par mi byed do //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod do //
translated: And so on.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //

original: skyes bus so //
analyzed: skyes bus so //

analyzed: gal te nang gi byed pas byas so zhe na /

analyzed: nang gi byed pa rdul shas che ba de ni sdug bsngal yin pas sdug bsngal de nyid kyis de nyid byed par mi 'thad de /

translated: Because the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is used in many senses,

analyzed: dper na zan byas so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: like ‚Äúfood is made.‚Äù

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar @146b gzhan zhes bya ba bdag nyid ma grub pas /
translated: Therefore, since that which is called ‚Äúother‚Äù is not established as itself,

analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could suffering be made by another?

original: yang na gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: skyes bu ni nang gi byed pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: a person is not other than the inner agent,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nang gi byed pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do ;
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nang gi byed pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do ;
translated: because he is a thing, like the inner agent‚Äôs own self. Thus, this contradicts his own inference.

original: / gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas /
analyzed: / gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas /
translated: Since it is not established as other,üîΩthe person is not the experiencer of the effect of the inner agent.

original: sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis de bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis de bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la //
translated: Therefore, the person is not the experiencer of suffering.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon yang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon yang yod do zhe na /
translated: There is also the fault of the reversal of the intrinsic reality of things.

original: de lta na yang sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so //
translated: Even so, it is not logical that suffering is self-produced or produced by another.

original: rnam gnyis su smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: rnam gnyis su smra ba dag na re /
translated: The proponents of the two-fold origination say,

original: 'o na rnam grangs las /
analyzed: 'o na rnam grangs las /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, in the Enumeration of Faculties,

original: sdug bsngal ni gnyi gas byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni gnyi gas byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: it says, ‚ÄòBecause suffering is produced by both, there is no fault.‚ÄôüîΩ‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To refute that, it is said:

original: gal te re res byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te re res byas gyur na //
translated: If it were produced by each,

original: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
translated: suffering would be produced by both.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas bdag gis byas pa dang ; gzhan gyis byas pa mi rigs pa de'i tshe gnyis gas byas so zhes bya ba'i skabs med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas bdag gis byas pa dang ; gzhan gyis byas pa mi rigs pa de'i tshe gnyis gas byas so zhes bya ba'i skabs med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: When it is not logical that suffering is produced by itself or by another, as has been demonstrated, then it is impossible to say that it is produced by both.

original: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It also does not originate without a cause,

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir rab tu byed par rgyu med par smra ba bstsal bas /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir rab tu byed par rgyu med par smra ba bstsal bas /
translated: because it does not arise. In the treatise Differentiating the Middle and the Extremes, the proponent of causelessness is refuted.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
translated: Not produced by another, not produced by itself,

original: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could suffering arise causelessly?

original: gzhan gyis byas pa ni gzhan gyis de byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa ni gzhan gyis de byas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúProduced by another‚Äù means that it is produced by that other.

original: gzhan gyis byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is produced by another.

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot produced by itself‚Äù means that it is not produced by itself.

original: bdag gis byas pa yang bdag gis de byas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa yang bdag gis de byas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúProduced by itself‚Äù means that it is produced by that itself.

original: bdag gis byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gis byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is produced by itself.

original: bdag gis ma byas pa ni bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ma byas pa ni bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot produced by itself‚Äù means that it is not produced by itself.

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis ma byas pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis ma byas pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNot produced by another‚Äù and ‚Äúnot produced by itself‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis mi byed pa dang / bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi byed pa dang / bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
translated: mean that it is not produced by another and that it is not produced by itself.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad smos pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir don dam par sdug bsngal dmigs su med pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad smos pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir don dam par sdug bsngal dmigs su med pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: When suffering is not ultimately observed because it is undermined by the valid cognition that has been presented, how could suffering arise causelessly?

original: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad sdug bsngal mi srid pas pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad sdug bsngal mi srid pas pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, since all aspects of suffering are impossible in that way, the opponent says in the first chapter of his treatise, ‚ÄúUltimately, the aggregates exist.‚Äù
